Reviews.Title: “Incredible view + not great Kowloon location”
Reviews.Author: pricklypoppy
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 3 nights. We booked the room through their website at an early booking rate. We stayed in Room 1610. It had a king bed facing the large window. The view was breathtaking (see photos). I'm not sure I would stay here again because I didn't care for the location. Likes View Immaculate, new and fresh Nice white linens Stocked fridge, everything free Stylish lobby Wonderful aromatherapy scent in public spaces Great bathroom amenities, especially liked the green toothbrush Front desk service was friendly and helpful Casual staff dress Good food, 3 choices of restaurants + room service Quiet Beautiful pool Dislikes Location was out of the way on the Kowloon side, couldn't walk to any points of interest Clientele was noisy and poorly dressed Shower flooded bathroom floor Shuttle was not convenient, overcrowded and hot Slow elevators Overpriced spa

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Hong Kong hotel”
Reviews.Author: casa360
Reviews.Content: I have made over 100 trips to Hong Kong and know the hotels pretty well. Kowloon is more convenient for me to stay as it is close to my business, and I have been staying at the Regent/Intercontinental for 20 years. With all of the construction, i decided to try some of the new hotels in Kowloon the last couple of trips. A couple of months back, I took my wife to the new Ritz-Carlton, which we enjoyed. This trip, based on the great Tripadvisor reviews, I decided to try the Icon. I will start with my only negative, which is the location. It is right in TST east, which for some people may be fun, but it is a bit too far east for my taste. It is near the train station and the museum, so for some people that would be a plus. The people working at this hotel were terrific. they are all quite young and a little less formal than is normal in Hong Kong. The feel was more "California" than the stiff formality of Hong Kong. i found that refereshing. The rooms was very nice. brand new, great bed and pillows. I stayed on the club floor, which was a great choice as they have a GREAT breakfast buffet at The Market restaurant. The pool is very cool and there are always a lot of people hanging out at the pool and pool bar. I probably would not have stayed at this hotel had i not seen the tripadvisor reviews. so THANKS TO ALL. you really cant go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “a real 5*”
Reviews.Author: niallp
Reviews.Content: I really felt like I was staying at a 5*. From the minute we checked in - we were very early so waited in a very comfortable lounge with free coffee, drinks, movies etc. The room was fantastic - amazing view and excellent features. The rooftop pool was amazing as was the gym. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Markali95”
Reviews.Author: markali95
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, a big thank you to Tripadvisor and their reviewers,otherwise we would not have heard about Hotel Icon The hotel has been designed to have the best/most appropriate of everything The rooms are perfect,we had the 80 Suite for 5 nights,the view amazing,the decor sublime,even the glass in the bathroom seemed to be designed specifically Above and beyond ,great place for breakfast,predinner drinks Yes ,its tied to the Hong Kong Polytechnic,but the staff are soooo attentive,helped or guided by some pretty impressive executive staff who know exactly how they want to see a hotel run I would not think to say anywhere else,the supposed weakness is its off the normal trail BUT,incredibly well run shuttle service alleviates any issues The shuttle runs every 20 minutes and puts you at Harbour City ,a huge shopping centre ,30 odd restaurants and near the Ferries and also drops you at the MRT station If in Hong Kong,think of The Icon

Reviews.Title: “Best hotelProblematic location”
Reviews.Author: Rando686
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel.. Room are big and very comfortable. The service is also very good.. My problem was that I got city view club 36 room on the 12th floor.. And. The room is facing the cross hurbur tunnel and I could hear the cars and the noises of the toll gates... Anyway... I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a training hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torontoshanghai
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on the club floor, room is great with all the wants and needs you may ever had. The rooms are the best feature of the hotel. The majority of the staff are trainees and it shows. From the bellboys to servers in the restaurants they lack experience and passion of doing a good job. This is not 5 star service but hit and miss from students of the college that owns the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: corob1
Reviews.Content: Had two stays in the last month - one for three days and another for six. We stayed in the Harbour view rooms and had access to the 38th floor club area. The view at night was amazing - sitting up in bed (with pillows of your choice) looking at the harbour and the lights of Hong Kong. The breakfast was stunning as were the afternnon teas, cocktail drinks, etc etc. The hotel offered regular bus rides to the Star ferry and the underground and buses are pretty convenient. Also had a good pool and gym. Loved the artwork throughout the hotel and the vertical garden. We were blown away by the service - especially Edith Tang who helped us find items that we wanted to buy. She was attentive and made sure all our desires were catered for. Very impressive service. We ate well in the hotel but also got to try some special places in the area and on the island. Very special time. Thanks for recommending it. The reviews were spot on - I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Nsingapore
Reviews.Content: We flew to Hong Kong for the weekend on a list minute decision, I researched hotel options and was drawn to Hotel ICON and let me tell you we were not disappointed. We were booked into a Suite so we got special check in at Level 28 where Above and Beyond is, this is where their club facilities are and its fantastic. Great food for breakfast and for cocktails which i might add is actually cocktails. Our room was big and what you would expect from a suite, There was fresh fruit a free minibar which got replenished every day of our stay. The view from our room was spectacular with views of Hong Kong Island. We also had a great view of the light show which takes place every night at 8 pm. Facilities in the room were good, I love the huge bath with the television on the wall. The service in this hotel is like none I have ever experienced even in 5 star hotels, staff were friendly, courteous, helpful and always smiling. Excellent value for money also. We would definitely stay at Hotel ICON when we next return to HK . Many thanks for a wonderful weekend Hotel ICON.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and practical”
Reviews.Author: apkt
Reviews.Content: like other reviewers, we were nothing but impressed. we stayed in one of the harbor view 38 rooms, which we found was efficiently designed and more than fully equipped. who would have imagined that a standard room is equipped with a nespresso, bose speakers with an ipod dock and even a printer? although we found hong kong island more attractive to visit, we definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in kowloon. we had one small issue, though. located a little off the city center, the hotel runs a complementary shuttle every 20 minutes. convenient as it is, the service is under-advertised. it took us a while to notice that the schedule was projected on a small screen near the elevators. subsequently upon request, bell staff gave us a brochure that includes the schedule, route and drop-off/pick-up spots. I wish such useful information were provided in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shaone
Reviews.Content: Good location, great price ,amazing view Perfect spot for a great view of the HK skyline service excellent. Pool good but only morning and early afternoon. Would stay again. Concierge very helpful and knowledgeable

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and service we have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Yoli K
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and truly experienced what we felt was the best service and quality of furnishings of any hotel we have EVER stayed in. Not exaggerating. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, they know how to sort out whatever we requested, and had great suggestions for our tourism requests (including finding out where we could go windsurfing in Hong Kong...!). We ate in all 3 of the cafe/restaurants and found the food to be of excellent quality. The sommelier at Above and Beyond was particularly memorable for his choice and explanation of wines. Great for tea and cake in Green, the ground floor cafe, while gazing up at the plant wall. And of all this served in the most stylish hotel in Hong Kong. And the pool looking out over the harbour, and our stunning room views of the hotel night skyline were unbeatable. Beats any of the mainstream 5 star hotels, which look so dated and garish by comparison. The influence of Terence Conran is all around. Stlye to the max. We LOVED our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sophiemlish
Reviews.Content: Travelled to HK in June/July 2012 for seven days, from the very start of our holiday Hotel Icon looked after us, from the observant door boys who always had an umbrella on hand, to the view from our lovely room. I wouldn't pay for the Above and Beyond service, the panoramic bar is okay but the food in the restaurant is pricey and average. Also the room service food was packaged (eg. The calamari and the club sandwhich wasn't up to par) but they are small issues in the whole! Take advantage of the free shuttle! I'd suggest a room with harbour views definitely and try to stick to the higher levels as the view is better! The check out service is very civilized and the use of a lounge and facilities is very good for the late night flights . Will definitely be back (this year in fact) Hotel Icon being the main reason to return to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lived up to my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Ethan T
Reviews.Content: With so many good hotel choices in Hong Kong, I relied on tripadvisor to help me pick out the right hotel for our 3-day stay. Hotel Icon more than lived up to its high mark on this site. I booked a basic Club 36 Harbour with a pre-arrival request of high floor to celebrate my first trip with girlfriend. We arrived early, they assisted us with early check in and kindly upgraded us to a Club 38 Harbour View on the 26th (out of 27) floor. We couldn't be happier with our stay. The view from our hotel room is spectacular and unforgettable when shared with your loved one. There's no need to mention hotel's hardware or clealiness as they are the basic prerequisite for a hotel to be rated so highly. Location of this hotel also makes walking in the city a fun thing to do. I love its space design, furniture choice, and lighting design. I will definitely recommend Hotel Icon to all my friends and family for their stay in HK!!

Reviews.Title: “Top boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M
Reviews.Content: Very nice and modern hotel, that was just opened when i stayed there, so the whole hotel was sparkling! The view from the pool at night looking out on the laser sjow was magnifique, and the club bar that was included in the price for a mini svite(80m2) was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelledl
Reviews.Content: Excellent service in this hotel while checking in and asking questions at the reception. The check in was quick and the concierge very helpful. The breakfast has an excellent selection. The only thing is when you get up to get food they do not check if you have left and reset the table and give it to another guest.....A little too eager. The breakfast room is cramped. The rooms are spacious and very chic. The drinks in the mini bar are free which is always a plus. The location of the hotel is near to the harbour and many great attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - Really loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: whykiki90
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay here - we were in Hong Kong for a week and Hotel Icon and its staff lived up to the tripadvisor hype in every way. We stayed in an Icon 38 room and also had the last couple of nights in an Club 80 suite - to be honest we would have been so happy to stay in the Icon 38 room on a relatively high floor - it was snug but extremely comfortable. Great size bed & crisp linen, complementary mini bar is a nice touch, powerful shower with lashings of hot water, petit but deep bath tub, black out curtains.... We had club level access for the last couple of nights which was fun, their breakfast was delicious and the drinks hour with free champagne was a great start to going out later. Free wifi throughout the hotel, nice size pool and incredibly helpful staff. We probably didn't need the extra space of the Club 80 suite for the last couple of nights but the bathtub with the views over the harbour was pretty special! We did spend a bit of time heading back over onto Hong Kong Island in taxis, but that was really the only thing we would possibly have changed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon - A very groovy hotel”
Reviews.Author: chanalis
Reviews.Content: To sum up and make it easy... Travel Purpose: We were staying in HK for a week, and wanted to try this hotel on the last night, so we have a reference for another hotel in HK Location: not so good. HK is a very safe place, but you cant help feeling the seedy side of things in east TST area. Saying that if you want to catch the bars and more night life in TST the place to be. Price: We have to say it is up there with other high standard hotel, which it deserves to be, but for us we would rather stay at another place based on location Cleanliness Overall exceptionally clean, with it being a new hotel it was expected, but i am sure the staff aim to maintain that Other points: very friendly staff breakfast was nice, with a good variety (some halal options is you are interested). It was 198HKD per person free internet, woop woop Swimming pool and gym are very cool. The pool is on the 9th floor, so while you swim you see really are up there over seeing HK, and feeling like the master of the universe (well, maybe his accountant) Restaurants - They have a few restaurants, unfortunately we did not try them (other than the breakfast place) but they did look interesting View - As mentioned from the pool and the rooms, the view of HK is pretty sweet!! Conclusion: It did win the trip advisor 2012 award, and deserves it. They are a very cool hotel and glad we stayed there, but I dont know if we would stay again unless the rates were very competitive and simply because of location. Little tip - What we thought was very cool was a place that if you are checking out but have alate flight, or arrive early, there is a room you can sit and chill out in...nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter79CH
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this really nice hotel and we really enjoyed it. We booked an "harbour view" room that had a great view on Hong Kong Island. It was so nice that we slept without closing the curtains to enjoy the view from the bed! The room was clean and well equipped, the people working there were very professional but what we really enjoyed was the outside swimming pool on the 9th floor with also a great view on the harbour. The swimming pool is a "must have" in Hong Kong as the temperatures are usually high with humide climate. So, it is very pleasant to swim in the morning or at the end of the afternoon to relax and to get colder. We also enjoyed the well-equipped fitness room beside the swimming pool, again with a great view. For sure, we would recommend this hotel that offers a good price for the quality you get in return.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertH16
Reviews.Content: The hotel more than lived up to expectations. Stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel is very stylish with nice art and decor. Staff very friendly and willing to please. A big surprise was a birthday cake that arrived unannounced- a nice attention to detail. I booked the "Club" upgrade and it proved to be a very good decision. The perks associated with it are well worth the a extra cost. The breakfasts at Above and Beyond we're excellent as were the cocktails. Breakfasts at the Market Place had a good variety of Eastern and Western food. Pool deck has spectacular views of the harbor. The Hung Hom station is a 5 minute walk which makes intra-city travel easy.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ric W
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights. Harbour View room. Everything was first class. The Above and Beyond Restaurant on level 27 is World Class and still at reasonable prices. Special mention to Aidan on the door who found my lost wife and got my excess luggage home. There is nothing to fault in this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: crazymonkey50
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor - very interesting hotel Staff are very well trained and eager to assist 3 areas to eat We loved all of them and )surprise) not overpriced food and bev Beautiful bathrooms We paid $440 aust for 2 nights

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: artecerca
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice, shuttle bus to ferry, just since the lobby is small and smart they try to maintain you sitted and there is somebody there like trying to make you go as soon as possible, I found concierge a little impatient not willing to do many suggestions... we missed our flight and could not arrive the first night but we called to notify, would have expected a note or a drink or something as a consideration since they could not refund... just a detail...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: David065
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. The hotel was great - in a fantastic location close to lots of restaurants and only 5 minutes from Hung Hom MTR station. Staff were friendly and helpful. The WiFi was a bit tricky to first get connected but once on worked fantastically on all our computers/iPads. Easy to get to from the Airport Express using the free shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janeaus
Reviews.Content: Hotel icon was fantastic, I stayed on my own as a stopover on the way home from London. I was initially booked into another hotel but then found hotel Icon website and changed to this hotel. I am so glad I did, every aspect of the hotel was amazing. There were always plenty of staff on hand to help out with any questions, the breakfast in the Market was amazing, the pool lovely, views fantastic and the cocktails at the above and beyond lounge made having a club room worth every cent. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have slept in at a hotel. If you stay you must also visit the day spa, the therapists are fantastic and my facial / massage was worth every cent. I will be recommending this hotel to all my traveling friends. Don't worry about the location of the hotel, it is a pleasant walk into town and the hotel also has a free shuttle bus every 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Of My Life”
Reviews.Author: Lionel888
Reviews.Content: This hotel while still very new has taken a lot of time to understand the detail required to make your stay faultless. I have stayed here twice in a month with my young son and husband and look forward to staying again soon. The hotel restaurant Above and Beond is excellent worth a visit and Green is great for an easy night in with very comfortable suurounds when travelling with a child. The staff are also lovely and can read your style dialling up the attitude or running with a relaxed approach which was great. We booked both times a harbour club room which i strongly reccommend worth the extra $$. The late check out lounge is so thoughtful and something I have never seen in any other hotel. We have travelled to almost 50 countries and have travelled reguarly each year and this is our best hotel experience ever which is an amazing accolade for the ICON. We are in our late 30's and the only thing i wished the ICON did was to have a return visitor rewards club as i know we will be back and i know i will reccommend to friends and family. This is my first review for tripadvisor even though i use this website regularly because i want many people to experience tlhe ICON

Reviews.Title: “i'm definitely coming back”
Reviews.Author: NLY39739
Reviews.Content: Yep, next time I go to Hong Kong I will stay at this hotel again. Let's begin! 1. Lobby was bright and airy, full of natural light. Cool decorations with live plants on the wall. The doormen were very welcoming and attentive to your needs. Very trendy and modern! 2. Check-in was swift. Upon arrival, my partner and I were brought to the 28th floor for a private check-in because we booked the Club room. We were personally escorted from the lobby to the 28th floor. Excellent! The gentleman who assisted us explained everything regarding the benefits of staying in the Club room, double checked our personal information, etc. All very nice and professional 3. The room was the Club 80 Suite. What can I say... it's just amazing. I can't fault anything. The amenities, the furniture, the finishing detail, the bed... and the view. Wow! Mind Blowing! The view over Central was just so beautiful we decided to leave the curtains open all night because the windows allowed for a panoramic view. To wake up and watch the sun rises from such height (we stayed on the 20th floor) set the good mood for the whole day. The master bathroom with big bath tub, raindrop shower, and massive window was also very much appreciated. We can take everything from the mini-bar,the cookies jar, mineral water bottles that were available everywhere. The wi-fi signal was also very strong. Big closet, ironing board, massive HD TV. Where do I stop now? :) 4. Swimming pool is awesome too. While it's not olympic size, it's nicely heated and just the right size to have a quick dip. the view was again.. AMAZING! the gym was equipped with complete equipments and very well-maintained. 5. We could choose to have breakfast either at the Above & Beyond Club on the 28th floor or at the Market on the 2nd floor. We chose to have breafkast at the Market and we were satisfied. Food was good and abundant. Quality is also good! 6. We had the chance to try the happy hour on the 28th floor. Drinks were plenty and the finger foods available while not much tasted good!! 7. The staff are young. Later on I found out many of them are still doing their internships from a nearby university. They all speak English very well, very attentive, informative, and very friendly. 8. The hotel is easily reached from the airport. There are so many options one can choose to reach the hotel. We chose to take the Airport Express to Kowloon Station and from there we took the K3 shuttle bus. All in all, it took us about 1 hour to reach the hotel and vice versa. 9. The TST east MTR station is not as close to the hotel as I thought. It takes a good 10 minutes to walk to the station. Actually it's faster to take the taxi to go to Central because the tunnel that connects Kowloon and Hong Kong Island is just behind the hotel. All in all, we are two happy guests. We will definitely come back to this hotel! This hotel succeeded in making our 1 day stopover in Hong Kong very memorable

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever imagined!”
Reviews.Author: MicallefC
Reviews.Content: I'm not usually one to write reviews but this hotel is worthy of one. Friendly staff nothing is too much trouble Breakfast is yummy! Everything u could imagine u could have at breakfast they have even a full on bread store Free cocktails and cheese plates on the top floor bar Free mini bar wasn't expecting it to have much in it but it's stocked full we have hardly made a mark on it Before bed u can have sleepy tea and macaroons delivered Great views Staff help with non English speaking taxi drivers and taxis are cheap so we have just used them to whole time The restaurant above and beyond has the best Peking duck we have ever had for reasonable prices too

Reviews.Title: “Casual chic and great service”
Reviews.Author: ajk1966
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to add to the previous reviews if not to confirm that you can't beat the price/quality ratio of the Icon. Some other plus. Complimentary wifi in the shuttle bus (!!) A lounge with tv, chaise longue and free beverage for guests waiting their evening flight. A brilliant solution to the late check out need. If you plan to have breakfast at the Market take advantage of the prepaid package for a 20% discount. The only minor detail is there are not much cereals options displayed. I.e. no corn flakes. But if you ask they'll bring it at your table. Dinner at Green is good.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish design hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: EJK80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and was impressed with the size of the room (for Hong Kong), the amenities and helpfulness of staff. The location is convenient - there is a shuttle bus to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station (or very cheap taxi ride) with lots of shopping and restuarants nearby. Less convenient if you have business on Hong Kong island, as traffic is heavy to get across. The room was great for business - big desk, good lighting, lots of power points, including international adapter and super fast wi-fi (not always a given in Hong Kong hotels). The ambience in the lobby is great and staff were more than happy to help with any requests. The gym and pool are great facilities and has a fantastic view. I particularly enjoyed The Market restaurant for breakfast. What an amazing selection of food. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sd_growingpains
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Location is good. Free in-room wifi and mini bar soft drinks. Good value. Try buffet at The market hotel restaurant, which is very famous. 400+ HK$ for lunch and 500+ for dinner. Don't forget to reserve beforehand. Just oppoiste the hotel, there are also lots of restaurants. We tried 太兴，just opposite the hotel on the right, and 靓靓车仔面, both in the 新文华 building opposite the hotel gate。 History and science museum, and the harbour, all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolm37
Reviews.Content: New trendy Hotel Fantastic friendly staff excellent service and help with advise 23rd floor corner King harbour view room was breathtaking Free wifi, free minbar with beer and softdrinks and snacks Coffee machine and kettle plus printer. TV in bathroom above bath Tub Great amenities. safe, iron etc Highly recommend walking distance to shops and resturants also have free hotel shuttle to train station or ferry or the taxi is about $5.00

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: spjwstaines
Reviews.Content: My wife has lived in HK twice in her life and I wanted to take her back for a birthday treat. I read the reviews and gave Hotel Icon a try. We were not disappointed. This is an excellent hotel; good location, excellent staff, stylish feel, large rooms and good food. What more could we need. Before arrival I exchanged a number of emails to get our bookng right. Daisy, one of the guest services staff, was particularly good - she met all of my requests cheerfully and exactly. It was my wife's birthday during our stay and a nice cake and signed card arrived on the day. The staff are very good. They're not overbearing at all but just respond to your requests cheerfully and quickly. My advice to other travellers would be to book a Club65 room. They're excellent; very large, peaceful and the use of the club lounge is well worth the expense - afternoon tea, cocktails etc. I'm sure there are better views from other hotels; but, the one from our room was a perfect picture of the harbour. The only slight negative, and it is very slight, was a meal at Above & Beyond. We had dinner there one evening and, whilst it was perfectly acceptable, it wasn't as good as we had been led to believe it would be. It felt pretty standard actually. So, would we stay here again? Most definitely. Next time we visit HK, and it will be soon as this is a great city, then there is only be place in which we will stay - the Hotel Icon.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Pranab D
Reviews.Content: Expectations are high when it comes to Asia. And the Icon has surpassed all our expectations. From a very convenient lounge on the 9th floor to freshen up [if you have an early flight and have to wait for your room] to a room upgrade to accommodate some of my needs. Very polite and helpful staff from the reception to the concierge to the front door. At every point of contact I was pleasantly surprised by their willingness to go the extra mile. Their courtesy shuttle bus is great and it has free wifi. In fact wifi is complimentary all over the hotel for multiple gadgets. The only meal we had in room was very good and the service prompt. The room has many nice touches. The Bose audio system for your iPhone, the heavenly bathroom, the smart TV... They even have a printer in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive modern base with stunning views”
Reviews.Author: Kitty1980Midlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first night travelling in Asia. We were upgraded to a room with a stunning view of the harbour. Our room was large and spacious with a very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was lovely with a deep sunken bath, and separate shower. Room was decorated in a modern cool contemporary style, topped off by floor to ceiling windows overlooking Hong Kong. Staff were friendly and service was excellent. Based in Kowloon, its not far. From the ferry terminal to take you across the river. All in all an excellent hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and inviting attention from all staff....”
Reviews.Author: Meryll W
Reviews.Content: Coming back to visit Hong Kong after more than 12 years, we wondered how us Westerners would be received this time. I am happy to report that the locals were unfailingly helpful and welcoming, no matter where we were. The Hotel and all it's staff certainly made sure we were well looked after whatever our question or request. Thanks to the helpful Concierge -Cody, we found our way into areas we never would have discovered out at Mong Kok. What I am really trying to say is that everyone working in this new hotel has a great attitude and we are happy to have experienced the result of the training given at the HK hotel Management School who own and run the place. We wil certainly come back, and have already recommended it to friends. Well done. Ps. Love the design, architecture, and wall garden.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay”
Reviews.Author: ZoeHolidayUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent level of service, staff very attentive, helpful and efficient. Used free hotel shuttle on a number of occasions down to harbour side and back. Enjoyed walking around local area and ate both at the hotel's Market restaurant and also in some of the nearby cafes and noodle restaurants - both were great. Caught the MTR train from airport to Kowloon and K3 free shuttle bus from there to hotel - on return to airport took a taxi direct from outside hotel(which the hotel staff hailed for us), for two adults + baby + luggage....the cost was similar (approx 130 HK dollars per adult) Great pool / gym / cafe area too. Would absolutely recommend hotel for visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Service second to none”
Reviews.Author: Carole T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were delighted with the standard of the room, and the attentive staff were very helpful without being obtrusive. The check in and check out processes were painless and other hotels would bear witness to the rarity of this level of helpfulness and quiet efficiency. The shower and bathroom facilities were great, and the free mini bar is a sensible idea, if limited to a few items. We had dinner one evening on the 28th floor, and the food there was of good quality and with fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid2007
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here, with one small exception. When I went to the top floor bar/cafe to take in the view and have a mid-morning coffee, I was awkwardly told that I was not welcome. Apparently, it is for "executives" only, even though the restaurant that adjoins it is not. This policy was not apparent to me, and was not handled at all well by the staff, who basically told me to go away (albeit politely). Other hotel staff were all very friendly and polite (not always the case in China, I have found), so that came as a welcome relief to me. The hotel itself is ultra-modern in style (if you like that), clean, slick, well-maintained and professionally run. Location is good (in Kowloon, on Mainland side, rather than on the Island) in downtown. Good value for money and strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel like NO other”
Reviews.Author: Wayneepops
Reviews.Content: Hotel ICON has essentially been able to get all the basics right. Their staff meet every challenge with the professionalism, helpfulness and friendliness that only other hotels would envy and wish they could match within the very short period of eighteen months since the hotel's soft opening. The awards they have achieved since their doors first opened are a testimony and recognition of this achievement. Hotel ICON IS a hotel like no other. It's my hotel of choice in a city renown for it's hotel. Positive accolades abound, I hope this will never prevent me from being unable to secure a room in the future. Thank you Richard, Hotel ICON's General Manager, and your team of dedicated professionals ofor making my stay once again an outstanding one. Your eager, fresh young team displays enthusiasm and maturity beyond my expectation. Thank you Thomas, Hotel ICON's Chief Concierge, and your team for working your magic in achieving all my requests outside the hotel with a minimal of fuss. I look forward to my return in the very near future without reservations. Dare I say, I might just walk in the front door unannounced and see if that the challenge of accommodating me exceeds even this discerning traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TY99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Icon for one night while we were waiting for a flight the next day. This is a teaching hotel so we expected the staff to be on their best behaviour, and we were not disappointed. The service is non-intrusive and helpful when needed. We stayed in a partial harbour-view room. The view is not really worth the difference in price, as we were looking out over rooftops full of A/C units and, in the distance, a small portion of the harbour was visible. The room is clean and full of modern touches. It was nice to see all the toiletries and other items they provided for convenience (and relatively a lot of travel sized stationary type items). The bed was comfortable and the shower (with a big rain head) was very enjoyable. While lit using modern lighting features (e.g., backlit mirrors), I found the bathroom to be very dark. The lobby is a nice space and we enjoyed hearing about the wall garden from the staff. The location of this hotel is not particularly convenient. It's a long walk (15 minutes) to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station, or a minimum fare taxi ride. It is on the airport shuttle route so it's convenient to go to and from the airport via the Kowloon MTR/Airport Express station.

Reviews.Title: “The essential satisfaction of any needs in HK”
Reviews.Author: Tommaso R
Reviews.Content: New, minimal and trendy Hotel with a winning price quality ratio. This is Icon hotel, built on a nice position looking at the bay on the south east side of Kowloon, just a short walk to the Star Ferry and the main shopping area. Rooms are spacious, very modern, fully equipped and with pleasant bathroom. Beds are exceptionally confortable. The swimming pool on a terrace at the 9th floor is something faboulous, looking at the landscape of Hong Kong bay and resembling a set of a sci-fi movie Imagine to see in a limited space a futuristic ensamble given by the pool itself, the structure of the skyscraper, the fully equpped gym room and the bar behind wide and shining crystal windows and the open air showers creating a rain effect at the entrance gate of the terrace. Wonderful !! There is also on the same floor an high level Spa with the top quality brand of Angsana. Obviously enough expensive. But what makes Icon oustanding is the quality of service given by a number of very well educated young front end employees ready to satisfy any your needs with a smile. Furthermore you can take a fantastic breakfast in The Market restaurant, a very wide ambiance splitted in different areas with a tematic culinary profile where you can taste food of different origins (chinese, european, jewish, and so on). Othe two restaurants very trendy are remarkable with a particular mention given to the restaurant looking the Hong Kong skyline at the 28th floor (Beyond and above) with a cared set of a la cart chinese dishes.. You can find easily good offers foe this outstanding hotel at an affordable price that make it surely a winning option for any stay in Hong Kong. Beyond and above the Luxury there is the essential satisfaction of any needs.

Reviews.Title: “Love it all the way”
Reviews.Author: Nickster121
Reviews.Content: A +++++ Probably the best hotel one can stay in when visiting HK on business or private. The pool is unreal and probably the best in all of HK. The breakfast market is unbelievably awesome, and so is above and beyond for drinks or even dinner. Loved it and can only highy recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Underpriced luxury”
Reviews.Author: Lonnielayabout
Reviews.Content: This is the luxury hotel to stay in when you don't want to pay the top prices of the top brands. We stayed in a club room on the 27th floor and enjoyed the following benefits: * Spacious, immaculately appointed room with magnificent views to Hong Kong Island. * Complimentary happy hour (6 - 8pm) with a wide choice of cocktails, good wines and excellent food in 'Above and Beyond' - the club area on the 28th floor. * Complimentary buffet + cooked breakfast in Above and Beyond. * 100HKD free laundry per person per day. * Complimentary mini bar (soft drinks and nibbles only). * Concierge service, in-room check in / check out, late check out. Apart from the benefits listed above the hotel also has an extremely friendly and professional staff provided in part by the Hong Kong Hospitality College and their mentors. The gym and pool on the 9th floor are superbly equipped. There is also a spa that we did not try. The wi-fi is free, fast and reliable. If you stay, book dinner at the 28th floor restaurant and ask for a window table to enjoy the Hong Kong Island evening light show. We thought the seven course degustation menu good value (scallops / lobster / Wagyu etc). The Sommelier, Wallace Lo, has an excellent knowledge of wine (especially food and wine pairing) and is outgoing and enthusiastic to share his knowledge if you are interested in wine. He was kind enough to provide us with a single malt whisky 'on the house' as a nightcap. Negatives? The hotel is not in the centre of things but a free shuttle bus (air con and wi-fi!) runs at 20 minute intervals to shopping centres and the ferry terminal for HK Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: hopeless1976
Reviews.Content: Probably the best service I've had at a hotel (and I travel a lot). Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. My room was a Harbor View room and the view was great. I will recommend this place to my friends and family, and I will stay here again next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky elevators”
Reviews.Author: Reaganspopy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times over the last year and I love it. Great service, decent location, good prices. I booked a suite the first time and it was spectacular. This time I booked a normal room but I was upgraded to a small suite for the same price. The staff is always eager to help, the mini bar is free, yes I said free! And they will stock it with whatever you ask for. Location is nice, close to shopping and restaurants, everything is within walking distance. Go ahead a spend the extra few dollars for the harbor view it is worth it. And take the time to go to breakfast on the second floor, one of my favotites. The only thing I could find wrong was the elevators had hardly no chime when they arrived on the floor so if you are talking or have background noise like the lobby you had to pay attention. And they always seem to stop on the ninth floor even with no one there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon”
Reviews.Author: Chris I
Reviews.Content: Just returned fron 5 day trip to Hong Kong and would strongly urge anyone doing the same to consider staying at this superb hotel. There are no negatives. Rooms and bathrooms are excellent especially rooms with a harbour view - very definitely worth the upgrade. The gym and outdoor pool on the 9th floor are exceptional and once again the views are stunning. Above and Beyond, the restaurant on the top floor has a well deserved Michelin fork and spoon award - delicious Chinese food and the prices aren't silly either. Nick Tam makes one of the best cappuccinos ever. Hotel Icon is only a stones throw from huge numbers of shops and yet more superb restaurants - we tried Spring Deer, Nan Hai No 1, Sabatini and were not disappointed. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic Hotel Icon”
Reviews.Author: TravelTails17
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of spending 5 nights at Hotel Icon. Our plane arrived early Monday evening during the recent Typhoon Vincente, luckily we had booked the Hotel car to collect us from the airport as category 8 means taxis are not insured and buses/trains were out. Our car driver picked his way through the debris and very wet roads to deliver us safely to the haven that is Hotel Icon. The fantastic Hotel staff rushed out to greet us and escort us safely inside and collected our bags. Once inside Raymond took control explaining the seriousness of the situation without alarming us. He then escorted us to our room on the 26th floor (Club 36), explained all we needed to know and left us feeling welcome and relaxed while outside the tempest grew. The room had the most amazing view across the harbour to the spectacular lights of HK island. It was spacious, clean, modern, with the most comfortable beds, crisp linen, fluffy towels and up-to-date amenities. Deep bathtub, groovy shower with rain or handheld shower heads. Free mini bar with chocs and soft drinks (no alcohol - didn't matter as Club room has free cocktails for 2 hrs each night in the sumptuous Above & Below Lounge). We found the room very quiet, no neighbor noise at all, air con was quiet and very little to worry us during 150km/hr winds! As we were advised to remain inside for at least the next 12hrs we headed for the 28th floor to Above & Beyond Lounge. Typhoon had now reached Cat10 and it was clear we were in the best place to watch it happen around us. We hadn't made a booking at the restaurant however the staff did their best to arrange a table, following, cocktails in the lounge. We enjoyed the crispy skin duck and chilli prawns - delicious. As morning broke it was evident by the lack of traffic on the roads the typhoon while abating was still posing a threat and it wasn't safe to emerge so we booked into the Angsana Spa - possibly the best massage I've ever had. As mentioned in previous posts the hotel is run by the Polytechnic University. The staff are young, energetic, friendly interns and post-grads who cannot do enough for their guests, always smiling and making you feel at home. So refreshing from the stuffy establishments who trade on their names only. During our stay we were asked to complete a couple of research surveys for the students and researchers from the Uni. We were happy to participate, even reviewing a 'concept' room the hotel was trialling with new products/amenities to make guests stay even more comfortable. We visited the Marketplace Restaurant for breakfast each morning and also for their buffet dinner. While breakfast was included in our room rate we found the buffet dinner expensive and were disappointed the staff were packing up and clearing away half an hour before close. It makes guests who do eat late feel a little harried. We didn't eat at Green but it looked great. We had a busy time in HK and at the end of each day were glad to return to our room - our haven from the vibrant yet busy streets. Throughout our stay the staff always asked us if we required assistance in planning our day, gave us some great tips - really doing their best to make us feel so special :) The comments regarding location initially worried us when looking for a hotel, however with the hotel shuttle leaving every 20 mins, dropping off behind The Peninsula Hotel or at Harbour City, taxis at the doorstep and really a very easy 10min walk down Granville Rd with some great shops to Nathan Rd we found the location not an issue at all. We even headed to the Temple St night markets, caught a taxi there for $HK25 and easily walked back to hotel after midnight without any issues. Hotel Icon is a great concept in a great location and we will certainly be back - very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: nanooki
Reviews.Content: Delightful, pleasant, nearly perfect, and the location is not an issue like others have complained. Breakfast is good but some of the warm prepared food is tasteless. Otherwise this has been my best hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top service but extremely busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rlouwerse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in June, based upon the high ratings from the Tripadvisor website. I travelled from mainland China by train from Guangzhou to the Hung Hom station, but even when the hotel was opposite of the street I found it hard to reach it by foot. The signs where not clear and I had to walk in the pouring rain to the hotel. At the reception they told me that I was early and got a room on the 7th floor, I asked them if they could give me a better room but unfortunately I had to wait 3 hours before housekeeping would have finished to clean the higher rooms. Since I was wet because of the walk to the hotel I still decided to wait in their Timeless room. Even though I asked for a high level room at my reservation, I found it unfortunate that there was no room available at check-in. The timeless room was nice, with television and nice coffee and I got a chance to take a shower. Once waited 3 hours I went back to the reception and got the room I wanted in the first place. The room was very nice, with great view. And although the minibar items where free, I found the minibar not very well equipped. What I liked about the room was the view overlooking the skyline of HK and the bathroom with separate bath and shower. One the first evening I want to go for dinner in their restaurants, but found out that it was very crowded so decided to go outside. There was one department which I think had the best service and that was the concierge. The very nice gentlemen behind the desk gave me great suggestions to visit and to shop for suits. All by all a good stay, but when you do not like a crowded hotel I suggest you to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: bubblegirl81
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good sized room, clean & comfortable room with sleek & modern design, free shuttle to Harbour City, plenty of small shops/ restaurants nearby. For the club floor: choice of breakfast at above & beyond restaurant (amazing view) or the regular buffet area (which is also good), complimentary daily afternoon tea and free flow wine and cocktail in the evening. Great value for money! Cons: A bit off the main area (about 15 mins walk to Tsim Tsa Tsui station)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: dmckown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 6 nights at the end of July, and this was a wonderful hotel with very attentive staff, beautiful, modern exceptionally clean rooms and a price far below comparable hotels with the same amenities and views. The western restaurant was excellent (our experience was with breakfast), pool area was nice. The subway is a 15 min walk, but there are endless taxis if you don't want the walk and probably about $4-5 USD for the ride to the subway. A shuttle runs every 20 min from 0800-2200 daily to get you to the other side of Kowloon. This was an exceptional bargain and would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room & Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Sheherezade
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit out of the way, as it is not near the public transport. The hotel does run a shuttle bus to the subway though. We chose it for an overnight, to be near the airport, and for this it works extremely well. Airport is only about a 15 minute taxi ride away. The room we had requested (with view) was not available, so they upgraded us to an even nicer room - no complaints there! The room was large and very comfortable, very clean, and with modern style and fittings, all very correct. The staff were friendly and competent. Too bad the restaurant and cafe are not open later, especially as it's a bit out of the way. But it's a good basic hotel at a good price for HK.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ics66
Reviews.Content: My family had an extended weekend stay at the end of July and booked a suite 80 and an adjacent club city 36 on 26th floor. This is by far the most responsive and helpful hotel i have come across. From initial enquiries about ajoining/adjacent rooms (for my 2 children), to discussing best way to get there, booking a table at restaurant on first evening, the response was very quick (less than an hour in all cases) informative and polite. This was seen through our visit until leaving. the staff were all incredibly friendly, helpful and polite, which was a pleasant change to the hustle of most of the hong kong population. As mentioned by several reviewers, the hotel is also a training hotel for the hospitality industry courses at the local polytechnic and this would also account for the youth of many staff at the hotel. The suite 80 had a fantastic view from the bedroom and lounge which had a full seating area and table, desk etc. By far the best suite i have known in HK when floor space is at such a premium. it also had a great bath with a huge picture window overlooking the harbour (with blinds if you want them) and a strong shower. We found the beds comfortable being medium/firm and the aircon is silent making for a good nights sleep. So there was plenty of space for 4 to relax and use as a base. The rooms are filled with technology, sometimes a bit daunting when late and you just cant turn the lights off. The club 36 city was a decent size room and has a more conventional bathroom. no complaints there. both rooms had good coffee (nespresso) and tea, also a free mini bar with beer and soft drinks. We found the club lounge a little small and if all club level guests turned up for cocktails I suspect they would not all fit in. There was a decent wait to get a drink as they were probably understaffed for the numbers in the lounge. So we tended not to use it as much as we might and i am not sure if we would pay the premium again. We had a meal at the chinese restaurant at above & beyond. The food was good, portion sizes were decent and serving staff ok, if a little too focused on my 15 year old daughter. I was surprised to note that no local food was on the room service menu which i think is a missed opportunity given the in house restaurant. location wise, it is a very short walk to the science and history museums. A bit further to the main shopping areas of Kowloon but there is a regular shuttle bus that solves that issue if you dont like the walk. The upside (or downside depending on what you are looking for) of the location is that is it perhaps a bit quieter than more central locations. Overall I liked this hotel, it may not quite match premium 5 star hotels such as the IC or Four seasons, but with the room sizes and service I dont think you cant find better value for money in HK.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: DannaSY
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't say one bad thing about this hotel. It is beautiful, the staff are incredibly nice and accommodating, unbelievable view of Hong Kong from the restaurant on the 28th floor. Even going to the gym was incredibly enjoyable with stunning views of te city and spectacular facilities. Yes, cannot use too many superlatives for this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: milkcandies
Reviews.Content: Location: As it was persistently raining during my stay, I didn't walk to take the MTR which I think is within walking distance. But taxis are easily available at this hotel. The hotel is located in Kowloon and near the tunnel which makes it a short drive from the main shopping areas on Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Room: I LOVE the Club Room - it's spacious (which is a luxury in Hong Kong), stylish, nice view of the city with a glimpse of the ocean (for my room); I liked lounging in the rocking chair next to the window and enjoy the view; the room includes free mini bar which includes beverages and snacks; nespresso; TV in front of the bathtub so I can enjoy my favorite channel while soaking in the bath; rain shower; free wifi; and a huge bed. The added benefit of staying in the Club Room includes breakfast at the Above and Beyond lounge. They serve eggs prepared in various different ways ala carte style. It also includes cocktails and afternoon tea at the lounge. Service: Staff are generally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for top service and luxury in HK”
Reviews.Author: Daniel T
Reviews.Content: From the moment I made first contact with hotel to the time of check-out, I only had pleasant experiences with Hotel ICON. I will definitely be staying here for future trips to HK. At the time of check-in I was upgraded to a club floor room (although no Club privileges) on level 26. The view from the ICON 38 Harbour View room on this club floor was awesome. While it did not directly face central Hong Kong, the layout of the room with the huge King bed facing the floor-to-ceiling window more than compensated. The room was spotless, and featured a free Minibar with M&Ms and plenty of drinks and a Nespresso machine, which were all very welcome after a day out in the city. I also enjoyed 'Green' - the cafe in the lobby. It has a really cool feel to it, and while the menu does not have huge variety, it's always a great place to chill out after a big day. Not enough can be said about the service in this hotel - always being greeted with a smile and staff genuinely go that extra mile to make your stay as perfect as possible. Location is quite good - it is about a 5-10 minute walk to the heart of TST. I would recommend catching a taxi to areas in TST, as they are very cheap (approx $20HKD or ~$2.50 AUD for a ride to the Star Ferry Terminal or Harbour City) over using the hotel shuttle bus. Perhaps my only criticism would be of the shuttle bus, as I could not see any defined stops and pick-up points, so I opted for taxis which were always readily available at the front of the hotel. Overall, I would definitely recommend Hotel ICON - there is no need to look any further for an ultra-modern hotel with great value for money, cleanliness, excellent service and good location. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: valentina v
Reviews.Content: This was a great surprise to find an excellent service and a very modern, spacious and comfortable room with spectacular view. I booked this hotel when almost all other hotels where I used to stay in HK were full and found everything excellent and reasonable prices for HK. The staff is friendly and spontaneous, except on the 28th floor bar during the daytime. The 28th floor bar is great when traveling alone for business with some complimentary food and drinks. The room service was eatable as far as I remember. Really appreciated the club room with the large bed and the modern amenities. The location was not so good, a little bit difficult to find by foot, but no problem when traveling with taxi or driver most of the time. I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, spacious room and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Caraan
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay in East Tsim Sha Tsui and we picked Hotel ICON as we believe it is the newest hotel in the area. The location is great. There are loads of restaurants nearby. Hong Kong Coliseum, Museum of History and Science Museum are all within walking distance. The hotel provides shuttle service to Middle Road and Harbour City in TST every 20 minutes. If you intend to travel around HK by MTR, the station is 5-10 mins' walk. The hotel itself was clean and new. The room was spacious and spotless. Toiletries and amenities such as slippers, bathrobe and toothbrush were provided. Drinks in the mini-bar and Wi-fi were free, which was a bonus. Last but not the least, the staff in the Front Desk, Concierge and the restaurant on the ground floor were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value”
Reviews.Author: PenguinTuk
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with amazing views and modern comfortable rooms. Ideal for business the pool is a little small if you have time off... Beware the bars close early at 11.30 so find a quiet local! Great spa with lovely staff! This is a good all rounder for business or pleasure! Will be back

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Zebanuck
Reviews.Content: Why my favourite? The service is exemplary, the design of the lobby and especially the rooms is interesting, modern and not your typical hotel and the location, while not perfect, is more than made up for by shuttle buses and the view. Oh, the view! Get a room on a high floor ending in 09-19 - harbour view rooms. The view from the full length plate glass windows is just stunning, especially at night when the whole neon vista of Hong Kong island is laid out in front of you. Worth every penny (or every attempt at sweet talking the receptionist when you arrive). This hotel is attached to the Hong Kong School of Tourism and Hotel Management so many of the staff are students who are in training. Others work full time. So you get staff who are invested in the service experience they give. For example, when I checked in i had just 20 mins to find an opticians to fix my glasses. But the concierge didn't just tell me where to go - one of the team escorted me across the road and down another street to the opticians, waited while I sorted out what I needed, helped to translate at one moment and then escorted me back to the hotel. That was great service. The room is nicely designed (you can see the hand of Terence Conran here, who the web site says was one of the designers) and has some nice features you dont' commonly find, like a printer that actually works (you just email an attachment to a certain address). Shuttle bus access is good - the Airport Express shuttle stops here and the hotel has its own shuttle to Tsim Tsa Shui. And it's good value too. It's a refreshing change from all the other stuffy hotels in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid alternative to the Central to CWB Corridor”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: We lived in HK for 8 years and used to frequent the Central to Causeway Bay corridor most of the time. For reasons of cost and exploration, we booked at Hotel Icon for a recent return trip. What a nice alternative! Service was excellent. The room offered spectacular views back over HK Island. The gym was amazing. The pool was wonderful and a hit with our kids. Having the minibar -- with its M&Ms and sodas -- was a very welcome touch. The shuttle bus was handy, as was the Airport Express transfer (free). The hotel is right near the History Museum (not to be missed!) and within striking distance of all the good street markets (kids particularly enjoyed the night market). Two footnotes: 1. The buffet dinner on the second floor is not good value for money and we wish we hadn't caved to jetlag/desperation upon check-in. 2. I asked/emailed repeatedly for a meeting with the reservation manager to line up a block of rooms for next March and was patently ignored. That was most disappointing. Otherwise, a real winner. Try it out.

Reviews.Title: “The best hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freda289
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online, asked for a limo pick up. 2 Days before we left Perth (wa) received an email telling us all the details, booking confirmation etc. Arrived at hong Kong airport jumped into the hotel limo. Met at the door by Raymond Hough ( with trainee) escorted to our room where check in was done. This is first for us (normally have to que in hotel lobby). Raymond explained all of the Club room details/features functions, explained how happy hour at above and beyond works (for aussies reading this, this means 2hrs free alcohol, what ever you want) we ate at all of the hotel resturants and would have to say some of the finest hotel food we have ever encounted. Some people that stood out fromt the crowd Shannon from above and beyond, your staff truely do go out of there way to help everyone enjoy the very best this hotel has to offer.In the market restuarant go look for George Hung he truely went out of his way to look after us.

Reviews.Title: “Consider splurging for this hotel – you won’t regret it!”
Reviews.Author: hbsboston
Reviews.Content: Located on the Kowloon side across from Hong Kong, Hotel Icon is positioned so that guests who book Harborview rooms end up staying in a space that contains a wall of glass, that when curtains are open, reveals Hong Kong – in all its glory – across the water. Consider two splurges when you book your Hotel Icon room. The first is that amazing Harborview room with their endless display of neon wonder at night. The second splurge – book a concierge floor room. Access to the Above & Beyond lounge for concierge guests and the amazing food served there – items off the breakfast menu and/or breakfast buffet, the afternoon tea, plus evening cocktails and hors d'oeuvres can pay for the room rate difference. The lounge provides a great place to map out the day’s activities or unwinding after (or between) events and activities. The Eggs Benedict with yummy truffle hollandaise sauce and perfect poached eggs meant I actually ate, and enjoyed, egg yolks for the first time in my life! The room itself is elegantly and minimally decorated which puts the spectacular view front and center stage. The wonderful bathroom contains a lovely oval shower, separate bathtub, semi-private toilet area, and a sink area with wonderful mirrors, lighting, and handy pull-out open drawer storage to hide traveling items is exquisite. When you close the door the bathroom space disappears behind a gracefully curving wall. Other room details – comfortable chairs that sit slightly low to the floor, a protective clear panel band so you don’t lean right through your window, and a free mini-bar. Regardless of the day or time, we found the single serving sized packages of plain or peanut M&M’s the perfect pick-me-up. The result is a restful room that’s hard to leave. Our flight into Hong Kong was terribly delayed and the free mini-bar tided us over until our late room service meal arrived. The bar and lounge near the pool is beautifully done and when we were there quite empty. The concierge desk is wonderfully helpful and the two-stop shuttle bus to Tsimshatsui and return to the hotel was convenient and we used it multiple times. The lounge for late departures or early arrivals gave us an easy hour of down time between our last sightseeing adventure and heading to the airport. That dedicated lounge is such a wonderful concept that I’m surprised more hotels haven’t copied it. My highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but awkward location”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a club room for one night. Reception staff were excellent. Room was modern with good amenities. My complaint would be the number of electronic lights which make it difficult to sleep and the curtains not allowing total blackout. Breakfast was very good. The club lounge was very nice but limited food choice. Pool area is fantastic but staff there are not as engaging as the rest of the hotel staff. Overall a good value hotel and I would consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Baby bed death trap!”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneGecko3
Reviews.Content: We recently stay at the hotel Icon and were very excited. The reviews were fantastic. We booked SEVERAL months in advance and requested a baby bed for our 18 month old. When we checked in there was no baby bed. After we requested it be put in the room THREE TIMES they told us that they had no spare bed as they were fully booked. After my husband insisted and my daughter got increasingly more tired and cranky they finally brought in a dreadful broken bed. By then it was two hours past her afternoon sleep and the bed was at least 20 years old and collapsed at one end. It was dirty and not fit for a dog. By this point we were sick of complaining and just coped. They did not offer any apology or anything to make it up to us. From here on things just got worse. Our bar fridge was broken and when I told the concierge her response was that I could keep my babies milk in the kitchen fridge of the restaurant. Anyone with kids knows that they need milk regularly and we couldn't be traipsing to the restaurant at 3am for the milk. Finally they brought a new fridge. BUT THEN we decided to shower and discovered the shower blocked up and flooded the bathroom. This hotel is really more about looking good rather than functioning well and supporting its guests. We would not stay here again and would caution anyone with children from attempting it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shiv_traveler
Reviews.Content: Amazing ambience, Super location. Rooms are nicely designed - modern styling. The shuttle bus was very convenient and takes you around key locations in kowloon. The pool had amazing views of the skyline, sitting right on top of the world. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We stayed for 3 nights and will for sure stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Hotel ICON exceeded our expectations. We visited in mid July 2012 and were pleased with the location, service, and amenities. The staff was helpful and friendly. The Mass Transit Railway was close by and the free shuttle to Harbour Mall and Star Ferry made getting around easy. The pool was cool and clean, and we enjoyed a refreshing dip each afternoon after several hot hours of touring. We loved the Harbour view! Our room was more than adequate: it was well maintained, clean and quite modern. We didn't use the spa facilities or eat at the restaurant, so we're unable to comment on those services. We thought we received great value for our hotel dollars and would highly recommend Hotel ICON to other visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnyvonnePreston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is magnificent, staff are very pleasant, always polite and extremely helpful. The room was very modern and stylish, the food in THE GREEN restaurant was superb. We would not hesitate to recomend this hotel to triends.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: csathiago
Reviews.Content: Hotel Icon is simply AMAZING! We went there in December 2011 and stayed at one of the suites. We were received with drinks in a special check-in area for suite-costumers. The hotel has a very modern design! ROOM was huge and very comfortable, very modern and new. All itens from the minibar were free of charge and we could choose to have breakfast (already included in the price) at two different venues. BATHROOM was excellent with TV, bathtub, shower and nice amenities. On the day we left Hong Kong, we had a very early flight, and since breakfast wasn't open at that time, they delivered a special "breakfast box" at our room for us to take to the airport with juice and sandwich. SERVICE by all the attendants was EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Would come back again”
Reviews.Author: bondbaby007
Reviews.Content: New, modern hotel on waterfront at Tsim Sha Tsui East. Spacious rooms for Hong Kong with large bed, bath and shower. Beautifully designed and clean. Service with a smile. Large gym on rooftop with devine outdoor pool overlooking Hong Kong skyline from Tsim Sha Tsui East. Short walk to Nathan Rd and its shopping and restaurants. Good value for money. Reasonable price for Hong Kong. Would stay again even though prefer to be based on Island side.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: demahend
Reviews.Content: Staying in the hotel from 12-15 of July. Room is excelent as it's stated in the previous review. Location is a little bit far from the action but they provide the shuttle bus to Harbour city and Tsim Tsa Tsui. A friend of mine who stayed with me got a surprise birthday cake and card signed by all staffs. Highly appreciate for the surprise. And staffs are very friendly and nice. Check in and check out process are very fast. Will stay again in the same hotel for the future visit to Hongkong. You cannot bet the price with that quality of service. Two tumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TonySopranosVest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed at. I can't recommend it highly enough. It's ultra modern in looks and has its own unique character and brand. Truly stunning design. The staff are extremely helpful and knowledgable and will help book restaurants etc for you without hesitation. Superb gym over looking the city, nice pool. Food served is also very good and I would recommend the breakfast buffet including traditional Chinese, pastries, English, sushi, fruit etc. Remember to take advantage of the hotel shuttle buses every twenty mins to the peninsula hotel as there isn't a train station that close by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Fantastic Stay in Hotel ICON - July 2012”
Reviews.Author: SS127
Reviews.Content: Concierge and Front Desk staffs are very enthusiastic and helpful, fantastic service, wonderful location to easy access by transportation, amazing harbour and open wide view, I could not find any reason to stay in other hotel when visiting HK again!

Reviews.Title: “State of the art hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Holidays_NZ
Reviews.Content: We researched a superior hotel stay for 10 days with swimming pool facilities for the summer for our family to cool down and refresh after a long day of shopping and sightseeing around the areas of hongkong so after reading many highly recommended reviews of this hotel, we were not at all disappointed ! Many hotels would charge so much more for the amenities offered in this hotel - Very spacious rooms and ultra quiet air conditioning, free mini bar including canned drinks and bottled water, bathroom is ultra modern includes a monsoon rain or slide shower and even a bath ! you dont even need to take a toothbrush. Only thing is they are about 10 miutes walk form the central TsimSharTsui shopping area, so they provide a free shuttle service every 15 minutes. We had a city view which was nice, but if you want the harbour view, you will need to upgrade. The added bonus is when you check out in the morning, you can ask them to store your luggage and if you have a late flight, you are allowed to use their 'transit' room, offering us of shower facilities,complimentary coffee and drinks, very handy if you have a late flight out. we would certainly return to this hotel for our next holiday there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Joliday
Reviews.Content: I think everyone has said all there is to say about this hotel. I loved everything about it. Rooms, service, pool, gym, the smell in the lobby! Great location, many restaurant options for any budget close by, including for breakfast. We particularly liked walking to Starbucks and enjoyed breakfast overlooking the harbour. I can't wait to return to hotel ICON and would recommend everyone stays here when visiting HK!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel but let's chill the enthusiasm a bit...”
Reviews.Author: Jon D
Reviews.Content: This hotel came very recommended so we booked a 65 suite. This is a very good room + the club gives you cocktails everyday afternoon, afternoon tea and brilliant breakfast at the market restaurant (much better than in the club). The staff is very helpful and give a very good service. But the hotel does have some problems: 1) The lobby and facilities are not as pampering as you will find at the ritz, mandarin oriental, etc 2) The Spa was good treatment but not good value for money + the relaxation time (which you pay for) was only at the spa lobby and seemed pointless 3) The location is not great. 15mins-20mins walk from Tsim sham Tsui subway station is not very good, the station next to it (hong kong station) is useless for island travel and the hotel shuttle service compensates just a bit. In conclusion – the ICON is a very good hotel, especially if you take the club room or suite. I would not take it for a regular room with no breakfast. The harbour view is fantastic and I think much better than rooms facing Kowloon. It will give very good value for money but still far from being up there with the Ritz, the Mandarin Oriental or any of the high end HONG KONG hotels.

Reviews.Title: “business trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was very nice but once you have checked out, there was nobody whose carry your luggage. We booked 7 nights, for about 27000HKD, but once we like to stay one more night, in a cheaper room, ( 1815HKD) the service was suddenly less. We don't understand why? It's a pity, the higher the price the better the service? I don't hope so.

Reviews.Title: “As good as they say”
Reviews.Author: travelglobe
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were high and they were met for the most part. We stayed in a city view room and it was perfectly adequate. The room was spacious, the bathroom was very functional and the view was great. We landed in HK very early and we were given a pass to a "waiting room" with some freebies and comfortable seats as well as the option to use the facilities to freshen up after a very long flight. The hotel itself is very stylish, modern and sleek. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The one issue we had was with the free shuttle service to Harbour City. The driver was very fixated on where to drop off guests and refused to deviate in the slightest. We were once also ignored a pickup from Harbour City because we weren't at exactly the pickup spot but a few paces away. Both the Market restaurant and the Green restaurant are great. The variety for both breakfast and lunch at the Market restaurant was impressive. We found the location of the hotel perfectly fine in that we don't mind a short walk. The views from the pool area are spectacular. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: thejam00
Reviews.Content: i loved the hotel. When i booked i thought it' another 5 stars hotel. But when it comes to service, it's much more. I went with my wife and Hong Kong was the 1st stop among other destinations.. It begins from the check-in. This was the 1st time i check-in from my room without the need to wait in at the check-in counter.. this was a nice human touch.. The hotel has 3 different restaurent, the one on teh 28th floor has a breath-taking view. You can enjoy evening snacks over there.. The restaurent at the ground floor has a very nice food as we and atmosphere.. The one at the 2nd floor is good for breakfast. What i notices couple of different things in this hote that amazed me: 1- in room amenities are un-matched. They thought of every single details. 2- They offer 5 types of pillows if the one already on your bed is not comfy. This was the main pain points in all the hotels i stayed in 3- Their Concierge services is amazing. Cody and Howard did an amazing job helping us doing the activities we want in the cheapest, quickest and easiest way 4- They have a shuttle that passes by 2 stops, Metro station and the biggest shopping center in Hong Kong). It departs every 20 min. This was very convenient for every trip we did.. 5- The mini-bar is for free and they refill it every day. (not sure if they have different policies for different room categories) 6- Laundry was complementary for $100HK per day. This was also convenient. I really recommend it for vacations. Enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels...ever”
Reviews.Author: 260mike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Hong Kong in August 2011...first off, Hong Kong in itself is a wonderful experience, and the Icon hotel just added to it. We went during the soft opnening (they were still finishing parts of the hotel). The Hotel itself is beautiful, and the staff super friendly. The restaurant (and lounge) served great food, and had a large variety. The best part of the hotel though was the room. Wonderfully designed to maximize usable space. The room layout is a bit small, but the way in which it was designed was fantastic, as well as aesthetically pleasing. The pool (rooftop) has a fantastic view of the city (well at least part of it), and everything is extremely nice. Comfortable bed, linens, etc. Just a fantastic experience...highly recomendable. And I have to mention (according to my wife) the buffet dinner had all you can eat oysters (as well as an ample variety of other seafood). Just wonderfull.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ryuready
Reviews.Content: Overall I got everything I would expect from a hotel such as this. One thing that made my stay here extra pleasant though is the excellent service that the staff in this hotel provides. They are very helpful and accommodating to make sure that you are enjoying yourself. Other than that the rooms and other amenities isn't really extraordinary from any 5 star hotel. The location is also a bit far (a couple of blocks away from the city center/ MTR station. What I liked: 1) Special lounge where you can freshen up and relax if you arrive too early for your check in or have to leave late after check out. You can even take a shower if you want. T 2) shuttle service that heads toward Harbor City, rather than walking to the MTR station you can simply board this. It's only one way though. 3) They have one of the largest vertical gardens in Asia which in my opinion is an attraction in itself. It provides a tranquil atmosphere to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cypressday
