Reviews.Content: Arriving early in the day the staff was very accommodating , setting us up immediately in a perfect room. We had requested a view - to watch the fireworks on July 1 - and boy did they come through. Up to the 27th floor with a panorama of the harbor and Hong Kong beyond. The room itself was beautiful, with a very sophisticated curved bathroom. The fireworks were amazing, and to be able to sit by the window with our feet up devouring the contents of the complimentary minibar, made it that much better. After the fireworks were done I headed down to the 9th floor pool, it felt a little odd only because the dinner barbecue service was still going on( it was specially set for the fireworks ) and after the heat of the day it was actually quite a cool pool- temperature I mean The day of check out also showed off the real effort they make to look after guests. Our flight was not until 8 , so after check out and wandering around Kowloon for the afternoon we were able to come back get a shower and change in the pool changing rooms - so nicely appointed. Multi head shower, all kinds of grooming products, and afterwards acces to the executive lounge for coffee, snacks and just some time to chill, before heading off to the airport. Please give a reason to go back to HK to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous service, rooms and view!”
Reviews.Author: Jodi99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a stopover on the way back to Sydney from a business trip, and it was fabulous! The rooms are spectacular (I had a standard king with a harbour view on the 21st floor) with floor to ceiling windows and all the amenities, including an amazing shower. The service was lovely and the free mini-bar was a nice touch. While it's a little further away from the ferry wharf and Kowloon station than some of the other premium hotels, just over the road there was a great area of local restaurants where I had some fantastic meals. I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of Great Trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: BuffCrone
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel based upon the amazing TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The room is a perfect modern base with all the amenities (and more) that you would expect but without the high prices and snooty attitude. The view from the rooms of the harbor is simply amazing so be sure to ask for a room on that side. We loved the separate shower and bath. A few tiny things could make it so much better: First, they need real coffee, not instant, in the rooms. Although the Illy coffee in the cafe is excellent, they don't open until 7 and that is late for someone recovering from jet lag. Second, there is an annoying whistle caused by the air conditioning that can seem deafening when you are trying to get back to sleep at 2:30! And we felt that the concierge could be much more pro-active in helping us find what we needed. As experienced trippers, we didn't need much help, but some alternative suggestions when our first choice was booked would have helped. All in all, a terrific base camp for your Hong Kong adventure.

Reviews.Title: “best quality value in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Gintonic76
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, only issue could be the FB that is not superb, but for the price you pay comparing with other hotels in the city, this is a minor flaw. The swimming pool is great, and the design of the rooms are very well thought. The Bathroom opens with a curved corridor door, and all the appliances are at your disposal. Service is flawless and it has very nice elements. Overall, and with the prices in HK hotel scene, this is a great place to stay in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here when it was first opened last June”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSommers
Reviews.Content: Sorry for late review, I have been busy travelling! I stayed here with my family last June when they were offering a promotional rate of HK$1500 with free minibar. The hotel was not fully operational at the time. The infinity pool wasn't ready which is a pity. I did enjoy the stay because everything was new. The only thing is - half of the hotel room is actually the bathroom, in a circular shape right next to the room entrance, leaving a narrow strip of space for the bed and the study. It's not surprising that the bathroom takes priority in this hotel cause I was told the key designer is the world's famous bathroom designers. The room furniture looks a little cheap to me. The hotel was brand new but I could already see peeling of the strips around the edges of the wooden furniture. The bathroom is in pitch black; It's not really for older folks cause they might not be able to see properly when they are inside. The bathtub however is to die for; it's deep and luxurious. For what it is charging now, I won't stay cause it's not really all that convenient to get to all those happening places in the area. I am not very fond of the Tsimshatsui East area. It's now the older part of Tsimshatsui and the walk underground in the MTR station is long. To me, the staff also wears some rather funny uniform. The girls wear a kind of yellow bolero with cut-out holes :-( I didn't eat at the hotel so I am not sure about the food. By now, the hotel would have improved, judging from the reviews I have seen here.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: shane b
Reviews.Content: Hotel Icon does everything right! Because it was our first time in Hong Kong we reserved a car through the hotel. A big black Mercedes S-Class was waiting at the airport and had us at the hotel in no time. When we pulled up the driver must have called the hotel because someone walked out to greet us BY NAME as we stepped out of the car! She took us straight up to our room where we were checked-in INSIDE OUR ROOM. No waiting at the front desk! If I'm not mistaken... for some reason we were told we had been upgraded to the Icon floor? Our room was on the 25th floor and was far more than we had expected! There was a flat screen above the bathtub, the coolest shower ever, an incredible comfortable bed and a free minibar! We had booked a room with a view of Kowloon instead of Hong Kong Island, because we really didn't know the difference! But we could see both sides of Victoria Harbor from our room! The hotel is close to two subway stops but to get to Hong Kong Island.... you have to walk a good way through the Tsim Tsa Sui Station. The hotel does have a shuttle bus that runs every 20 minutes to three stops around the hotel on Kowloon... and one of those stops is at the Tsim Tsa Sui East station... which if you go there you don't have to do the walking ! (I may not be spelling those names correctly!) Point being the hotel is in a great location in Kowloon.... a short walk to the harbor where you can watch the laser light show every night... short walk to subway stations and sites like the Peninsula Hotel... and literally just steps from all the best museums hong kong has to offer. Everytime we'd come or go someone was always waiting to open the door and tell us how to get where we were going! A typhoon hit one night we were there so we sat in the bar/restaurant on the 27th floor and enjoyed a couple drinks while the storm passed! its an incredible view up there and although we didn't have a meal, the wine was great! The bar in the lobby is also great for that! Unfortunately we didn't have time to enjoy the beautiful pool (which has a great view of Hong Kong Island) or spacious fitness center, because our time was VERY LIMITED and we were trying to hit all the top spots in our guide book. If i had more time it would've been nice to enjoy the pool and soak up the sun while relaxing high about the city! The only complaint about Hotel Icon... and its really more about the subway.... is the subway to Hong Kong Island stops running around 12:45am.... so if you're on Hong Kong Island late at nite you'll have to catch a cab back to Kowloon! Our last night we were out at a club and when the bartender told us this, we rushed back to the subway station to get back in time! We were actually tired and needed to get back..... taking a cab would not have been that difficult and I doubt that expensive? (But I honestly have no clue the cost because we took the subway and buses everywhere.... THE PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM IN HONG KONG IS INCREDIBLE SIMPLE TO UNDERSTAND! EVEN FOR SOMEONE FROM CALIFORNIA WHO NEVER GETS OUT OF HIS CAR) FOR THE PRICE, I DO NOT SEE HOW HOTEL ICON CAN BE BEAT! Hotels aren't cheap in Hong Kong but our room was under $300 a night and somewhere like Manhattan.... a hotel and room like the one we enjoyed would have been more like $500! I'd love to return to Hong Kong and Hotel Icon because I was truly shocked at how nice this city AND HOTEL WERE!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Quinnynews
Reviews.Content: The Icon is a modern hotel that is well located in Hong Kong. Staff are efficient and extremely eager to please. We were upgraded to a Club Room as the room we had booked wasn't ready when we checked in. The room was large by Hong Kong standards with a good view across the harbour and city. Wifi was free, as was the minibar soft drinks and snacks. Toiletries and facilities in the room are excellent and the bed is extremely comfortable. The swimming pool is outdoors and a very modern gym is adjacent. Both excellent. We didn't eat in the hotel. there are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk to TST station, and there is a shuttle bus every 20 minutes if you don't fancy the walk. The shuttle also goes to the nearby Ocean Harbour Mall too. I can't fault this hotel. It is modern and stylish with quiet efficiency. Stay here and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps Getting Better!”
Reviews.Author: Muzza54321
Reviews.Content: I regularly travel to Hong Kong for business and Hotel Icon is now my only choice. I have stayed here 5 times and every time I check in, it just keeps getting better! Rooms are large (for HK), modern and immaculately clean. Wifi and minibar come free of charge. Bathroom is sexy, although the shower can be a bit tricky. It's almond shaped and it's pretty big, but there's no shower door so if you're not careful, you'll get a flooded bathroom floor. The bath is a bit small, but it's nice and deep. I'm around 5'5'' and the length of the bath is just enough for me to sit up straight with my legs stretched. Don't know how a taller person will manage. Nevertheless, the rooms are slick and sexy and I appreciate the newly installed TVs in the bathroom. Oh and the views are great - regardless of whether you stay in a city or harbour view room. With regards to staff, when I first started staying here, I noticed the doormen, concierge and reception staff were a bit aloof, but I did think that it was due to awkwardness, rather than rudeness. They have since sorted that out. They are now very welcoming and friendly - always smiling. The doormen now say "welcome back" when you get back at the end of the day - just that little bit of something that makes one feel at home whilst travelling. Service at the restaurants have been great right from the start and the food in all three restaurants have been outstanding. Although I'm no Chinese food expert, I thought that it was nice to eat dimsum in a fine-dining setting (at Above and Beyond Restaurant), where plates are changed after each dimsum dish. I commented that the walnuts served as appetizers were really good and they gave me a box of walnuts to take away for free. Brilliant service! The "timeless lounge" is also another reason why I choose to stay here. My flights out of HK are often scheduled late in the evening and it has always been a problem for me when I used to stay in other hotels. Hotel Icon solves this issue for me by offering a lounge for guests who have checked out. This means I can check out in the morning, go to my meetings, come back to the hotel in the evening, take a shower, blow dry my hair, do my make-up and change into a comfortable outfit for long-haul flights. Much better than doing it in an airport lounge as I can use my own toiletries and not worry about having to pack a travel outfit in my carry-on luggage. Location is good in that it is close to the Hung Hom train station if you have to take a train to China, and there are lots of places to shop and eat across the road, but the MTR is quite far. Don't be fooled by those exits you see on the street. You could walk underground for ages before you see a train. Taxis are dirt cheap though, so I prefer to take taxis rather than the MTR when in Hong Kong. What else can I say? I just absolutely love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow T
Reviews.Content: Great stay at hotel icon. Staff were lovely and the rooms are amazing. Great views and modern facilities. Best bathroom. The pool iand gym were a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality and Service”
Reviews.Author: NanzM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel through Feb 2012 for a few days. Upon arrival, we were greeted kindly by the staff and taken to the rooms. The rooms are some of the best I have ever stayed in, amazing bathrooms and the view of the harbour was amazing. It is in a very good location, a short walk to the Tsim Sha Tsui and the ferry. The service is amazing, all the staff are very friendly and helpful, and even when we were checking out and had a few hours to spare, we were allowed access to the spa showers so that we could freshen up before our flight. I will definitely be staying here again on my return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: FFAF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are having an extended stay at the Hotel Icon (10 nights) as we have met up with our daughter and grandson who live on the other side of the world to us. We have only been here for 3 nights so far but I am moved to write this review as I have been blown away by the level of service offered. This morning the concierge spent over 10 minutes trying to unscrew the base of a model car that we had bought at Hong Kong Disneyland yesterday. Eventually when the very tight screws were released our grandson was so happy that he could eventually play with his car. I had forgotten to pack my nail clippers so when I received a note in our room asking if there was any way they could help with extra services, I mentioned that I needed nail clippers and also that we would like an extra two bottles of water in our room (the mini bar is free) and some extra large slippers. All were delivered to our room today when we returned from our shopping trip. They even asked what time we would prefer our room to be made up each day and whether or not the mattress was too hard or too soft. What an outstanding hotel - I would never consider staying anywhere else in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary stay from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: LLAKTravel
Reviews.Content: Exemplary hotel emphasizing high touch service,stylish design and a great location in Kowloon that yet again gives me further reason that a boutique/concept/more independently minded hotel has it in spades over global hotel brands that fail to deliver.Hotel Icon is a highly recommended hotel that in the ultra competitive market of HKG ranked at #1 when we booked and matched our expectation from first impressions and had surpassed them very soon after. After a wind blown journey in from the airport we were met with exactly what a weary travelling family smiles at when we arrived....a warm welcome,quick turn around,upgrade to a suite and a sign in the impressively well appointed rooms that read...'Complimentary mini bar'..happy days! Our access to the Above and Beyond club came with our Suite stay and we had cocktails,free finger food and a cracking view back over to HKG island - the English front of house manager James made a real effort with us and that was appreciated. A truly memorable stay that made our visit seamless from start to finish - great staff, a conscious but not overbearing approach to service that reached real heights and will ensure that next time we come back...we are coming back here without question!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and the complete package”
Reviews.Author: travelerOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awsome. Great service, great property. We were on the executive floor which I totally recommend as you get to utilize the top floor lounge. Again, great food, service and drinks. I had a suite and it was the best way to go...over the top views and room size if you can afford. ICON is also a school and has its dorms and classrooms attached. I will stay here again. Club 65 room, free mini bar stuff, great staff and room, what more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: TxTxAustin
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at the ICON for 3 nights in June. Our expectations were way exceeded! Because we had a group, with a large number of bags, we requested a van to pick us up at the hotel. This was done swiftly and efficiently. Upon arrival at the hotel, staff met us in the driveway, and led us to a personalized check-in in our rooms. There is no question...the staff here is a major part of the ICON's success, and they really care! The ICON is busy....there were 2 large conference meetings taking place while we were there. However, we never once felt as if we couldn't get top-notch service or a question answered. The concierge at the front door, and the one who answered my phone calls were always helpful, and never seemed to be rushed (refreshing!). We splurged for the Club rooms.....with a harbor view. This is absolutely worth every penny. The harbor view from the 23rd floor is world class. The Club price also grants entry to breakfast (delicious) and an evening happy hour (fab, with lights of HK). One evening we ordered steamed dumplings in the bar, and they were really great. We ate twice in the Market, and it was just fine. Again, the staff was so friendly and helpful, and service was super fast. The pool was gorgeous and the gym was fab. There has been much written here about the rooms, and ours was wonderful. Great bed, pillows, wireless, charging station in desk, huge TV, incredible shower and bath....all very clean. The housekeeping staff stopped me in the hall one day to ask if we would prefer more of a certain type of drink. There was just one pleasant surprise after another at this place! Our group did NOT want to leave the Hotel ICON. I"m certainly happy we chose to stay there, and chose to stay there last on our long journey (we were spoiled after the ICON). l just can't write enough nice things about this fabulous hotel and its hard-working employees. I'm afraid I will judge all other hotels by this one now, and this one is certainly hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay for me and my wife.”
Reviews.Author: calref
Reviews.Content: Probably the best room i have ever stayed in , I arrived at the hotel at about 1p.m. they could only check us in at about 3.30p.m. , apart from that nothing else I can think to complain about.The Above and Beyond restaurant is classy but very pricey, the staff is very well groomed and proficient. Highly recomended if price is really not a constraint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nwest_mail
Reviews.Content: The service provided at Hotel Icon is fantastic and so attentive. The facilities are still in as new condition and the view from the pool is something to remember. The rooms are very well set out and provide many amenities that most hotels neve think of. The free mini bar certainly makes life pretty easy as does the stationery set provided. The cocktails in the club lounge provided you with any choice you desired and were served whilst viewing the nightly light show. We made good use of the free shuttle and the location is only a few minutes form 2 metro stations that provide access to the whole island. A great stay

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler127
Reviews.Content: I could rave about this hotel for days - as a quick list it starts from: - The amazing infinity pool overlooking the entire HK skyline - A wonderful chair in the room with the same view - Incredibly comfy beds and great bathrooms - Impeccably polite staff (which includes everyone from concierge to cleaning staff) Down to the little quirky things like the mini bar being free and they stock stamps for postcards at the front desk, everything was brilliantly thought through and well executed. This comes from people who are usually very pernickety and difficult about the hotels, we travel a huge amount for business with our company and are rarely so impressed. We loved our stay and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: OconeeCP
Reviews.Content: Modern, up-to-date and full of amenities. Nothing overlooked. Club level stay recommended because of all the "extras." Stayed one week and wish it had been longer!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Black_Ste
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong was at the last leg of our 13 day China-HK trip. We reached Hong Kong from Guangzhou in Mainland China by train. I was initially doubtful about getting HK visa on arrival if we travelled by train. Thankfully it was an inspired move and visa was stamped on arrival with no problem. Trains are nice and comfortable and take just 2 hours and cost about 150 Yuan. On the plus side you reach right into the heart of Kowloon straight away compared to the HK airport which is a 200 HKD ride away from the city. You can see the sights on the way far better than if you were on a plane. Due to my mainland China trip taking one more night than planned, I was thinking of to cut short the Hong Kong leg of the trip to just one night, instead of the originally planned 2 nights. I had already shortlisted the hotel from Trip Advisor review and decided to go with Icon for its location, decor (I prefer the modern trendy decor with modern amenities in hotels to the classic style old world charm) and prices. Since my travel plan was not fixed, I could book at Icon only the day before. I was looking for a Icon 36 Harbour View room and to my dismay hotel listed only the higher priced Club suite rooms for the day. I had not budgeted for this and this came on top of the dismay of not getting the early bird 20% discount which is available for 14 days' advance booking. I then decided to book from other sources like hotel.com and they had listed Club 36 rooms as available. I was surprised why the hotel themselves do not have it, while other have. Went back to the hotel website and this time I could book what I wanted! We arrived in the afternoon and check in was very friendly and efficient. I knew the club rooms start from 23rd floor and hence requested if I can get 22nd or 21st floor. They said if I need to check in soon, then only 17th floor was available. If I could wait an hour they will give me 21st floor. Hmm.. I did not want to wait considering I was only there for a night. So took the 17th floor room. The hotel is in Tsim Sha Tsui, which is a central location with the highest concentration of hotels in HK. The Hung Hom MTR station is very near, but accessibility is never an issue with HK anyway. The hotel offers free shuttle to the key tourist areas within Tsim Sha Tsui making it easy for you to plan your trip. Despite the fact the hotel photos of the room view may make you believe you are right in front of the harbor, the hotel is a good 2-3 blocks away from harbor. May be the floors lower than 10th floor do not have any view of the harbor as they are blocked by buildings in the front. The higher floors have unhindered view. So don’t expect harbor view that you can get from say InterContinental Hong Kong which is right at the corner of the Victoria harbor with possibly 270 degree view of the harbor. I had initially eyed the InterContinental but their harbor view rooms were nearly double what Icon HV rooms would cost. IC is also a bit dated compared to the newly built Icon. My first impression of the hotel was very positive, despite the fact the lobby or porch were just good and nothing special as is common with city hotels as opposed to resort hotels. The hotel and its decor is very trendy and modern, something which I found quite likeable. The room was not very big, but roomy enough, very elegantly furnished with quality materials. The amenities were good; the mini bar (no alcohol) was totally free and replenished daily. The view from the 17th floor is quite good, but felt it did not fully represent the best view of the city skyline that is renowned as the best in the world. Having stayed at the Hyatt on the bund at Shanghai, I felt that Shanghai hotel had even better view despite Hong Kong having far better skyline. This is not to say the Icon Harbour View was disappointing, it is just fantastic, but just mentioning that Icon do not have the best location to do justice to the view HK has on offer. Icon of course do not charge as much others hotels who do have such view. What Icon have in plenty, and what raises it a notch above, is of course the service. Smiling, caring, helping, always available and yet unobtrusive, this was the best service we experienced in our entire 13 day trip that included 7 hotels some of them costing more and being rated higher than Icon. Young, enthusiastic, smiling staff are everywhere possibly because the hotel trains a lot of students and the trainees do not betray their rawness. On the contrary I feel the eagerness and freshness of youth rubs in on even the seasoned staff and the result is a perfect marriage of experience and exhuberance. The concierge was fantastic, ready with maps, tips and umbrellas when it rained. We did not try any of the hotel restaurants or pubs, but had in-room dining a couple of times and liked the food. We just went briefly to the pool which is on the 9th floor. The pool is an open terrace one, but is a bit small. The pool is actually closer to the harboor and thus has better view of the harbor and is a nice place to relax. Being small, it can get crowded a bit too soon. Realizing one night is not going to do justice to the Hong Kong city, we extended the stay by one night more. That gave us some breathing space to explore the city further and to spend time to spend at this wonderful hotel. The best part of the stay at the hotel was when we had checked out. We had our flight at 10pm in the night. Hotel readily agreed to extend the check out time from 12 noon to 2pm. The best part is that those who need to check out late can keep the luggages with concierge and get the keycard for the 9th floor. This allows you to use the 9th floor facilities free of cost EVEN AFTER you have checked out. You have thus access to the pool, change rooms, a lounge with free beverages (which include an Espresso machine, tea, water and soft drinks), fruit bowl and comfortable lounge chairs which allows you to stretch your legs while reading magazines which are supply. We could even use the Wi-Fi briefly. This was a very special touch as this allowed us to visit the city for the last time in the noon, then come back by 6pm, freshen up, change the dress and have some coffee and then head for the airport by 7.30pm. I think this is a very nice touch taking care of guests who have already checked out. Well done Icon. This clearly shows Icon do care. As we had our luggage taken into the cab, the staff including receptionist came to inquire about the stay. We said farewell as we would when visiting the friends. Hmm...it was very nice way to end the hectic trip and we were glad we were at the Icon. While the lure of trying a new hotel next time lingers, I would not be unhappy to go back to Icon again. In fact I would look forward to it. Thank you Icon! I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone interested.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgeguy88
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is simply excellent, especially given its price. I believe it is linked to a local tourism school. The staff were extremely helpful. They all spoke excellent English, and helped me plan my journeys around Hong Kong, to the airport and to Macau. And even though my flight out of Hong Kong was at 1am they let me use the gym, sauna and pool until I left. The rooftop pool, with poolside bar service, was luxurious. The gym was also excellently equipped. There were free bottles of mineral water and apples everywhere. The room itself was very comfortable and lavishly designed, with lots of new furniture and a large bed. It had free wifi, several English TV channels, free local calls and a free minibar. I was upgraded to a harbour room view for free. There is a separate, large walk-in shower plus a bath. The location is very central, less than five minutes' walk to a metro station. There is a shopping centre and many shops, restaurants, banks and pharmacies across the street. There is also a free shuttle bus into the centre of town every 20 minutes. Although excellent in all respects, there are always some areas for improvement. The breakfast was very pricey, but it wasn't difficult to find cheap, local food a few steps from the hotel entrance. The free shuttle bus into town was much appreciated and left every 20 minutes, but it wasn't immediately obvious where the bus was supposed to stop (there was no sign). This minor point could be easily improved.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angelo S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Icon is a cool hotel with rooms and bathroom to match. The staff are friendly and try to assist as much as possible. Restaurant and bars within the hotel are good but a little expensive. Overall had a great stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to hong kong. There is a free shuttle bus which takes you to two main drop of points which was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: Scorpioworld
Reviews.Content: After much net surfing and going thorugh travellers' reviews , booked Hotel Icon in Hongkong for 1 night . As advised by fellow travellers , expected a confortable stay but it was much beyond that. From the moment you drive into this hotel , you are greeted like a special guest by the wam , friendly , courteous English speaking staff and a feeling of openess and space surrounds you . Check in was pretty quick , excellent sylish room , designer toliet and had good vaastu vibes to the room. We had booked a harbour facing room and were not disappointed ! In the evening we switched off all the lights inside the room and enjoyed glamour of Hongkong and great harbour view from our room window with a glass of wine ! Centrally located in Kowloon , it is a real treat to walk around in the evenings with so many diffrent kind of cuisine restaurants with the harbour view. Breakfast was not included in the room rate but offered at a special rate . It turned out to be a great classy affair with a lot of selection to choose from around the world and could not have asked for anything better ! On the whole , we loved our stay in the hotel with full marks to immpecable service by the trained staff. Would stay there gaian next time and also recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Amiekork
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, from June 18-June 20. We had booked the city view king size bed room. The view was amazing and even had view of the Harbour. The room was spacious, the bed was huge, the whole room arrangement and decoration was modern and fresh. Wonderful bathroom! The wifi was for free and very fast, mini bar was for free as well! We had buffet lunch and dinner at the Market, located in the 2nd floor of the hotel. It absolutely worthed it! The staff was very friendly and helpful, very fast and efficient service. The location is very good as well, very near Harbour City (if you want to go shopping!) In the past we have stayed in many different hotels in Hong Kong (and have payed even double price than Icon) but I must say, this hotel is absolutely the best value for money! For me is a straight 10. Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “TOP NOTCH GUEST SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ModernTraveler10
Reviews.Content: Easy to see why this hotel is rated #1 in Hong Kong. Guest service and experience is off the charts. super strong. everyone from Door Hosts, to Front Desk Associates, Concierge, Housekeeping, Bell staff, restaurant staff were very attentive and outstanding. Cody rocked it at the Concierge Desk. gave us solid suggestions of what to see during our 3 day/night stay. I work in Hospitality so it gave me some great examples to come back and share with my staff. suggest it strongly. view of Hong Kong island was great. would suggest a room with view. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: manbarbs
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeds all expectations. The staff is polite, attentive and speak english. The rooms are very modern, clean and amazing views of Hong Kong. Well worth the money

Reviews.Title: “great cool sleek”
Reviews.Author: Memphis K
Reviews.Content: stay 3 nights cos of the good review of tripadvisor, location wise, 7 min walk to hung hom station, the area there is like the late 70s /80s, which is fine. the room is spacious, king size bed is rare! view is fantastic, the harbour view rm. only comment is i thought there is free fruit like apples daily with the newspaper as stated in their welcome letter on the desk, but i did not have any apple for the 4 days. (strange as why stated there if dosen't provide any?) another issue is the reading light, they got the on/off switch wrongly connected. each time u need to turn on/off, u need to walk to other side . i hope they can rectify it since it has been operate close to a year.(rm 2214) overall is good, probably becos is under the hong kong polytechnic school(tourism).. whatever u request , they will try to attend to yr needs! the pool is cool as u can have the whole harbour view !

Reviews.Title: “Mold on bread for bread bowl”
Reviews.Author: Dee G
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is modern, clean and aesthetically pleasing. The service is just OK. I stayed at the Landis Hotel in Taipei for five nights before flying into Hong Kong for a four night stay in April 2012. The staff at Landis is amazingly trained - they showed us to our room, went over the amenities with us, and was even washed a few of our personal items w/o cost. The service at Icon was just like any other big chain, four-star hotel - pleasant, but impersonal. We booked a harbor view room for our stay, and we ended up in a room that had a view of rooftops and city. Sure, there was a view of the harbor, when we looked to the left side of our window and even then it was only a partial view. I didn't make a fuss about it b/c I figure we weren't going to be in our hotel much. I still wanted to give my mom the experience of the HK skyline since this trip was for her 60th bday. Finally, the moldy bread. Since it's been two months since the incident, I'm not as disgusted by the thought of what happened. My mother and I ordered a soup bowl from the restaurant in the lobby. The top of the sour dough bread had mold!!! The staff apologized, and offered to bring a brand new bowl. That's it! No offer of comp'ing the clam and oyster chowder (which was sub-par), no extras, nada. For a hotel which is so highly regarded for service on Tripadvisor, my stay at ICON was forgettable and somewhat regrettable.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: hotbath
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a good hotel with the best value in Hong Kong. With the hotel Icon, I have made the best choice. The hotel is new, good location and everything works well. It's an easy journey from the airport. With airport express train to Kowloon and then switch to hotel bus K3, you will there in 30-45 minutes. You don't need a taxi. The staff is young, friendly and fast. Some of the staff are students. The rooms are modern and comfortable and everything of good quality. The restaurant Market beats everything. The food is top class. If you are hungry, take the buffet with big choices, otherwise the menu. We also can recommend the wine. The price is just right. I stayed in hotel Icon two times. Once in room Nr. 2719, which was top class with nespresso machine, and once in room Nr. 2216, which was standard. Both rooms with side view of the harbour. Minibar is free. This is a very nice present. Negative is the coffee in the lounge by the main lobby. You pay HK$ 50 for a coffee to go in the paper cup. Also the treatments in the spa are expensive. It was our plan to take massages, but we didn't try. They announce 90 minutes, but the massage is only 30 minutes, the difference of 30 minutes is for the relaxing time. Overall, the hotel is definitely Travelers Choice 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Book in and don't check out!”
Reviews.Author: Tk116
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel. My husband and I booked into a Club 36 Harbour room for 3 nights. The check in was smooth and fast. The room was lovely...large, modern, clean, great view, comfortable bed, soft pillows, self controlled a/c, great view, lovely bathroom, nicely fit out, great view, free mini bar and snacks in the room, nespresso machine with pods, free wifi, great toiletries, and have I mentioned great view! There was no need to leave the room to watch the light show each night...the view was incredible! As part of this room rate, we were also entitled to the above and beyond club. This included a free afternoon tea (cupcakes, macaroons, cakes, scones, tea/coffee etc) each day from 3-5 and then an hour later, we were able to indulge in good quality Ïcocktails, spirits on ice, beer etc with canapés from 6-8. The service on each visit was impeccable. The staff and students made you feel warmly welcomed and all were extremely professional. Breakfast was served each morning in the same area...a small buffet with freshly cooked hot meals from an expansive choice of popular options. Again, staff were incredible. We also ate a couple of nights in the hotel restaurants. Both the above and beyond club area restaurant and the market were fabulous. The quality of food was exceptional! This is the type of hotel you never want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nooneelsehasthisname
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights, Icon was a haven in the hot humid bustling and vibrant city of Hong Kong. Extremely professional. Whilst hotel is a teaching hotel for the university many staff are the usual paid staff and some are supervisors who keep a very keen eye on the students so service is of an exceptionally high standard. We had a 65 square suite with a panoramic view across the harbour from 2 huge windows. The suite was huge with 2 toilets, 2 big TVs, very large bath and massive shower, large separate lounge with an office area. Lots of little touches to make you feel pampered and the suite entitles you the use of the Above and Beyond Restaurant which also has a sensational view with afternoon tea then evening cocktails and nibbles included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “The finest and friendliest place to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: rossnagh
Reviews.Content: From entering the hotel after an overnight flight from heathrow we were greated like members of a long lost family. Our first impression was one of a fabulously modern hotel but unlike the multinationals this hotel was fitted out to the highest standard yet still provided us with the highest standard of comfort, which proved a godsend later in our stay. Unfortunately both my wife and I contracted a rather unpleasant virus, which resulted us being confined in turn to the room, and to help us a member of the reception team escorted my wife to the nearest pharmacy and enabled her to purchase the necessary drugs to help alleviate the problem. The hotel, which is owned by a Hong Kong University, provides an ideal training ground for future high quality hoteliers.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible disgusting experience”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: After the experience of the Hotel Icon I am intentionally writing my first review on trip advisor. Hotel Icon is the worst ever hotel we have stayed at. We always spend good money and stay at high end hotels on our holidays and usually the price we pay reflects the service that we expect. After reading all the reviews on trip advisor we decided to opt for the Hotel Icon over the famous Shangri La. Big Mistake. The allure of staying at this concept hotel as well as the harbor view rooms we decided to pre book and pay for two nights stay. Firstly our flight was delayed from Brisbane and we arrived in HK later than expected and we were at the hotel at 10am. The rudeness of the woman who checked us in will not be forgotten. We were abruptly informed that our check in would be at 2pm. As we had arrived earlier than the check in time and as we were extremely tired after a sitting on a delayed plane for a total of over 9 hours I was prepared to pay a full night stay for the four hours until check in. I was rudely told no. I probed and advised her that we both had a long flight and we just wanted to rest and shower, again this employee disregarded our requests and informed us to take the shuttle bus to the Shopping Centre. Clearly not travelled in her life or inept at understanding that the main concern here is that we want to rest, her attempts to pawn us off until 2pm were quite distasteful. We found her to be unresponsive and rude. We did not want to go shopping nor did we express any desire to but she continually insisted we take advantage of the free shuttle and go to the shopping centre. The fact that we were ready to pay for a room for a few hours as opposed to expecting us to be checked in earlier was clearly above her intelligence. We informed her that we just wanted to rest but she offered no explanation or reason as to why this was not possible. If the hotel were booked up fine we would have gone elsewhere but nothing. Interestingly enough, whilst we were at the desk another guest checked out and stated his room number to which she immediately scribbled down on a check in room card for us. Clearly she was under the impression that we are stupid to not work out that the room she had given us was this other guests and obviously would have taken time to be prepared. In the end she suggested we go up to the lobby on the 9th floor and we can use the showers there. Not having the energy to complain we decided to do this. Why she did not offer this to us in the first place is a mystery. We showered but were left unimpressed by our treatment and to make the situation worse, another guest took offence that we had our luggage with us in the lounge room. There was no facility to iron any of our clothes and furthermore we had to take turns to shower as we had all of our valuables with us. We then decided to leave the hotel and as we had pre paid we decided to return after 2pm. When we arrived I informed the staff member who I believe was Tim a supervisor of some sort of our experience at check in. He was a shining example of natural stupidity. To this day I have never been spoken to in such a patronizing way. I am amazed that someone is prepared to pay this man a wage. I explained to him that I was left unimpressed with the way our check in was handled and wanted some explanation as to why there was no option to even pay for another room. He did manage to tell me that they were fully booked as I suspected, why they did not feel comfortable telling me that is a mystery perhaps him and his colleague earlier were both not telling the truth. He attempted to explain that our room was not ready and then proceeded to inform me that hotels around the world have check in at 2pm and onwards and no hotel would let you check in earlier. Clearly shocked at the way I was being spoken to he continually informed me about how all the ‘top hotels’ in HK as well as the rest of the world had the same check in policy. I think he clearly misunderstood what the issue was and when I suggested to him that we were not impressed with his tone or what he was saying he preceded to laugh. He informed me again that all the top hotels have the same check in policy and they wouldn’t allow a guest to pay a full nights rate for four hours stay, as this would be seen as ripping off guests. I’m not sure if this employee had worked at top hotels however he continually tried to educate me on how 5 star hotels operated. Of limited capacity and lacking the basic understanding of what was being said to him he continued to repeat the same thing again and again. Having the privilege of staying at some excellent 5 star hotels as well as some of the best restaurants in the world I have never been spoken to like that before. Arrogant beyond justification and completely incompetent at explaining why there was such an issue when we checked in he jokingly apologized to which left me incensed. I could understand the complete rudeness of the first employee but this chap did an excellent job at illustrating ignorance. I am still baffled as to how this hotel could get so many positive reviews and yet treat us in this pathetic manner. To say this experience ruined our stay would be an understatement. I think these two employees need to be addressed as they have clearly limited capacity in listening or being attentive to us as their guests. I would not return to the Hotel Icon even if I were offered a free flight and free stay. This experience as well as the overall impression of the hotel leaves no doubt that this hotel is not 5 star. The lobby is impressive and the harbor view room is small. All the reviews of the showers are correct and the smell of the water, which is left after showering, is clearly an issue. As some of the reviews suggest that this is a college hotel perhaps they can teach their staff not to be so inept at understanding a simple request. We were not approached by any management or even offered an apology from the shocking service we received. Our stay at the Hotel Icon reinforced the fact that clearly some service sector employees are of limited intelligence and not able to grasp simple instructions. However it must be noted that the chap at the swimming pool and another whose name I did not know greeted us warmly every time we passed him. The location isn’t great however was fine for the purpose of our stay. In future I will keep to the big name hotels and certainly avoid amateur ‘concept hotels’ with idiotic staff members.

Reviews.Title: “In a league of its own”
Reviews.Author: DevonMcSchnitzel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early June with my girlfriend, based on the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor. We have travelled a lot over the past 3 years, staying in some really great 4 and 5 star places, and this is THE BEST hotel we've stayed in. Phenomenal service. Fantastic rooms and great location. Did I mention the service? Really extraordinary. Definitely worth paying the extra for the Club class. Free cocktails in the spectacular bar on the 28th floor each night. Afternoon tea and food. Wonderful hotel. Can't fault it in any way. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves all the praise”
Reviews.Author: wrightone
Reviews.Content: This place really punches above it weight. The staff are pleasant and can't do enough to help. The rooms are stylish and well laid out as are the common areas. There is a surprisingly large pool with great views over Hong Kong harbour. Several excellent restaurants are nearby. The metro can be reached within a 5-10 minute walk and nothing is far away. I really liked this place and thought the staff made a real difference. Will stay here again next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Service + Modern rooms + Attention to detail!!!”
Reviews.Author: PWatt79
Reviews.Content: Yup, these guys know how to run a hotel. The service you get from the minute you arrive to when you check out is flawless. The guys on the front desk were only too happy to help me out when organising a dinner for a group from work and went above and beyond many times over the period of our stay here. The food for breakfast and lunch at the hotel restaurant is amazing. Huge variety, fresh and modern. The pool up towards the top floor is big enough to do laps if you need to work out and if your not a swimmer, the gym is also very large and modern... or you could just enjoy a beer next to the pool and let the other guests do all the exercise. I'd return here on my next visit to Hong Kong, well done Hotel Icon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GG2006
Reviews.Content: It would be a pity to stay here and not enjoy all the amenities. My room was beautifully appointed, with the little things done nicely. Bathroom with rain shower was superb, especially as the humid weather meant a shower after any extensive trip outdoors. The pool was glorious, whether for a gentle swim, or to relax in the afternoon breeze. Service attentive without being obtrusive. Went to breakfast on two mornings, and enjoyed the delicious choice, and being able to relax and plan the day. dining room not quiet and calm, very restful. Reading the reviews, yes, I'd upgrade to harbour view (at least) next time.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Honkers”
Reviews.Author: WineloverMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Like most of the other reviewers I found the Hotel ICON to live up to the expectations from Tripadvisor. As previously stated the rooms are not large but large enough and extreemly comfortable. We upgrade to a harbour view on the 17th floor and it was spectacular at night, by day you see the top of all the lower buildings. The bed was one of most comfortable I have found in any hotel and the bathroom was just about perfect. It had a "rain" shower as well as a normal hand held /fixed shower. The mirror was heated so it didn't fog up and it had a magnifying mirror as well. A trap for the unititiated, the lights go on automatically when you enter the room, however on the first day as entering I flipped what I thought was the light switch only to find out later when our room wasn't made up that it was the do-not-disturb sign. Fortunately they made the room up around 4.00pm. On the first night we went to the Above and Beyond restaurant, the food was good Chinese. We had two soups, one prawn dish and a beer and a wine, the total cost $700 HKD, around $90 AUD. even by Australian standards it is expensive. We checked out The Market and the buffet looked amazing, heaps of seafood and every possible type of meat and the desserts were spectacular. It cost around $60 AUD and if we had an appetite to do it justice I would have went. Our package didn't include breakfast so rather than go the hotel buffet breakfast acros the road is a chinese restaurant, Tai Hing which serves a great chinese/western breakfast for around $28 HKD around $4 AUD. You get a bowl of noodles with cabbage plus scrambled eggs, ham, toast and a coffee, amazing! Also up Moby road is Delifrance and they also have a good breakfast for around $4 AUD. If you use the gym and one of the treadmills you can check out the internet or watch TV whilst overlooking the pool. The East Tsim Sha Tsui bus depot and train station is also just up Moby road if you want to explore further.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I Chose It”
Reviews.Author: walkabout59
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stopover in HK and decided to stay at the Icon a try primarily to try out their harbour view rooms. I took the Airport Express train to Kowloon and then the complimentary bus from there to the hotel. Check-in was expeditious and courteous. The view from my room was probably great, but as my luck would have it, it rained the whole night! The windows did not open at all, so no chance even to squeeze a camera lens through unfortunately, since the window glass was spattered with rain, making photography nigh impossible. The room itself was very comfortably furnished and the king-sized bed was very comfortable indeed. The bathroom, somewhat funky in design, was very functional and had a nice big rainshower. Surprisingly the mini bar was complimentary, but disappointingly contained only soft drinks! A room service breakfast was delivered promptly, was of a high standard, and it was great to be able to dine sitting in front of the window enjoying the (still rainy) view. I found the best rate through myhotelguru. When I go back again, apart from staying longer, I think I would definitely choose the Club room to be on a higher floor and have an even better harbour view. Hopefully it'll not be in the rainy season!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: 13Andrew
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I couldn't be happier with the service and our stay at the Hotel ICON. My wife and I honeymooned in Paris with two nights in Hong Kong on the way home. We arrived in Hong Kong early in the morning and my wife wasn't well but the concierge was able to arrange an early check-in for us so she could get some rest. From that point onwards it was clear we'd chosen the right place to stay. As it is, my wife talks more about the hotel in Hong Kong than our time in the city of love!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMMSeatte
Reviews.Content: The room was large and clean with an incredible view (see photo). The staff was very helpful. The living wall in the lobby, which extends into the bar, is lovely. The exercise facility is modern and also has an incredible view. The location is great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: katri0na
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Icon for three nights in January. We chose this hotel based on all the rave reviews it got on tripadviser. Maybe my expectations were to high because of all the hype, but I didn't find anything about the hotel as outstanding as I was expecting based on all the reviews. Don't get me wrong, it's a good hotel, but for me it lacked that extra special something that makes a good hotel into a great hotel you'd want to go back to. With all the fantastic hotels in Hong Kong, I'm actually suprised that this one has such a high rating. For me, the best thing about the hotel was the harbour view from our room. It's deffinetly worth paying extra for the view. Another thing I enjoyed about our room was the rain shower - probably the best shower I've ever used. Other than that the room is pretty much what you'd expect from a modern hotel, but nothing too special, "design" hotel rooms are usually much more interesting. At the Icon, it looks like much more effort was put into designing the lobby and other public spaces than into designing the rooms. Nothing wrong with it, just not the type of room that you'll remember for long or one that you would want to take photos of. Our rate didn't include breakfast and we didn't have any meals at the hotel. I did want to order room service on our first night, but the menu turned out to be limited and pretty boring, so we went out instead. The lobby bar seemed to be popular and crowded most of the time, so it must be good. The location is pretty good. They offer a free shuttle service, but we didn't use it and walked everywhere. The area has many dining and shopping options, so you don't even have to venture out too far if you don't want to. Staff is efficient, but nothing you wouldn't expect from a hotel of this class. Overall, if you get a good rate for the harbour view rooms, hotel Icon is a solid option for staying in Hong Kong. However, I wouldn't stay there again. And for our next stay in Hong kong I've already booked a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Premium service without premium prices”
Reviews.Author: lowsweeheng
Reviews.Content: Read reviews on Tripadvisor and decided to try out this hotel although it is slightly off the main tourist haunts of the city. After all, it is ranked the second favourite hotel of travelers to Hong Kong on the site. I certainly wasn't disappointed. From the convenience of the airport express shuttle sending you the hotel directly, to the ultra modern lobby with a welcoming fragrance (unlike the musty smells of some hotel lobbies), to the excellent staff who checked me in, to the excellent modern room that ensured a peaceful and comfortable stay (there was even a TV in from of the bath tub!!!!), to the excellent housekeeper who ensured the room was tip top my whole stay and always had a smile, to the concierge who took pains to help me write my destination addresses in Chinese since I don't speak Cantonese and would need that in case the taxi drivers did not speak English or Mandarin, to the friendly staff who were ever helpful throughout my 5 day stay. The free wifi, soft drinks and chocs were a bonus! I have to say that all that was said about the hotel is true. Yes, location wise it may not be most central and it is a 10 min walk to the MTR, but this is a small inconvenience. The swimming pool was a bit of a let down as well as it is rather small and when other guests were smoking there, it is not the nicest place to relax. But these are really more than made up for by the excellent service and the great room. I certainly know where to stay when I am in Hong Kong from now onwards. What summed up the hotel experience for me was the check out experience. As I walked out of the lift, I was greeted by staff who took care of my bag. The checkout itself took 2 mins and I was asked to sit in the lobby and the staff would get me when the airport express shuttle came. Once the shuttle came, they loaded the shuttle and I simply boarded the bus. The shuttle then went to a few more 5 star hotels which cost a lot more. In each of the stops, the guests were waiting outside the hotel by themselves and struggled to load their luggage onto the shuttle. That summed by the difference in the service provided by the Icon staff. Thanks guys and you will definitely see me again on my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and great views”
Reviews.Author: Oldsurfer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Icon for 4 nights in June 2012, great hotel. Rooms modern and practical, I had Harbour views and was amazing - floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom is kind of in the room and divided by the back of the bed. Shower is good, shower/wet room, but small bath. Hotel has a great location, walking distance to tube, bars and restaurants. Staff were great and very helpful for things to do and places to eat. I only had breakfast in the hotel and was just average, the hotel bar was OK but not that great. Overall I would return - just make sure you get a room with harbour views!

Reviews.Title: “New 5 stars hoel in hongkong clean room beautiful view from club 65 room good service”
Reviews.Author: Suneesiri
Reviews.Content: Good service clean room good view from club65 room new hotel will go back again

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel on Grand Scale”
Reviews.Author: ThrillingMe
Reviews.Content: Near the Hung Hom MTR station and at the end of the TST promenade walk and around the corner from the old Shangri-la - this is the new kid on the block for hotels in Kowloon. It's kinda like the W hotel experience but not quite. The club rooms have great views of the Harbour, have a TV set built 'into' the bathtube, a cool all points shower and 'free' refilled softdrinks fridge. The bed is comfortable and the overall design is tasteful. The gym area is surprisingly extensive and the pool is almost a horizon pool - only problem is that it spends a fair amount of time in the shade of surrounding skyscrapers so always seems cooler than it should. A big attraction is the world famous Thai originating Banyan Tree spa - outstanding. The only negative of this hotel is that the lobby cafe/bar was poorly serviced while we were there but as this was the only complaint it's a hotel that comes with our strong recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Delight”
Reviews.Author: Kerry123000
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Icon is a must hotel to stay if you’re headed to Hong Kong. The staff could not do enough for my family & I. The rooms was tastefully decorated, clean and had everything you could want- they even threw in a free mini bar - less the alcohol of course. Sometimes I thought there was more staff than guests and I must say there was nothing they wouldn’t do for us. The view from every window is spectacular overlooking the harbour and city that sometimes we didn't want to leave the rooms but with great shopping in walking distance from the Hotel we did it all. The “Above” restaurant on the 28th floor, I would say was the best meal I had in my 5 weeks travelling through Europe, I’m still talking about it now to friends and I’ve been home for a week. My comment to Hotel Icon is well done and thank you for a memorable 4 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Emma R
Reviews.Content: A beautifully modern hotel with everything you could think of to make your stay relaxing. I adored coming back to the hotel after a busy day out in the city sightseeing and jumping into the roof top pool. It was such a relaxing hotel with m & ms and soft drinks free of charge in your room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of heading to Hong Kong a perfect location with the best service I have ever received in a hotel. Well done Hotel Icon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bryano1976
Reviews.Content: The ICON was just finishing its soft opening when I stayed in June 2011, however the level of service provided was akin to an already established venue, which is testament to the hard work and professionalism of the staff. We stayed in a Club 60 Suite which was fantastic, very spacious with all modern amenities, the bathroom in particular was excellent with a separate bath and Rain Shower and spotlessly clean. The view from the room to HK Island was absolutely spectacular and worth the nightly rate in itself! The club suite comes with access to the Above and Beyond bar on the top floor of the hotel, where you can get free drinks and canapés for a couple of hours in the evening if you wish. I would recommend getting Benny the bar tender to prepare you a Mojito, absolutely delicious. I ate at the Chinese Restaurant on the top floor and I'd rate it as one of the best Chinese establishments I have had the pleasure of eating in, well worth the visit if a little on the expensive side. The Market Restaurant for breakfast was excellent with a huge range of foods from all o eR the world to satisfy the most eclectic of tastes, the Dim Sum were exceptional. The SPA was not open when I visited due to the soft opening so I cannot comment on the services. The pool was very nice, my only criticism was the fact that only 8 sun loungers were provided which is clearly not enough for the size of the hotel. The ICON is one of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying in and I cannot wait for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, with a minor gripe or two”
Reviews.Author: Howeser
Reviews.Content: Lovely looking hotel, stylish rooms. Thoughtful touches ie free m&ms, cute Hong Kong maps, etc. Service was professional, friendly and responsive. Check in and out was smooth. Beautiful views both from our room and from the pool/gym area. Well located for shopping along Granville Rd etc. Minor gripes: Access to Above and Beyond level 28 bar/restaurant (prior to 8pm) is restricted to club members or those who paid extra for access. This seemed a bit cheap for a hotel of this calibre - this isn't a low cost airline - it should be part of the offering for all guests. Breakfast is nice but expensive even for hotel standards. Tips - look into offers that include breakfast and access to Above and Beyond. It would have been a good spot to watch the light show (if we'd been allowed in). Shop around for deals before booking/paying they can vary. The Harbour view rooms are worth the additional spend.

Reviews.Title: “My fav hotel in Asia”
Reviews.Author: ExpatFromNY
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend Hotel Icon highly enough! I frequently travel internationally and I can say this hotel is easily within the top 5 hotels I have ever stayed in, including other 5 star hotels, LHW, etc. The rooms are very comfortable, the decor is chic but not cold, the shower is heaven, the bed is incredibly comfortable, the food at all of the restaurants is outstanding, and the wine lists are very well chosen. More importantly however is the staff. The staff continually went above and beyond the call of duty. One of the concierges, Alvin, was absolutely angelic in helping me deal with my lost luggage, as well as suggesting a computer store in which i purchased a new laptop at $500USD below what i would've paid in New York. Tina, another concierge was incredibly helpful in outfitting the room to my specifications before arrival, including stocking the free mini bar with my requested beverages. Joey (female) in the spa gave me the best massage and pedicure I have ever had. In sum, for someone who travels extensively I am blown away by Hotel Icon. I wouldn't stay anywhere else (including the Peninsula & Mandarin) in Hong Kong. This place has solidified my return patronage.

Reviews.Title: “Quality furnishings and warm, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: herbsandspices
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised and amazed at the use of quality furnishings in the hotel. There were some clever design elements such as subtly hidden wardrobe and the curved bathroom door, which saves a lot of space in the room and is fun. Although the shade of brown of the wood finish was not my favourite, I was very impressed with the room. The bathroom was well decked out too, although it could do with one more hook or towel bar. The shower stall had a surprising curved design that was roomier than it looked. And the bathtub was deep! There was a TV just above the bathtub. Unfortunately, it did not work and I was not prepared to have a technician come over that late at night. From the Club Floor at least, the harbour view was absolutely stunning. The hotel was staffed with permanent staff and interns. Service was cheerful and warm. It was mostly great, although there was one who served us our in-room dining who did not really know what she was doing. Overall, we were well served and enjoyed the stay tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: mtangulo
Reviews.Content: First time visiting Hong Kong, we wanted a nice place with a nice view and a nice price! All in one this hotel is top in value for your money! It is a great spot, great service, nice lobby cafe and bar, nice retaurant. I loved the room and the bathroom all minmalistic but cool. The free mini bar with m&m was a hit!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, amazing service, great views, 24 hour gyms, pool overlooking the harbour, chic deco... this hotel has everything!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful respite in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: duckleader
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of a stay at the ICON for 4 days in May 2012. Upgraded to the club level for minimal expense and worth every penny! The hotel has a lovely contemporary decor and does not compromise on comfort. The lobby living green wall is among the more unique features I have seen and leaves quite an impression! The room was spacious, well designed, with a beautiful harbor view and a WONDERFUL bathroom. We consulted the concierge many times for tour and restaurant information and were given offbeat, good local restaurant options and recommendations. Hit the happy hour at the club level, you will not be disappointed! Free flowing French champagne (not sparkling wine), good wine and cocktails. Breakfast was very good and very extensive, offering all Western and Asian options one could want. Also, we ate at the Above and Beyond chinese restaurant adjacent, really excellent service and very well prepared delicious cuisine. Great pool and workout area, the fitness facilities are state of the art. In Kowloon, this is a prime spot!

Reviews.Title: “I love icon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Idofei
Reviews.Content: Everytime we are coming back to this hotel we feel at home. This time we bring our new born 6 month baby and they was sure ready for him. We had a lovely bad in the bedroom, very clean and safe. We had a small tub just for babys and a set of shampoo and bath Jel from Johnson and Johnson. Very very impressive. Just when I thought this hotel can't surprise me any more we find out all the accessories for our boy and we was so happ with it. We stay in icon hotel already 5 times and we sure be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pauline010
Reviews.Content: Writing this review, lying by the poolside of the Hotel on the last day of our ten night stay. We have thoroughly enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere, created by the design of the hotel and the staff. We stayed in a Club 65 suite, which was on the 26th floor and has spectacular views over the harbour. The suite itself has a very generous lounge, with desk and refreshment bar area. There is a whole range of office stationery and a wireless printer. Obviously the complimentary mini bar, which does include beer. Nespresso machine also there. The lounge area has a table and two chairs in the window (floor to ceiling/wall to wall) area, with a curved sofa in the middle of the room, which could easily seat four persons. Large TV and a Blueray system also in this area. The nice part is that there are two screens, which push into the wall and can be pulled closed to separate the lounge from bedroom. Off the lounge, there is a washroom. Normally in these types of rooms, I end up pushing the table and chairs out of the way as they clutter the room but no need in this room - plenty of room here. The bedroom also has a full size window overlooking HK island and Victoria Harbour, which is spectacular by day but more so at night. Big winged chair and footstool in the window, huge bed (very comfortable) and a tv. The vanity area leads off the bedroom and from there the toilet is in one 'room' and the large bath, with shower wet area is in another 'room'. All these areas have frosted glass as walls, which does offer sufficient privacy if that is required. All of the lights are electronic, with keypads all over. Nice to come back to the room at night, as the Lights go on automatically to the 'relaxed' mode. Bose IPod sound sytem in bedroom. Rooms and hotel are very clean. Definately recommend spending the extra cash for a club room. We used the lounge daily for breakfast, which is a nice way to start the day. Afternoon tea is also nice, with little sweet and savoury nibbles. Cocktails and canapes are worth it also. All premium branded drinks included, as well as champagne. It is a very relaxed, adult space so I am glad the hotel maintains the policy of no children allowed as this would ruin the atmosphere. There are windows behind and either side of the lounge, which overlooks HK island and the light show at 8pm. We ate in the Above and Beyond restaurant a couple of times, which was fabulous. I have no idea how anybody could complain. Pool area generally quiet as most people are here on business. Water is a nice temperature, bit cool when you fist go in but very refreshing. Ate lunch here a couple of times. Good choice and good quality. Never used the gym but it looked well equipped and quite snazzy. Also had breakfast in the Market, which again had a massive choice. The overall feel of the hotel is clean, comfortable and relaxed. When you arrive, do not expect white gloved bellboys - they are dressed in cargo pants, desert boots and sweaters, which I liked and I think sets the tone of the hotel. All other staff are more smartly dressed. The hotel is a nine minute walk from exit P2 of the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR, which really is not far at all. There is plenty going on around the hotel for eateries, shops etc. The hotel has a free shuttle bus, which takes you to both the Peninsula Hotel shops or Harbour City, a mammoth shopping centre, which is also where the Star Ferry leaves for HK island. The staf are very friendly and attentive and are keen to meet your requests. The only minor niggle we had was the sometimes the bellboys are a bit slow in opening the doors, especially for people entering the hotel. It really is not a huge issue but you kind of expect it. On arrival, you are given a queationnaire for your preferences for a variety of things like room service times, air temperature, pillow quality and any other requests, which they do comply with. A nice touch. All in all, a great hotel and would definately recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: Goldens18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a wonderful four night stay at Hotel ICON. The hotel decor was wonderfully decorated, but the service is what stands out. The service is professional and attentive (but not annoyingly so). The rooms were very comfortable and the complimentary mini bar was icing on the top. It's a great hotel to come home too after a busy day of sightseeing. We also loved the fact that it had a free shuttle to/from Harbour City (huge shopping mall) throughout the day. We would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a hotel in HK. We'll stay at ICON again if we were to return to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this place is the best!”
Reviews.Author: 4onadventure
Reviews.Content: WOW what a fantastic hotel. The overall philosophy seems to be 'generosity'. So many complimentary services such as free mini bar, laundry ,breakfast, afternoon tea, cocktails!, Just unbelievable. This is coupled with excellent young staff who go out of their way to provide service. I haven't even mentioned the brilliant view from our club room 2513. I have about 300 photos of this gorgeous unobstructed view of the harbour and city . We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GP-USA
Reviews.Content: This place is simply amazing, I got the Club 65 Room, with a gorgeous view o the victoria harbor. They provide complimentary breakfast, wireless, in-room wet bar, drinks at the lounge, tea with sweets, and appetizers. The view of the show of lights in HK is amazing from this location the view is incredible. Furthmore I'm a fan of the Singapore Sling and this place has the best I've tried so far out of SG.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: Joanne2012_03
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 7 nights at Hotel ICON, and will be back to stay again next time we go to Hong Kong. The rooms were spacious, modern, and very clean, with the right mix of funky without being over-the-top. The bed was huge and very comfortable and the bathroom was big (for a hotel). We paid the little bit extra for a harbour view, which was pretty cool (I loved the neon lights of the city!). Also enjoyed the soft drinks and m&ms in the free mini bar, and the fruit platter which arrived in our room in the afternoon of our arrival was a very pleasant surprise. The staff were friendly and eager to please, especially the doormen who were quick to help you out of the taxi or shuttle and often carried our two-year old into the hotel to ensure he was safe. It is a fairly short distance to the trains - less than 10 minute easy walk (with a stroller), so coming from a country where we use public transport a lot this was perfectly fine for us. There is also a regular hotel shuttle bus to take you to the trains and the harbour too if you don't want to walk. We liked the location as the different activities we were doing were scattered all over Hong Kong so this was pretty central to everywhere. We had the buffet breakfast at The Market on the morning we went to Disneyland, which was very good quality and excellent range, and a standard price for a hotel breakfast (not cheap) but we ate well so didn't need much else to eat for the rest of the day. We didn't opt for the "Club" level room as have a two-year old so too young for the Above and Beyond lounge, and were often out sight-seeing until the evening so wouldn't be able to make the use of the afternoon tea and cocktails at night or relax over breakfast every morning. When departing we used the free Airport shuttle to take us to Kowloon Station and did the in-town check-in for our flight and got the express train to the airport. This was brilliant - the shuttle came promptly and just a couple of quick stops and we were at the train station, no queues to check-in for our flight (a massive plus when you have a two year old), cheaper than taxi, and probably quicker too as no traffic issues to worry about. I was amazed and wished that more cities had this system. Next time we'll use it to get us to the hotel as well. I find picking a hotel the hardest part of planning a holiday, and when I read the reviews and then booked I was really hoping it lived up to our expectations, which it definitely did. Overall a fantastic family holiday, topped off by a brillant hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Caveatemptornz
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step through the door the staff could not do enough to make you feel comfortable. In room check in great when you are tired. Free Shuttle bus to the shops etc. Free WiFi, soft drinks in Mini Bar. Pool is amazing. Tea and scones a highlight! Would definitely go back especially having seen some other options we considered as we walked around town.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: zacd
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay very much very classy and fashionable hotel stayed in a suite with my wife and 2 children - very convenient beatiful views location good would love to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Ultra Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrzej K
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui. Staff are incredibly attentive. Beautiful modern rooms, great pool on terrace with bar and excellent dining. There is a free shuttle to get you around and the hotel is on the free airport bus shuttle route from the train station. I liked it so much I have rebooked for the entire family in August.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were amazing”
Reviews.Author: Kimberley M
Reviews.Content: Hand made cupcakes on arrival at hotel. Awesome mini bar. Fantastic food and knowledgeable staff. My partner fell ill! Staff advised of options to seek medical assistance within 2 minutes of ringing planned all details and called the next day to check on us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service levels”
Reviews.Author: Lulu D
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the hotel icon and loved every minute.It was such a peaceful haven to return to after a busy day shopping and sight seeing.The hotel is super clean and smells divine,the rooms spacious and modern and the service from all staff fantastic.This hotel is excellent value for money and I would not hesitate to recommend it to even the most fussy of travelers.It really does deserve its No 1 trip advisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed in-”
Reviews.Author: louieHobartTasmania
Reviews.Content: This was a long anticipated experience for us, we had booked 4 months in advance based on previous reviews on tripadvisor. We were blown away by the attention lavished, the level of service, the quality of this brand, and the friendliness of everyone at the icon.
