We enjoyed a club harbor room on the 25th floor and all of the little extras this afforded us. Personalised check in with a glass of bubbly, $200 laundry and dry cleaning credit per day, and most of all the wonderful martinis served each night, among other drinks too.. Whatever you wanted, always with a smile, without being over serviced, which to us is important. We have never revisited a hotel in our travels, as we believe every experience in a new one, but we both have decided that when we return to HK, we will be returning to the icon as we believe the icon have definitely got it right. The icon is well located next to the hung hom MTR which is the best way to really experience HK at a really good price. Do yourselves a favour don't look any further when choosing a hotel in HK:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: wulili
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel ICON, especially with the expansive room (the room was about 3 to 4 times the size of a room at the Cosmo Hotel in Wan Chai), free M&Ms, and funky bathroom. The gym was also well-equipped and had a great view of the city (but a view of Hong Kong from any vantage point is great!). The scent as one walks in is wonderful, especially after a long warm day outdoors. However, perhaps it is the understated service, which was good, but it also seemed as if the staff could not quite be bothered. Upon arrival, yes, they were pleasant and gracious, but still... there was something missing. Perhaps it was just a smile? It's ok Hotel ICON staff, a smile won't keep people away! In fact, it will make them feel even better to come back to the hotel. The location is not as central, but it's still well served by buses to Wan Chai, the Airport Express Shuttle, and the Hotel ICON shuttle that travels to TST and Harbour View every 20 minutes. If you're not in the mood to wait, the East TST station isn't too far of a walk (not much farther than the usual walks to any station in HK). Overall, a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, lovely staff, great location, a couple of quibbles that stopped it being perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Brydon55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Icon for 4 days on business. Didn't have a harbour view room but not too bothered as quite like looking at buildings but if I had been paying and could choose would definitely have gone for harbour view club room. Room excellent, sevice outstanding. Only two quibbles. You cannot get freshly made poached eggs - they are on the buffet so only good if you like them hard. Can get all other types of eggs cooked for you but not poached - weird! Sounds rather petulant I know but I do love poached eggs! Other quibble which made me quite cross and meant slightly lower overall rating is that the bar on the top floor which has spectacular views is not open for non club members until 8pm. So you cannot enjoy a drink as the sun sets. Seriously annoying. The lobby bar is great and enjoyed it very much but would really have liked to enjoy a beer after work overlooking the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “top top hotel with incredible service levels”
Reviews.Author: Streetlobster
Reviews.Content: superb rooms and facilities, phenomenally helpful and professional staff, brilliant hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hugely Disappointing - Do NOT stay in Club Rooms if have Young Children”
Reviews.Author: andrewpTA
Reviews.Content: Disappointing stay after reading a lot of positive review about this hotel. Stayed in a Club room because we wanted to experience the Hotel fully. Despite the fact other reviewers with young children being allowed into the Lounge for club previledges and never stating that it is NOT allowed in their pamphlets or promotions we were turned away twice! Once for breakfast and once for evening cocktails. On that occasion we were made to sit in the reception area making us feel like we were gate crashing. The staff are generally very polite but they really need to inform guests about their policy on the lounges better. I would love to hear response from the Hotel on this matter. I can also provide link to reviewers of young children that were allowed into lounge if needed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Sue53_11
Reviews.Content: We booked here as all the reviews on Tripadvisor were so good.Our stay was fantastic,the staff so friendly and helpful.Our view of Hong Kong Island spectacular and our room absolutely beautiful.The hotel is in a little way away from an MTR station but with the free shuttle bus that leaves for Middle road (behind the Peninsula Hotel)and Harbour City shopping centre every 20 minutes it is really easy to get around. We will return and would recommend the Icon to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, excellent value. I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Stavros P
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Free shuttle bus from Kowloon Station. Clean stylish room - had a city view, but the harbour views from my floor were spectacular (city views still interesting). Free wifi and minibar immediately helped me feel at ease after my long haul flight. Bath small but deep - shower no probs. The breakfast restaurant was like a mall - food on offer seemed endless. Staff everywhere were courteous and attentive. Even having checked out I'm still online writing this review. Well done Icon. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Juzshmee
Reviews.Content: Like all other reviews the Hotel Icon is an amazing place to stay. We stayed there 10 nights on the 22nd floor in a Icon 38 Harbour View room, and cannot think of a negative thing to say. The bed was sooooo comfortable, every attention to detail was faultless.The staff were wonderful and very eager to please. Enjoyed breakfast in The Market...so much to choose from and everything delicious. Cant wait to go back !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Patricia A
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in most of the best hotels on our travels. You would find it very hard to better the Icon. From being met at the door on your arrival to be made to feel you are the most important guest they have ever had. The service never faltered during our 8 day stay. Above & Beyond restaurant was amazing Hugo Cheng, the manager, always made our evening fun, the food up to Michelin standard. Room so good! never stayed at a hotel that offered to change your mattress if too hard or too soft for your comfort. Top marks have to go to Suki Ho, the assistant manager , also Grace and Edith, Guest Relations for going the extra mile. Can't wait to return loved it loved it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice find in hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Bobbyz51
Reviews.Content: I had to take. Last minute detour to hong kong due to china visa issues. I stumbled upon the icon from American express website since intercontinental and four seasons were booked solid. After checking trip adviser reviews I gave it a shot. What a good bet, hotel is excellent. Top notch rooms after long flight from NYC. Excellent concierge service. Excellent breakfast. Beautiful pool. Great lobby. Close to all the action in kowloon. What's not to like???

Reviews.Title: “Perfection for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: dudih
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just the business for business! I have stayed at most of the 5* HK hotels over the years, including many stays at he Peninsula, the Mandarin Oriental and both Island and Kowloon Shangri-La. This is my third stay int he last 6 months at the Icon and here re some reasons I love it: 1. The View - the Icon 38 rooms which I have stayed in each time have the most superb view over the harbour, makes me feel great to lay in bed and look out through the floor to ceiling picture windows. Many other hotels give you a side view or a view just from the desk etc and call it harbourview. 2. Nespresso -Yes I can order a good coffee in most 5 start hotels, but then I need to wait , get dressed, answer the door, or I can make myself a coffee usually from an instant pack, at this hotel you get a Nespresso machine with a selection of pods and you can enjoy a real cup of coffee within 2 minutes without having to entertain and room service staff. Bliss! 3. Mini Bar - However expensive a hotel is, however opulent, it irritates me to spend £5.00 or $8.00 for a coke or an Orange juice, at the ICON the mini bar is complimentary, nicely stocked with soft drinks, nibbles and even a couple cans of beer. 4. WiFi- Great WiFI, no extra charge, allows you to connect multiple devices (Laptop, iPad, Android phone etc) 5. Bathroom - Great design, not opulent but comfortably functional and clean and modern 6. Location - Yes it s not 100% central and it is a few-minutes walk to an MTR but the payback is that you are staying in a relatively uncluttered area, no fighting through crowds as you leave the hotel, easy access to taxi's and it is literally only a few minutes away from bustling Tsim Sha Tsui main shopping / tourist area. 7. Service - Have not eaten in the hotel as I follow a special diet and eat in a local club that caters to my requirements. However the services I have requested (such as late check out etc) are always met with a yes or at least a good effort. So many other hotels automatically say no for each request and then come back with a compromise. 8. Office facilities - A great colour printer, scanner, copier is in the room, you need to email your documents to the printer and they print within a couple of minutes, no cables, no setting up a new printer, no installing software etc. just another way to make things easier for a business traveller. The only downside if any is that the hotel doesn't quite have the prestige of some of the other hotels in Hing Kong, and if you want to impress your business colleagues then this may not do it, but bottom line is that its a great hotel, comfortable, well equipped and well run by obliging people who want to make the guests happy. My new home from home in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Hardeep K
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for this hotel and stayed 3 nights. The hotel is based in Kowloon but looks out onto the harbour and across to hong kong island, amazing views at night. Hotel has lots of facilities, a pool, spa, gym, chill out rooms, restaurants, the list is endless. Everything is top notch quality, and the staff are very helpful and couldn't do more for us. Would def stay again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but location a drawback”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the Hotel icon in a Club 36 Harbour View Room. the Hotel is very new and very comfortable with all modcons. VIews from a harbour view room were excellent. The location however isa bit of a challenge. the only mTR nearby is Hung Hom which apart from Tsim Tsa Shui East is pretty much mot part of te main MTR network. I tis the base for the Kowloon to Canton railway. They run a shutttle to Harbour City which works well but it is still a bit os pain-it would be better to be nearer to the main MTR and cross harbour ferry network. Whilst the Hotel stay was very good it is obvious it is a training hotel-lots of staff but many do not have good english. On my first night in the Club room for a drink it took almost 35 minutes to get serves one drink and a second was never forthcoming after another 40 minute wait. The breakfast downstairs was excellent but dinner again in the Club was disappoitning. Quite expensive and very small portions.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morry1234
Reviews.Content: What can I say, we stayed here for 4 days and this hotel is awesome... We have stayed in alot of hotels over the years, certainly some which are more $$$, but Hotel Icon has everything worked out and is a must stay in HK. The staffs attention to detail is so precise. They can not do enough for you... They really make the little things count. The hotel provides sweat bands for jogging and a map, along with its free mini bar and the Timeless room you can use if early for your room or your plane has been delayed etc... The location is pretty good to, not to far from the heart of Hong Kong either walking or taxi. I had my birthday when here and we came back to a birthday cake in our room with a card signed by several staff... The pool and gym are great with a view over the harbour. We stayed in the Harbour View 36 which was really nice, great bathroom and comfy bed. If you get a chance eat at Above and Byond restaurant in the hotel. I never eat in hotel restaurants but this is a must. Fine dining with a awesome view. The sucking pig is the best I have ever had!!! All in all, we seriously could not fault them at all...a great stay and we will be back....

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: ant_obrie
Reviews.Content: Perhaps not in its construction and architecture a 5 star hotel but in service and attention is a 6 stars, staff, janitors, masters and waiters are attentive and always magnificent, though small spa and massage Service are exceptional two days pass very comfortable and I recommend it very much. When I come back to Hong Kong I will stay again The food at the restaurants is very good as well as its Service and the spectacular view of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: chienvieux
Reviews.Content: Just returned from absolutely brilliant stay at the Icon in Hong Kong. Stayed 4 nights in a Club room on 25th floor, and I would thoroughly recommend paying the extra for the Club Harbour View. The room itself was very impressive, excellent comfy bed, glorious bathroom (with TV at end of bath) and fantastic view. The extra amenities in the Club Lounge (28th Floor) worth it for the free drinks and snacks 6 - 8 each evening, not to mention the afternoon tea. Great open air pool on 9th floor, very helpful staff. I cannot think of a single negative thing to say

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel several months ago when it was still very new & didn't even have a ranking on Trip Advisor. As such I think I may have got a better deal on our room than what it may cost now. We spent one night there in May 2012 as part of a stopover in Hong Kong. The second we arrived at the hotel, there were plenty of porters on hand to grab our luggage & the innitial impression of the foyer is 'wow' with a fantastic art deco inspired spiral staircase & huge living plant wall. This hotel is used for training Hospitality staff & this was great as there are staff everywhere & all of the ones we came across including the ones at check in seemed really young & enthusiastic & eager to please. We were given a room on the 11th floor which had amazing sweeping views of the Hong Kong Skyline & the local surrounding Kowloon skyline. The large room was possibly the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. Everything felt really modern, sleek, luxurious & state of the art, with lots of little extras such as free snacks & soft drinks in the Mini Bar. The outdoor pool deck on level 9 has an amazing view once again & was just a really nice area to spend time in. Also, on this level is a lounge where you can chill with free snacks while waiting for your flight after you have checked out or before checking in if early. It really seems as though they have thought of everything here. The location was great & if you catch the train from the airport there is a free corresponding shuttle bus from the local station to hotel. This would def be my first choice for staying in Hong Kong again

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: AnnChiong
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel ICON for 4 nights. When I first step into the hotel, I was impressed. Very pretty environment and friendly staffs. During check-in it was done efficiently and no more papers to check in, high tech with computerize equipments. The rooms are really nice, clean and I had a beautiful view of the harbour. I enjoyed my stay here and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I like.”
Reviews.Author: Koenraad
Reviews.Content: Great place (free shuttle to the subway). Great service. Great rooms (ask for a high floor). Great swimming pool. Great restaurants. It doesn't get much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: Here4Now2
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in quite a few 5 star hotels in our recent travels. Hotel Icon is without doubt in the top 2 Hotels we have stayed in to date. Friendly and helpful staff. Nicely appointed room. The most comfortable bed and pillows. Great room service. Good value Restaurant,s serving up top notch food. Overall.....fantastic. If you are in Hong Kong, do yourself a favour and stay at the Hotel Icon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Kowloon Side”
Reviews.Author: wtliving
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Icon for 4 nights last week. I really liked the hotel. Good room with a great view. Everything is new. Great lobby bar, Restaurant at the top of the hotel is really cool. Also great pool and exercise facility. Depending on the purpose of your visit, the location can be good or bad. The good is that it is close to Hung Hom train station if you are coming from the Mainland or need to go to the Mainland by train. The bad is that the hotel is located in Tsim Sha Tsui East which is not well connected to Tsim Sha Tsui by MTR so you will need to take a taxi ($20-$25HKD) or wait for the hotel shuttle bus. If you need to go to the HK side then by taxi you are close to the Cross-Harbour Tunnel which is nice. If you would rather go to the HK side by MTR or the Star Ferry (much cheaper than a taxi) then you need to take a taxi or hotel shuttle to Tsim Sha Tsui which is really not that convenient. All in all if I need to stay on the Kowloon side I would chose this hotel again. However, on balance I would rather give up some of the advantages of this hotel and stay on the HK side which I find to be much more enjoyable. I usually choose Lanson Place Hotel in Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “they make an effort are proud of being on top of trip advisor and it pays off for everyone”
Reviews.Author: hedonisticjetset
Reviews.Content: ok. you cannot miss the many trip advisor logos once you enter this hotel (which I find a bit tacky) but they are just proud to be #1 (may12). and everyone really makes an effort to stay #1. the design is flawless, the staff is overly attentive, I had no waiting time at the reception (opposed to other reviews) and the buffet is huge and worth the price. the massages were also good although paying before enjoying it seemed weird. it is very practical to take the free shuttle bus K3 to the hotel. i was surprised by the efficient organization. the bus leaves every 15 min or so. the area kowloon is unfortunately a vast tourist trap. unless you enjoy shops and more shops that stay open till midnight it is recommended to leave this place and at least discover HK island. only one thing to watch: the bell boys are young and try hard to be professional. but on my way to the airport they did not pay attention and the MTR shuttle bus I was supposed to board passed through the hotel's driveway without stopping. so i had to take a taxi as the next one would have been 12min later. maybe one should blame their 10 hour shifts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation in perfect location with great view !”
Reviews.Author: Ben R
Reviews.Content: First of all - the view is just stunning !!! We had a room with harbour side view for 8 nights and it was worth every cent. You can enjoy the view from many other spots inside the hotel - for example from the restaurant and the lounge on the top floor or through the glass front from the 24h gym or from inside the outdoor top pool in front of the gym. You see, the view is not everything this hotel offers. It starts when you enter the lobby and see the simple but very stylish interior while you smell the fine designed and freshening aroma that's in the lobby. The hotel staff is extraordinary friendly and helpful with everything and well educated in English. There is an extra front desk for tourist information and to meke up reservations, purchase tickets or change money. A 5min walk away you have a big train station, on the opposite side of the hotels street there is a taxi stand where almost everytime taxis are waiting and the hotel has its own shuttle service. The hotels restaurants offer a large variety of good dishes, as well as huge breakfast buffets. The rooms have also a nice and chic design as well as the bathroom. Minibar drinks (just non-alcoholics) and chocolate is for free. All in one it was a great experience and it was not my last stay in this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: extralite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after reading other good reviews. Staff were very efficient, professional. Had a standard room but had great views, more spectacular due to a thunderstorm. Thing i really liked about this hotel which others could learn from is that there wasn't an extra charge each time a door was opened. Free internet worked very well and quick. Soft drinks and chocolate in the mini bar. The hotel is a little way from the nearest MTR station. There is a shuttle bus that runs every half hour, and taxis pretty easy to get, so a relatively minor inconvenience. So overall a good hotel which i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Tarek T
Reviews.Content: Wow... No wonder this hotel shot up to the number one spot in less than a year of being open!! I am a busy executive who has very little time to write reviews, but this hotel is truly exceptional that I hope that my review would be helpful to other travelers. For one thing, you really feel that the staff cares about you as a guest. The room design is very contemporary and looks fabulous. Being a new hotel, you get plenty of plugs to charge all your devices at once.. so you can can have your iPad, iPhone and laptop all charged and ready to go.. No need to prioritize devices.. You also get free WIFI and FREE MINIBAR! When was the last time you got anything for free in a 5 star Hong Kong hotel?? Can't go wrong with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff & Hotel...they really go Above & Beyond”
Reviews.Author: myn2012
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Icon through Expedia.ca and stayed there from April 24-29 for our honeymoon. We travelled a lot through out the years, and this is the best hotel that we have stayed in Hong Kong. We highly recommended everyone to stay at this hotel. Is a bit on the pricey side, but you get what you paid for. If we ever go back to Hong Kong, we will definitely stay here again no questions asked! The service is fabulous even if you don’t book the above and beyond club rooms. We love the location which is really quiet, away from TST's major noisy streets. As we were checked into a higher floor, so the view was gorgeous. The room is really sleek & clean and has a nice designer feel to it. The size of the room is big enough for the two of us even with our 2 large and 1 medium sized luggage. We love everything in the room, especially the rain shower. The only a little concern would be with it's design, as the glass door is not wide enough to avoid water splashing everywhere on the floor. We also love the chairs and bed in the room, they were all so comfortable. When we first checked in, the staff were really nice, it was 5 am in the morning, 2 of the bell boys rushed out to help us with the luggage as the taxi pulled over. However, the staff at the front desk did not acknowledge or welcome us as honeymooners. As other hotels, they gave us free upgrades to suites, a free restaurant meal or bottle of champagne to make our stay special. We did not have any of that when we checked into our room. Sadly, a family of loud mainlanders was checked in next to the room next to us. The whole time the family sounded like they were going to kill each other and it was horrible. The next morning, we were thinking of bringing all these issues to the front desk attention and let them know our concerns. Before we even got to the front desk, we bumped into Raymond Hou from Guest Relations. Of course we voiced our concerns about our stay. He apologized to us right away and told us that the front door staff missed our honeymoon message on our account and offered us a bottle of house wine of our choice. As for the noise from next door, Raymond informed us that they are checking out as we speak. He promised us that front desk will only check in single business traveler next to us, so we can have the privacy that we deserve. We also requested to have bottles of water in our room instead of pop as their mini bar offers free pop & water. Raymond checked into our room daily to ensure housekeeping keep our bottles of water refilled. He also took his time and showed us how to get around town. By the time we get back to the hotel that night, the bottle of house white wine was chilled in the ice bucket along with a card signed by the whole Guest Relations Team. On one night, Raymond surprised us with yummy cupcakes from their restaurant “Green” to celebrate our marriage. It was the yummiest cupcakes we ever had. He also took the time to show us the restaurant in the hotel and the lounge area. Raymond was really personal and really went “Above and Beyond” to ensure that we were well taken care of, and most importantly made us feel very special. We tried the buffet restaurant “The market” on one of the nights and it was amazing. They have every kind of cuisine there, you name it, they have it; such as: lobsters, crabs, sushi, sashimi, freshly shuck oysters, all kinds of cheese, fruits, lamb, steak, curry, rice, ribs, soup, dim sum etc. Their desserts are to die for, especially the green tea matcha mousse. My husband is not a big fan of dessert; but even he went for a few encores, it is that good! I can sit there all day long just to eat that dessert. LOL. We have also tried "Green" for dinner, it was absolutely amazing as well. We went there around 9:00pm, it was packed. The hostess notified us it will probably take 30 mins for the next table to become available. As she knows that we are guest staying at their hotel, she was being such a sweet heart told us that we could wait in our hotel room until they have a table. Within 20 mins, we got a call back from her and they already set the tables nicely for us. We had wings, spring roll, pasta & risotto. It was great, except the pasta was a bit overcooked and the risotto was undercooked. To sum it all up we did encounter a little problem in the beginning, but they took the initiative to fix the issues right away, unlike some other hotels we stayed in Hong Kong (Regal iClub we are looking at you). Hotel Icon took our concerns seriously, and made us feel all special again. We really wanted to thank Raymond and everyone at Hotel Icon for making our stay special. You all have really executed the word “Above and Beyond”, and provided "Legendary Service". As Hotel Icon is built by Hong Kong's Polytechnic University in order to train their hospitality and tourism management students for the workforce and did a fine job doing it. Hotel Icon, you have all done an excellent job making Hong Kong Polytechnic University proud.

Reviews.Title: “Very Stylish Design”
Reviews.Author: eustajoh
Reviews.Content: Very stylish rooms and attentive service. Check in took a while as the staff debated whether I could have a late check out but all was happily resolved. The Club lounge has fantastic views of the Harbour and the evening light show and is a great venue to start the evening. Free shuttle to the Airport Express at Kowloon makes getting to the airport easy. The hotel is unique in being a training and research hotel as part of Hong Kong Polytechnic University.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Louise M
Reviews.Content: I agree with others, everything about this hotel was fabulous! Only wish we'd had time to try out the pool.... We found this hotel almost by accident really whilst surfing the net and got a great deal on a room on the club floors. That was certainly worth the privelege, from the moment we arrived and had our personalised concierge guide us through check-in. Every staff member we encountered over the weekend couldn't do enough to make our holiday more enjoyable. The room was sensational, overlooking the harbour and with all the amenities you could want - huge comfortable bed and all the little touches that you would expect in a hotel of this class. The restaurant was to die for, once we dragged ourselves away from the free cocktails in the lounge (personally designed creations that really gave sparkle to the evening) then we treated ourselves to some chinese delicacies with wine perfectly matched by our sommelier, Wallace. Breakfast every morning was a feast which really set us up to go and explore the city on the doorstep. Thank-you to everyone on the club floors, you made us feel like rock-stars for the weekend, can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service, location”
Reviews.Author: Tinoh F
Reviews.Content: Three days at Hotel Icon and I was delighted. Beautiful simple design rooms. Simple breakfast. Great rooftop bar. And above all ... Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: islander15
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect!!! The service, room, gym, infinity pool, and the restaurants!!! Better than the Peninsula!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon.. Look no further..”
Reviews.Author: Rohan G
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another fantastic week at the Icon. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning on a visit to Hong Kong. From the stylish and comfy rooms, the gym, pool and great views from the lounge bar on the 28th floor this place is perfect. I must not forget the staff, they are excellent. I have seen a couple of negative reviews but you do have to remember that the Icon is a hospitality training hotel so you can expect a few minor hiccups which I think adds to the experience. Overall I have found the service to be superb and always with a smile...

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating HK”
Reviews.Author: paulmar45
Reviews.Content: HK is really fantastic Icon Hotel too. Second triop to HK in two years and in two differents hotels. I will return to Icon. Very nice staff. We had a meeting during too days. The second days when we arrived in the meeting room all our documents have disappeared cleaned by the staff in charge of the meeting room. Very bad surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !”
Reviews.Author: Hopalong1789
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the previous review. This hotel IS truly outstanding and if you book the 'Above & Beyond' package the service is fabulous. I have stayed at high class hotels all over the world and this hotel is absolutely fantastic. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lodging in Kowloon...”
Reviews.Author: JAR103
Reviews.Content: Very modern, great service, immaculate, great service and hospitality, good rates for Hong Kong. The lobby bar is very nice for a quick breakfast or drink... wonderful staff. The top floor bar and restaurant has great views - watch te light show from here. The offer a light happy hour to some guests - ask for it! They offer a very good airport pick up/drop off limo service for a fee but well worth it for a two couples.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great in every way”
Reviews.Author: Yoret
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, with impeccable service, “perfect” location, great food, excellent rooms, facilities and spa. Rooms are spacious for Hong Kong standards, everything is new with sleek design. The services is great because it is a teaching school and all the young staff members are happy with their jobs and keen on making your stay perfect. Value for money this is definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed in. No complaints, no suggestions, all was perfect and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon”
Reviews.Author: DohaAndy
Reviews.Content: Overall great hotel, no major complaints just few observations for improvement: 1: make more children friendly i.e. Kids menu options at pool side, in- room and restaurant. Just as well my 5 year old loves pasta 2: breakfast at Market excellent bar the service, not that it was poor, just far too quick to clear your plate. No sooner is you cutlery down they promptly try to remove plate, but had to on several occasions say I had not finished. Like I said it's not a compliant just an observation, it's better being quick then no service at all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it very much”
Reviews.Author: Michellen21
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service, very friendly staff, truly 5 star. Definitely coming back .

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: coa2012
Reviews.Content: I travel 2-3 times a year to Hong Kong for business. The Icon is a relatively new hotel and I have now stayed there twice. The hotel has met or exceeded my expectations on each stay. Very friendly and helpful staff, great views of the harbor and very nice room decor and ammentities. Hotel is located on the Kowloon side and centrally located. It has a small boutique feel rather than the larger hotels such as the Sheraton, Nikko or Inter-Continental.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Adventure”
Reviews.Author: baileysontherocks
Reviews.Content: A very new and modern Hotel in the very busy and exciting part of Kowloon, Hong Kong. We arrived to the very friendly and efficient staff who made our check-in very quick and easy. We had booked a Harbour View room and we were not disappointed. It was just a treat to wake in the mornings (curtains open all day and night) and see the busy harbour bustling with boats of all shapes and sizes and an even better site at night with all the sky scrapers showing off their colours, it was truly mesmerising. Our room had a wonderful comfy king size bed, bathroom had a fabulously deep bath with tv to view as you let you body soak after the endless shopping! the decor was modern and there was a Bose ipod/iphone docking station which was great if you wanted to listen to your own tunes, a large 3D flat screen tv which was positioned so you could watch from the comfort of your bed, while also taking in the harbour night vista. The Market Place, where you could go for breakfast, lunch and I believe dinner (although we didn't go for dinner) was just great, more then enough variety of food and the staff were there to assist if you required something that wasn't. On our last night we decided to dine in the Above and Beyond restaurant on the top floor, this experience was a little disappointing, although the food was great, there was just not enough of it. Our Aussie men were certainly not filled and we were also a little disappointed with the rushed service. We actually felt as though they may have been trying a little too hard and felt pushed through the meal, rather than being left to relax and enjoy the surroundings, the view was just amazing, we felt hurried and left feeling a little bewildered. But, all in all we had a wonderful time there, the gym and the pool were just fantastic and the gym staff were great! it was very pleasant to sit poolside and watch the hustle and bustle of the city folk below, while also being intrigued at how all those high rise buildings can accomodate so many people! Hong Kong was just an amazing experience all round and we will be back to stay at the Hotel Icon again! A must see and do would definitely be to go the Ladies Markets in Mon Kok, and take a trip to Victoria Peak on a public bus, what a buzz! there is also public transport to Stanley, where the well known Stanley Markets are and also a very popular beach for swimming. I suggest that you sit on the top row of the double decker bus, it is just a great sight seeing experience and very cheap!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for biz traveller”
Reviews.Author: cldsyl
Reviews.Content: arrived late from HK railway station. It's just 10 min by walk. Close to main destination in Kowloon side. Great space and service. It's a bargain 5 start comparing the neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't ask for a better business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gymnastgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best I've stayed in for business, especially with its reasonable price. The staff were excellent; it was a nice touch that the waiter brought me Newsweek to read when he realised I was dining alone for dinner. After a particularly tiring day, I was able to have dinner next to the hotel pool, and the staff went out if their way to ensure that I had a lovely dinner overlooking the harbour. The room was flawlessly clean, and with a free minibar and free wifi, I was completely happy. The chair at the business desk was surprisingly comfortable. I did use the gym quite a bit. It is as nice as they claim. The website wasn't too detailed, but for you fitness fanatics, there were 2 bikes, about 8 treadmills, a rowing machine, free weights, a multi workout machine, several random weights machines, and stretching machine. The pool was crystal clear and warm enough to enjoy but cool enough to be refreshing. The food was excellent, though be warned that they have American-sized portions here for everything. Delicious, but I recommend sharing where possible if you don't tend to eat a lot. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Staff is just great, location is great, price is ... well, only fair :)”
Reviews.Author: Bumbi17
Reviews.Content: We have spent a few days in this hotel. We loved it! It has everything you need. A superb staff (really!), great location, nice design, clean rooms etc. (The only lame thing was the "free" minibar, that included 6 sodas :), but who cares?) It is a bit pricy, like everything else in Hong Kong. If you want to spend a few days exploring the city, and you can afford this, do not hesitate. This is a GREAT choice!

Reviews.Title: “Iconic in my view”
Reviews.Author: dimanche80
Reviews.Content: Fast & smooth check-in, friendly faces and service, swift in-room dining services, fabulous view from both room and pool, very comfy bed, a bathtub fabulous for partnership with a good book and wine, my top hotel choice in Hong Kong!!. Downside, I wish there was an iPhone dock and speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: Helen F
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 1 night during a business trip. The hotel took my emergency booking when my flight to the UK was cancelled at the last minute. The service team were excellent, taking the pain out of what had become a very stressful day. Of particular note was the helpful welcome provided by Kevin, who ensured that we had great rooms and something to eat. The room was very clean and the facilities excellent. It is worth a visit to the pool deck, even if it's just for the view.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city hotel you will love staying here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelpepper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Icon for 1 night when we bought our daughter to Disneyland. The hotel is fabulous, it is new and has all the modern appointments you would want in a 5 star hotel. The views of the bay are wrondeffu and the beds and room are extremely comfortable. The location of this hotel is fabulous and is right in Kowloon. The food is great at all the restaurants and the room service is equally as good we only wish we had more time to stay in this hotel but we will be back when we come back to Hong Kong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Iconic experience”
Reviews.Author: gert1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on two separate occasions in October and November 2012, both times in an Icon 38 Harbour View King room and enjoyed both stays immensely. The room was fabulous,waking up to the view over the harbour and HK Island made for a great start to each new exciting day in this fantastic city. Service was as excellent as can be expected from a five star hotel, with special kudos to the tireless doormen (or more accurately, doorboys) who made us feel glad to get back to the hotel each and every time with a jaunty smile and "welcome back". Our two stays were before and after a short trip to Macau and the hotel allowed us to store some of our luggage whilst we were away for these three days and promptly returned it to us upon checking in for our second stay. We were so glad to be back at the Icon, after the rather impersonal experience that was Macau. As an indication of the level of service we experienced, for our first stay we had arranged transport from the airport to Hotel Icon via the hotel concierge and we were stunned by the attention to detail and service delivered: the driver picked us up on time, was courteous and called ahead to the hotel a few minutes before our arrival. We were greeted at the Icon's front door by two bellmen who whisked away our luggage, and by a lovely front desk girl who led us straight to our room, bypassing the front desk, and proceeded with all check-in formalities in the room itself on her iPad. Efficient, professional, high-tech and smiling throughout. If only all hotel stays started this way! This experience did cause us to be slightly disappointed when we didn't have the same experience the second time around, when we went through the normal check-in procedures at the front desk, but only because we were so spoiled the first time around. Next year we're going back to Hong Kong and I'm very tempted to go for the Icon again; there's literally hundreds of good and excellent hotels in HK, but looking at my own experiences, the reviews here on Tripadvisor and the fact the Icon shot to the top 3 of HK hotels corroborate my opinion it'd be difficult to find a better hotel experience in Hong Kong than the Icon offers, unless you're willing to pay two to three times as much for the pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond and above expectation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Adika J
Reviews.Content: We were amazed by the staff hospitality when we first arrived at the hotel. We were escorted by friendly staff to club lounge for private and personal check in and were offered with drinks. After we got all the information we needed, we were taken to the room to begin our weekend stay. The room is spacious and beautifully designed. We were impressed by detail personal care supplies and you can even choose your own preferred pillows. The bathroom is big and shower room includes huge shower head. The room offers everything you need which includes The Nespresso coffee and mini bar with free snack and drinks (all snacks and drinks are refilled everyday). We are treated like royal and staff are so attentive to our needs. As we are vegetarian, we have been specially catered for our diet requirements at breakfast. What really impressive was, we were surprised by a bottle of red wine and greeting card personally hand written and signed for our honeymoon. The services are superb and we are definitely spoilt during our stay at the hotel. Thanks to Lauren, Jackie who helped us on our check in and other staff members who have helped us. We will definitely recommend to anyone and will be sure to come back for hotel Icon on our next visit. You are the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Icon for 2 days in April after being recommended by a friend. Difficult to say much that hasn't already been covered previously. Staff all very well trained. Rooms very modern and cosmopolitan. Good location and walking distance to the China mainline train station. Had the set lunch in the coffee shop one day...very very good. I travel a lot and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Waraphorn
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at the hotel Icon but it was a great experience. Unfortunately it was foggy so my viewed was all grey in stead of the amazing harbor view. The room is nice but small. Free minibar is a nice touch. Breakfast is fantastic with lots of choices that I wish I could have sat there and eaten all day!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Icon!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marmatjj
Reviews.Content: Hotel is first rate! Stayed two nights and service was excellent. Room was spacious. Stayed at Icon 36 Harbourview 19th floor. Good sight lines of Harbourview and city. Ate at the buffet at The Market. Good selection of foods. Try the dessert table...green tea mousse. The pool was ok but the gym, the sauna and the showers are excellent. Multiple jets and shower heads. Staff was very friendly. Free mini bar and route map for joggers (ask for bottle water and sweatbands with hotel logo on them...good souvenir). Hotel offers a free shuttle to Nathan road area (behind Peninsula Hotel) but check when last pickup is. If you mss it, take MTR. It's a short walk back to hotel from Hum Hong station. Visit the Hong Kong History Museum which is five minutes from the hotel. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say what others haven't already said about this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: samjonk
Reviews.Content: On this trip we first stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile, which was a total disaster! After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to try the ICON. After arriving by cab, we were pleasantly surprised by the stylish bell boys and doorman. The checking in was excellent and fast. We booked a room with city view but got upgraded to a harbour view. The hotel has only been opened since 1 year and you can tell! The layout of each room is perfect. The rooms are spacious and very convenient. The bathroom is large, unlike many other hotels in HK, and has a separate shower and bathtub. The free wifi internet is fast and works perfectly and the free mini bar is a big plus. Good job ICON hotel! We are regular HK travelers and would certainly come back next time. Keep up this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCoco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Hotel Icon in Hong Kong on our layover from Asia to Chicago. We had a lovely stay! We had a club level room on highest guest floor (right below the bar) - the view was lovely. Not only could you see the harbor and all the lights on the other side, but we could also see the lights from the buildings on our side of the harbor. We thought the location was convenient - a bustling area close to many restaurant choices (we loved the Sichuan Restaurant tucked in the mall a block/two away). The service, though, was what really blew us away at the Hotel Icon. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The hotel was modern, clean, with great amenities (beautiful work out area and heated pool with gorgeous views). I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “March Hong Kong Birthday Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Melissa H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited to Hong Kong and stayed at the Hotel Icon on the late of Feb and checked out on the 5 March, staying for 5 nights. They allowed us to check in at 9am, even though our room was booked at 2pm. When we arrived we were greeted by hotel staff who were very welcoming and happy. First impressions were that staff were passionate about their job and about being there. It really set a good atmosphere for anyone new to the hotel. We were escorted to our room, ICON 38 Harbour Room. The lady (I wish I could remember her name to give feedback), was very helpful offering to explain the areas on the map in regards to site seeing, transport, explaining how the taxi's services operated (red, blue, green taxi's). Every time we came down stairs hotel staff were always greeted by the staff and enquired as to how we where and took interested in our planned for the day. I could not fault any of the staff they were so accommodating, polite and friendly. All the meals breakfast, lunch, room service tasted amazing and they catered for as many variety of cultures through their foods available. Visually the hotel is modern in its decor but not cold or too harsh. It had a environmental vibe to it with floral and greenery arranged in a very unique presentation up the wall of the lobby. The room was spacious and we enjoyed the free mini bar snacks (which were replenished each day) (mm's, coke, juice, redbull ect..). Loved the fact the shower had the option of coming out of the shower head or out of the roof. Although what I didn't understand was why was there a TV above the bathtub? I couldn't get the sound to work properly on it. The Ipod docking station in the room was a good idea as we actually used it quite a few times. The location of the hotel was great, we could walk to most places on the side of the island (ladies markets, harbor shopping complex, ferry's, train station, shopping) or easily get a taxi. Our mornings regularly started off with breakfast followed by a walk to Starbucks. :) The most surprising part of our experience at the hotel was on the actual day of my birthday. They must of written my birthday date down from when they looked at my passport the day we checked in. This is because when my boyfriend and I returned from our day out on my birthday the Hotel staff had surprised me with birthday cake waiting in my room with a card signed by the hotel staff. Given that this was my first time away from home on my birthday it really meant a lot to me and I was overwhelmed by the lovely gesture. Thank you so much, for contributing to making our holiday in Hong Kong simply incredible. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone who travels to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: 44Vanessa
Reviews.Content: We had read all the rave reviews of the Icon Hotel which really does live up to them. We stayed for three nights and upgraded our room to the club floor. Amazing views from our room on the 25th floor and excellent terrace pool on the 9th. The Above and Beyond lounge has breathtaking views although I have to agree with other comments as to why they put the bar across the window so limiting the view. The staff are incredibly helpful - nothing appears to be too much trouble. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel I've been ever in my life!”
Reviews.Author: jorge v
Reviews.Content: Ok. So i travel most than a lot of people i know and use tripadvisor.com a lot for every trip i make and yet have been incredibly egoistic not to write anything for my fellow travelers. I think i lacked the inspiration i was looking for until i stayed in this Hotel. It is magnificent! , the staff is great, the spa incredible, the view left me speechless, the pool best view in town but it is the design and value what will make you happy every time you go into the hotel, you get wifi included and breakfast too, furthermore you get 100 HKD complimentary in laundry a day and free shuttle rides to Harbour City. This Hotel is perfect in every sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: SRFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in March and had a great time. Service at counters was faultless and the room was spacious by Hong Kong standards. New fittings and a very nice shower. Only complaint is that the shower stall is a bit small and oddly shaped. The hotel location is good. I've always preferred staying on Kowloon side as long as I get a good view of the island. The view at the W is better, being higher up, but you get a better priced deal here. The hotel is also very near the train station for trains to mainland China, which was great for me because I had a day trip to Guangzhou and the MTR operated service is the best way to get around As a Muslim, I particularly appreciated the selection of halal items at their breakfast buffet. This is one of the few hotels in Hong Kong I've had that available. All in, a very good stay and one that I would recommend and return to.

Reviews.Title: “the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: Francoise S
Reviews.Content: As before you leave your country Icon is checking is everything is ok with your trip, I could see I've made a mistake in my reservation and they didi great to fix it immediately to help me. At the arrival, we had a warm and personalized greeting. Overall, the hotel is one of the best I've ever experienced. The design is modern, minimalist, made of high quality materials and items, either in the common places than in your room. The room is really quiet with no noise neither form outside, other rooms or hall. And when you arrived to your room, you are just blowed by the stunned view over the harbour. Evrything is done for your comfort, free Nespresso coffee, free minibar, 100HKD/day/pax of free laundry, ipod dock... Ask for the harbour view, and you could enjoy it when you wake up and at 8pm, enjoy the laser battle shot between the high skyscrappers of HK... The location is fine, you can go easily wherever you need : 5 mn walk to MTR metro that brings you everywhere very quiclky (super safe, super clean), incredible number of (cheap) taxi in the street, the pier is about 15/20 mn by cab or free Icon shuttle, and just 10/15 mn to walk to the old central Kwoloon or the same by cab to HK Island. Don't miss the great gym room located in a glass-cube over the top of the pool, very quiet heated outside pool where you can swim and have a drink or coffee with a great view on HKI and Kwoloon. Don't go without tasting the Above&Beyong 28th level restaurant (make a reservation and ask for a harbour view), great recommandations from the waiter for food and wine (good wines menu). Feel free to ask any tips to the Concierge (best way to go anyway, reservations...), and hope you will enjoy as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Comes at a premium but worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: Marcoe69
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real treat, but be prepared to pay a premium. Our room had a harbour view, which was spectacular at night as you could see the lit up buildings of Hong Kong Island. The staff were exceptionally professional and very friendly. The hotel offers a choice of three restaurants - we had dinner at The Market, great food! All in all, a truly delightful experience!

Reviews.Title: “An icon in a land of skyscrapers...”
Reviews.Author: jjllrr
Reviews.Content: Was just ducking through hong kong on the way to china, and wanted to chill a bit before heading to mainland.. and boy, was i impressed.... The hotel is well located, not far from ladies markets by taxi, perfect position for Hung Hom train station and everything.. although really, you dont even need to leave the hotel... I stayed on the club floor and the room was superb... although i did not opt for the harbor view, the view over the main roads of hong kong were just as impressive... as was the Bed, the pillows, the bathroom, the shower head (so luxurious), bath, toilet, toiletries, and the MINI BAR.. did i say that the mini bar was complimentary? OMG,,, a coffee machine sits on your desk, push a button and espresso ready to go - for FREEEEEEEE.... soft drinks, beer, red bull, perrier, m&ms, nut bars all for free... or should i say, complimentary... nice touch.. Further to this, if on business you even had a printer that you could email files to and print for free as well.... was great... club floor.. brekky.. all awesome.. i have never stayed in a hotel that privided approximately 4 hours of happy hour and free drinks.. cocktails, nibbles and all.. all in the comfort of a lounge overlooking the harbor in trendy replica furniture pieces... nice touch... and staff all very accommodating.. overall, loved it.. asked for some help to catch train to china and how to get to my next hotel from the train to china.. the staff rang my hotel in mainland to establish the best alternatives and kindly left me a message on phone and on screen message service on best way to proceed. Very much in love... will be back for sure.. enjoyed every aspect of it, only regret.. told the wife all about it, now we have to head back there in a few weeks on the way back from mainland..

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: sgsukkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in May last year for 4 nights. upon check in i was informed that i was upgrade to the club room, room only without benefits which is great. This is a hotel where alot of students from the HK university does their attachment, so you see lots of trainees there. When i stayed there it was still new and under the pre-opening period so everything smells fresh Concierge service however was not that good, i ask for a particular recommandation for cheap shopping and dinning that is very local based, they end up recommanding me to high end shopping belts and area which is not what i asked for. They keep pushing you with info for high end things which is not very good. Asked for a slightly later check out on the last day of stay at 12.45pm, not unreasonable at all when it just a mere 45mins, the guy at the reception said "bei hei lo, sei sap mu fen zhong zeh". Doesnt sound that nice. But i m appreciative that i was given a late c/o. Rooms thou were very eco-friendly and housekeeping did a nice job too. Operator was really helpful as i did have problems printing my boarding pass with the printer in the room, he offered to print it out for me and deliver it to my room. Overall, a nice hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor didn't steer us wrong - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: B P
Reviews.Content: Sometimes all the good reviews are hard to believe, because it seems on the Internet a good portion of people are irked about something, but this hotel rocked. Switched our plans to stay at the Mandarin to Hotel Icon after reading all the glowing reviews and were glad we did. Stayed in a Club 80 suite, views were incredible. Breakfast in the Market in the morning was very good with a very large assortment of options. Service was great as well, ordered room service a few times and the food arrived hot tasty, and in a timely manner. All the staff we interacted with were very pleasant. Also the small things like the free mini-bar and items like toothbrushes go a long way to just add to the overall good feeling about staying at this hotel. Stayed as a family and a second bed was already set up without us having to ask for it. The one concern we had were some of the reviews knocked on the location. But Hong Kong has great options for public transportation. The walk to the station really isn't that bad, and the bus to the station comes every 20 minutes. If you're traveling on business and your meetings are all in Central, then I could see the location being a negative, but with so much to see and do in Hong Kong, I think some people make a bigger deal about how the Kowloon side is the 'wrong side' than it really is. Especially when considering a similar room at other hotels will be considerably more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nward_2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Apr 2012. It's one of the best hotels I've experienced, particularly for the price. Good location in Kowloon, great views of the Harbour from a Harbour View room (the picture is from one of their corner suites which are more expensive), modern and clean room with some of the best and friendliest service we've ever experienced anywhere in the world. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: ted m
Reviews.Content: A brand new hotel owned and run by the HK university. Wonderful, contemporary styling, ( the entrance is really wow, with a huge "wall garden" cascading down the open atrrium style area) I understand that Conran was involved. Comfortable rooms, stunning bathroom, free soft drinks mini bar and the most delightful staff you could possibly hope to meet. We were contacted by text 2 days before our arrival and offered taxi or limmo collection from our flight, we went for the limmo, which was fantastic value for money, and were whisked away from the airport (late at night) in sublime comfort. We were treated like royalty when we arrived and was quite taken aback by the level of service and attention to detail.We were taken straight to our room to check in rather than standing at a desk. The following day we realised that every one staying at Icon, was afforded this level of service and continued to enjoy our 3 day stay. The pool on the 9th floor was wonderful and a great get away from a crazy busy city. Breakfast a little expensive but we did get a great deal on the room. Would go back if im ever in HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeSanFrancisco09
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Icon for three days. It was our first trip to Hong Kong and the hotel really exceeded our expectations. Beautiful modern lobby, helpful staff, sleek designed room with a very comfortable bed and cool shower and a view of the Harbor. It was also very quiet which helped with jet lag. The location was an easy walk to the metro and other tourist sites. Everything was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Everytime again!”
Reviews.Author: Wuschel27
Reviews.Content: Nice and quite hotel in Kowloon, not fare from the ferries.

Reviews.Title: “What no tip!?”
Reviews.Author: RobbDale
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were excellent at Hotel Icon. Our only comment was that there wasn't a chance to leave a tip as we checked out. Tipping isn't always customary in Asian countries, but allowing us to leave a tip as we check out to cover all of the services we recieved would have been nice for us. We were able to leave a tip when checking out of a hotel in Bangkock. The tips are collected for the month and then distributed among all the staff at the hotel. Would be nice if Hotel Icon adopted a similar policy. Another option would be to include the tip in the purchase price and let your clients know that in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in HK!”
Reviews.Author: cmathgen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. Staff in friendly and very helpful. Design is just fantastic and food is great. Chinese restaurant on top floor is a delight. Free shuttle service to Harbour City is very convenient. Only negative point is that twin beds are too small to hold two - but that's everywhere in Asia...

Reviews.Title: “The Best Of Hong Kong/The worst weather!”
Reviews.Author: napman
Reviews.Content: My wife travels extensively in SEA and uses Hong Kong as her transition back to the U.S. to unwind and just have a good time. This was my last opportunity to accompany her and we stopped here having been in Thailand, Vietnam, Cambodia and Lao. She left the choice of hotel to me and because of the TripAdvisor reviews we spent three days at the Hotel Icon. At her suggestion I opted for a "Harbor View" room on one of the higher floors. Getting from the airport was a breeze using the train and free bus transportation directly to the hotel. From beginning to end the service was exceptional. The vertical garden in the reception area was beautiful and the room was modern and spacious. Because we just wanted to unwind the first night we had dinner on the top floor restaurant. Great food but even more impressive was the wine list and the help offered by the sommelier. I was able to buy a great bottle of Austrian Riesling at a price I wouldn't be able to duplicate at a retail store here in the States. If it wasn't for the fact it rained and there was a fog cover over Hong Kong for our entire stay it would have been perfect. At best I could barely see across Kowloon Harbor and could only imagine how impressive the evening light show must be if the sky would be clear. We still walked and took cabs, subways and the Ferry in spite of the weather. I hope we can go back again with better weather and would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Icon again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this hotel - It's excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kylie782
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Icon for 3 nights and it is one of the most impressive hotels we have stayed in. The prices are very reasonable for the quality of the hotel, I hope that this continues because its a real draw card. The staff were lovely and attentive, and the rooms were of good size, clean and trendy. The free hotel mini bar (snacks, bottle water and soft drinks) was a really nice touch. The location in Kowloon is not in the middle of Kowloon but its a short walk to the action, or the shuttle can drop you off most places. You can also walk to the MTR without too much trouble. We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: traveljunky20
Reviews.Content: I really cannot recommend this hotel strongly enough. I am particlularly fussy when it comes to choosing a hotel or restaurant. And very critical when it comes to customer service. I have stayed at my fair share of hotels, worldwide, over the years. Both as a solo traveller and accompanied. And I can honestly say that no experience has ever come close to Hotel Icon, on all fronts. The customer service is second to none. And above all, genuine. I cannot bare false niceties or pretentiousness. But this was the real deal. I very rarely stay at the same hotel twice...always on the lookout for the next big thing. But for the Hotel Icon, I could be persuaded to return to Hong Kong, simply to stay at this wonderful hotel once again. A big thankyou to Nick and Joanne in the Above & Beyond Lounge, who always made me feel genuinely welcome. But also to each and every one of you for your kindness and generosity of spirit. Immaculate, beautiful, stylish hotel. Quite literally, Above & Beyond!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very impressive facilities”
Reviews.Author: Superbenj
Reviews.Content: As with the vast majority of the other reviews on here, its very hard to pick any real fault with the Icon. We stayed 3 nights in a Club, harbour view room. The room itself was excellent and very comfortable, not huge by any means but certainly more than comfortable enough for 2, with a large bathroom and great views out over the harbour. The service levels were truly excellent, certainly the best I have every experienced, in every single area of the hotel and the facilities were top notch throughout. The only downsides slightly worth mentioning are the fact that there is no Swiss/ Dutch style cheese or any ham at breakfast and that the Club lounge did get pretty busy during the 'happy hour' and could be slightly bigger, its also a shame they put the bar up against the window, restricting the views a bit, as opposed to the back wall but the drinks and service was still excelent The location was fine for us, there are a number of bars and restaurants within the immediate vicinity of the hotel and it was only a short walk (10-15 mins) from Nathan Road and the MTR and other highlights of TST. I would most certainly consider staying at the Icon again, should I ever be lucky enough to return to Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wishyouwerefloyd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is impressive. Very polite staff, almost too polite and helpful. Everything is clean, orderly and new. Bathroom is clean! Shuttle to most destinations in HK but taxi fare is actually cheap so no problem. Walking distance to the nearest metro though not too accessible if you got a baby in a stroller. A chinese restaurant just across the street, street foods and grocery just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, very modern, great location.”
Reviews.Author: klf1609
Reviews.Content: Have just got home from 3 nights at Hotel Icon and I am pleased to say that it lived up to our very positive first impressions. Located in Kowloon in a quiet but easily accessible area. Getting there from the airport really could not have been easier - just took the airport express train to Kowloon station and took the K3 shuttle bus (included in train ticket price) which stopped at Hotel Icon - piece of cake! Staff were extremely professional and attentive and basically went out of their way to help you in whatever way possible. All staff spoke excellent english which is not that uncommon in Hong Kong but extremely helpful. We were travelling with our 7 month old daughter and they were very accomodating and helped us every single time we were coming or going with the myriad of baby equipment we were juggling. We had a harbour view room which was simply spectacular. The room itself was very cool and reasonably spacious (for China!) given we had a cot in one corner and still felt like we had space. Bathroom was quite large with bath and shower and nice toiletries. Mini-bar and wi-fi both complimentary - great added bonus. Hotel Icon is in between 2 MRT stations so easy to get around however taxis are pretty cheap (compared to Australia). LOTS of great local restuarants within a stones throw with excellent food. We particularly liked Lei Garden (basement level of the Houston centre, about 7 mins walk from hotel) and Jade Restaurant (it also went by another name.. something to do with a terrace) for lunch time dim sum which was off the large plazza/square about a 5 min walk from the hotel - inside a shopping complex type thing on level 2. Also, just across the road is a place called Yum Thai or something similar who did excellent take-away and had a pretty wide variety. Worth noting the hotel is located near the Hong Kong science museum and history musuem. The only two downsides was that the room rate did not include breakfast and food/drinks at the hotel were pretty pricey (nearly $25 for a beer and glass of wine in our room) but there are plenty of options for drinking and eating at your doorstep. Finally - the Kowloon vs Hong Kong Island debate. I will admit we only spent an afternoon on HK island and given we were only there for 4 days we clearly did not see all of Kowloon but when we go back, I would stay in Kowloon again. Firstly you get the added bonus of looking over at HK Island in the evening which is one impressive view but also, it just seemed cooler to me. HK Island felt a little like being in the CBD and while there certainly seemed to be some very cool pockets, I preferred the mainland. Whichever side you stay, both have awesome views and excellent shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish treat”
Reviews.Author: lauralovesit
Reviews.Content: Icon is dramatically, elegantly styled. One of the newer kids on the block, not all taxi drivers will know it, but they will soon. The lobby has high ceilings, a 'vertical garden' (shallow-rooted plants growing up the wall) and graceful furniture. The welcome staff are very attentive and the-right-side of friendly, looking after guests in casual chinos and jumpers. The pool and gym are stunning with sweeping views from the 9th floor. Make sure you indulge in a steam before you leave and marvel at the high-tech changing room. My room was a city view (actually a view over the road) but quiet up on the 22nd floor. The free minibar (soft drinks and M&Ms) was a very welcome treat and room stationery, presented in a slick wooden box, highly coveted! I slept like a baby in the super-soft, 7foot wide bed and enjoyed the good selection of TV channels (English, Chinese, various languages - docus, movies and news. Not too many options, not too few) on one particularly lazy morning. There is plenty of storage room for your luggage and hanging space for evening clothes. The bathroom has a large curved door that slides back elegantly to open and close. Curved lines are used as an attractive theme in the basin, shower surround and mirrors with dark tiles adding indulgent mystique. The bath comes with a TV at the foot for ultimate spoiling. Although I booked a non-smoking room, it smelt faintly of cigarettes if the AC was switched off, a shame since I don't like to use AC where avoidable. Likewise, the bathroom could have done with a drain purge as I occasionally got a waft of unpleasantness. The restaurants were good and had tasty menus, but the bars were closed just after midnight each night, even for hotel residents; not ideal for those in town to celebrate weddings, for example. Equally, the bar at the 28th floor, Above & Beyond, is well-designed and comfortable, but there was a sense of exclusivity and not being wholly welcome on arrival. Not ideal when you are resident. However, taken in sum, this is a wonderful hotel; well worth splashing out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but costly for what you got”
Reviews.Author: msnora
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, good location. We had 2 nights in Hong Kong Thursday & Friday nights. We booked Hotel Icon with a Harbor View room. Our room was only partially harbor view. and I was not happy with this, but I did not complain as we were heading to Oz for a month and this was only a stop over. Anyway we booked this hotel so as we could see the light shows and the light shows were only on Wed & Sat nights., no fault of the hotel. Room was very comfy, absolute best was the free WIFi. We had one drink at the pool bar, pool seemed fabulous but was too cold to use. We did not eat at the hotel as we like to go on holidays to tour the cities and just sleep at the hotel. Had a great time walking the City....my biggest bit of advise is if you are changing currency to Hong Kong Dollars ask at a few places before you agree to change, prices vary in a big way.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth for money”
Reviews.Author: Patcharapa
Reviews.Content: We had unpleasant experience at Hotel Icon. We paid extra for club priviledge, but were treated second class. We booked for Habour view but got buildings view. Breakfast was so-so and never change menu. Don't understand why they get a reward.

Reviews.Title: “Something Special for a Change”
Reviews.Author: russell t
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Icon. We had access to the club package which is worth the money and had a terrific and quirky room. Great facilities and amenities with a free mini bar and plenty of goodies to keep us interesting in the lounge and fridge..! Amazingly good clean with a fantastic cleaner who I wanted to take home as she was so good at tidying up...! Buffet breakfast was excellent - huge range and excellent quality. Food in the foyer was good though the air conditioning could be a little ferocious...! Evening buffet was first class - the best outside of the Bellagio in Las Vegas (and I have sampled a few...!). A tiny gripe was the ingress of noise from the lounge bar as we were directly underneath where the staff worked serving drinks - we could hear the noise of heels which was a little disturbing. Loved the room, bed, service and the pool was clean, warm and a real pleasure to jump into...! I love Hong Kong and this hotel make it even more special...!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish”
Reviews.Author: cervino75
Reviews.Content: the hotel is amazing, rooms are big and very well furnished, very modern and you can easily see it has been carefully studied. the area outside is nice as well and you can either enjoy the gym with a wonderful view on the bay either go running IN the bay! but what you will really enjoy is breakfast which really let your day start much much better! the variety of food and the very good quality of it will for sure let you be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Butlers ( Nottingham )”
Reviews.Author: Keith19_12
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this Hotel, The view over harbour was great.The hotel was very clean and spacious. All staff were so friendly. Breakfast has a very good selection for all tastes. A special thanks to bar manager Nik and his staff in the above and beyond lounge. Great cocktails, Long Island ice tea special mention.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first class”
Reviews.Author: PetenCarole
Reviews.Content: We booked a harbour view club room, and were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel special, with personalised check-in. Our room was stylish and sophisticated, like the rest of the hotel, and we liked its understated and spacious elegance. Breakfast at the 'Above and Beyond' lounge was excellent - a perfect combination of buffet and cooked-to-order. We particularly enjoyed the fresh fruit, which was delicious and included raspberries, strawberries, blueberries and exotic-looking dragon fruit. In the evenings, the lounge bar served complimentary drinks and snacks, which guaranteed a lively atmosphere. One thing we noticed was the range of travellers in the bar - groups, couples and single travellers, all of whom seemed perfectly at ease there. We dined one night in the Market cafe, which we thoroughly enjoyed. The 'wall garden' is amazing - we couldn't believe it was real! - but the occasional flower head falling off onto our tablecloth confirmed that indeed it was. We made use of the gym and also the pool, despite the cold weather - and were very glad of the 'Timeless' lounge, to relax in before our late night flight. To sum up - staff were friendly, professional and attentive, facilities were excellent, food delicious. Service standards were exceptional. If we visit Hong Kong again, this is where we will stay - it is absolutely first class.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, you'll want to stay there”
Reviews.Author: DangerousDolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a city view room for our last night in Hong Kong (just coming back from Macau). We added the Club room package and that meant checking on floor 28 (nothing special, the regular desk had no line), nice afternoon tea in the calm lounge on floor 28, drinks (we didn't go) and breakfast (in the lounge or the restaurant on floor 2) Everyone in the staff was really nice! The room was great, with printer, Nespresso machine, great bed and TV over the tub ;-) With the club room we were allowed to check out at 3 PM, which was great since we had a late flight. We had a bit of an issue getting the cab-drivers to understand where we wanted to go, they didn't seem to recognize the name of the hotel or the streets English name. If we would have stayed more than one night I would have asked for a note to show them :) Personally I'm happy we didn't start off at hotel Icon - I wouldn't have felt the need to see the city at all - I would have just stayed in the hotel all day ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Location OK (could be better, but not that bad)”
Reviews.Author: mahme
Reviews.Content: We were travelling as a group of 10 friends and this hotels seemed to offer a great price/quality ratio. It clearly is not the Four Seasons Hong Kong, but certainly deserves its 5* ranking. Pros: -Rooms are new, well appointed, clean. Harbour View rooms have an amazing view of the bay (probably only topped by Penisnula, sheraton and Intercontinental). -Public areas are very nice. -Fitness/Swimming pool is very well equipped (better than many 5* Hotels) -Service was extremely good. Everybody was very polite and the swimming pool staff clearly went out of their way to help! Cons: -Check-in took forever. An Intern was taking car of us, and it probably took around 12-15 minutes to process us. There was no queu, just a slow receptionist. - Was given smoking room even though I reserved a non-smoking. Someone came within 5 minutes to give us keys to our new room, so the hotel was really good dealing with that. - Elevator are extremely slow (there are 4 elevators, so you won't wait vry long, but once you're in, it takes a really long time to go up 20 floors). I can't say I timed it, but it is noticeable enough for me to mention it - Breakfast has a great selection of Western and Asian. Lots of choices, but I foudn the Congee station lacked the wide array of condiemnt you'd expect (they only had 3 condiemints) -Could not find shoe horn in the room.
