I didn't spend more than 3 minutes looking - I always have on in my suitcase so I was fine - but, if it is in the room, the shoe horn should be be that difficult to find in the first place - Location: Could be worse, but could be better. There are many shops nearby (Pacific Coffee Company, Starbucks...) and the walk to Canton Road is about 5-10minutes through nice streets with lots of shops (so it goes by pretty fast).

Reviews.Title: “Good all round”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttish_Wanderers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a harbour view club room. The room itself was spacious by Hong Kong standards and because we'd booked the club room we had a free mini bar, nespresso coffee machine and tea making facilities. The one downside was that although we'd booked a harbour view room because of the direction our room faced we couldn't see the 'symphony of lights' from our window. Booking the club room was definitely worth it just for the breakfast which was excellent. They also offered afternoon tea and cocktails in the club lounge daily. We ate in the green restaurant on the ground floor a couple of times and the food was lovely and the service very good. The staff were lovely and always very helpful. The hotel was a pleasant 20 minute walk from the star ferry and also offered a free shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: blueberrybadger
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel with a young and eager staff. Politeness and courtesy were the watchwords throughout our stay. Club rooms and the Above and Beyond lounge while not cheap are exceptionally good value. Excellent breakfast selection, well appreciated afternoon tea and pre dinner drinks. Bed was super comfortable, and the bathroom is stunning. Super deep bathtub with TV is always appreciated. Shower looks great and has both rain fall and three setting hand shower. As it is a walk in shower then there is some splashing onto the floor. My only comment is that the bathroom mirror could be better lit. The gym managed to get me to actually exercise in the morning, double or triple height windows over Victoria Harbour made for a more motivating run than most hotel gyms provide.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, relaxed, friendly luxury”
Reviews.Author: Michaela2011
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a seven night vacation to Hong Kong, and we stayed at Hotel ICON for the duration. From the moment our limousine (arranged by the hotel at very reasonable price) collected us at the airport, to our seamless checkout and limousine pick up yesterday, we loved every moment at the hotel. We didn't want to come home! Hotel ICON is stylish, calm, relaxed and extremely comfortable. The facilities are lovely and the staff just could not be more welcoming, accommodating and friendly. We had a 38 Harbour View room, and loved waking up every day to see the bustling activity on the water, and the views across to Hong Kong island. We were a little worried about noise as everyone told us HK is noisy 24/7, but we slept soundly every night and barely heard a thing – the extremely comfortable beds and pillows helped! We included breakfast in our booking, and thoroughly enjoyed the various buffets every day in The Market restaurant or in the Above & Beyond restaurant on the 28th Floor. We were never hungry until the evening, so having breakfast at the hotel meant we got to do more during the day without having to worry about lunch. The location of the hotel was perfect for us as well. A five minute stroll takes you to the Avenue of the Stars along the water's edge, or if you stay walking along Mody Road you are soon at East Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. Hung Hom station is a five minute walk in the other direction behind the hotel. Both stations offer access to many of the city's attractions via the MTR (which is so cheap and efficient it makes London's underground look a shambles!). If you like a bit of luxury, but don't enjoy the overbearing nature and dress codes of some other 4 and 5 star hotels, you will really enjoy Hotel ICON. You get all the luxury and 5* service, without the pompousness. We will certainly be recommending it to anyone who visits HK. Thank you to all the staff at the hotel for making our trip to Hong Kong a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “hong kong 25 years later”
Reviews.Author: terry m
Reviews.Content: we stayed in hong kong 25 years ago and stayed in buget hotel in Kowloon. We came back here and chose the ICON Hotel, and we were very impressed. Staff was excellent,and very accomodating. We had breakfast on 28th floor everyday, food and service EXCELLENT. Would recommend this place and we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around”
Reviews.Author: bbs220
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room with great views and very reasonably sized for Hong Kong, but the service is what really made the stay great. Staff was incredibly helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, getting taxis and was especially helpful in helping me track down a very specific gift I was looking for. The location in on the Kowloon side may not work as well if you're only in HK for a day and looking to have everything on your door step, but the ICON is great if you have a couple days and want a great homebase for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: nakdaddy01
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed at. A bit on the pricey side, but well worth it. Great views of the city and great location. Amazing modern decor!

Reviews.Title: “Fully deserved its award winning status”
Reviews.Author: Brusselscharlie
Reviews.Content: We went to the Icon Hotel with high expectations and were not disappointed. We were particularly impressed by 3 aspects : 1)the excellent sound insulation which is so rare even in very expensive hotels. In the Icon we were not disturbed by the noise of slamming doors of adjoining rooms or cleaning staff having a good chin wag in the corridor; 2) the level of service which is completely unobtrusive, but always one step ahead of the customer; 3) the general design carried through even to the writing pens and the eye for detail; It was the first time I didn't have to kneel on the floor to access the room safe; in the Icon I found the safe in a drawer - excellent idea ! The location may not be the best in HK and the nearest subway stop is a good 10 minute walk, but this is a very minor drawback when measured up to all the other positive aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matthias M
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great view, great service! Couln't made a better choice

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant views of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: SweetpeaOlive
Reviews.Content: Everything you read about the hotel is true, it is very good. The decor is quirky and interesting, it looks like the interior decorators have been given free reign to go crazy. When booking the hotel I was a little concerned about the location, however the hotel runs a free shuttle bus very 20 mkns to the Peninsula hotel and Harbour City shopping centre. From either of the stops it's an easy walk to the Star Ferry or MRT. There is also an abundance of cheap restaurants around the hotel. If it is your first time to HK I recommend you pay a little extra for a Harbour view, it is truly spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Sendationell”
Reviews.Author: Catcha82
Reviews.Content: I visited the Icon during HK 7's. Checked in for 2 nights. Just the best "home base" I ever had. Pool and Spa area are amazing. An massage I booked aswell. It was just perfect and absolutely relaxing. Breakfast was outstanding and the room service as fast as its possible! Place to be in hongkong. And for sure I'll check in there again, if I travelle to HK next time.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneLin
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, contemporary hotel. Under a year old and everything is perfect. Great service - plenty of staff to help with whatever need you have. The rooms are very nice - the bathrooms are great. Used the gym, which is one of the nicest I've ever seen. Ate at all three restaurants. Only complaint - had dinner one night at Above and Beyond and thought it was mediocre. Wished we had eaten that dinner at The Market, which looked fabulous! Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiresfunkyd
Reviews.Content: Firstly, many thanks to my fellow reviewers in tripadvisor, based on your reviews I chose ICON. I arrived early, staying during the peak season last week for the Rugby 7s and was quickly moved through to a personal check in, upgraded to a lovely room, with a stunning view across to Hong Kong island.... The design, service and room amenities were excellent.... the management and staff are really focusing on the small things, which for regular travellers make the real difference. We only ate in top floor restaurant both myself and my chinese friend were very impressed by the food and an excellent wine list.....the breakfast served in the morning was also far more comprehensive than I expected. In terms of the gym, very clean, very modern, excellent machines and plenty of cardio equipment...high ceiling and all looking out on to the swimming pool, sun-deck and views across to Hong Kong island... The location is a short taxi ride through the tunnel to Hong Kong island, or catch the Star ferry across the water... couldn't be easier :-) So overall, I simply can't fault it...an excellent hotel, good location, excellent facilities and very nice professional staff....

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at the Hotel Icon”
Reviews.Author: JBPtraveller
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Icon, and although both visits were not without their issues, I look forward to staying there again. The food is first class, and the views from the top floor towards the island, are stunning both day and night. The technology works, and the rooms are very comfortable. A special thanks to Nick, the 'Above & Beyond' Manager as when issues arise, he is on had to help at all times.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: roger s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super modern. staff was super courteous, the food was great. the views of Hong Kong harbor are spectacular. its a great place to do business and the food was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Alexander Z
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly staff! A great design! All for your convenience! The best hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding: Superb Staff and Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Raddisch
Reviews.Content: A funky new(ish) hotel located in Kowloon, Hong Kong that is run as part of a Hospitality University. The staff are largely students at the University, but don't let stop you, what they lack in experience they make up for in enthusiasm and service (probably the best I have had in Asia..and I have spent 60 nights in asian Hotels in the last year) We stayed for 7 nights in the ICON 36 Harbour View Room (2 adults and one baby) and it was a very comfortable room, and a standard size for Hong Kong rooms in this price range. A very spacious cot was provided. The very modern bathroom had a deep bath and a separate shower that included a rain shower head. The Pool and the gym were beautiful and also ultra modern. There is a day-spa and a "Chill-out room" that can be used if you check out of your room and need to wait for a flight. Location wise, it is only a short walk to the train station and a 15 min walk to the Ferry Terminal, though there is a complimentary shuttle bus that runs every 20 minutes to Harbour City Shopping Centre and the Ferry area. Wireless is included in the cost of the room and is readily available throughout the hotel and the shuttle bus! We ate at both the "Market" and the "Green" restaurants and they were both fantastic. The buffet at the Market was especially good, even for those (like myself) usually turned off by buffets (particularly hotel ones). The view from the bar on the roof (Above and Beyond)is excellent The hotel was very kid friendly, with a playground and basketball courts next door, plenty of high chairs, baby cutlery, complimentary toys etc. But for the the business traveller, don't let this sway you against the hotel, the walls are thick and the families are largely grouped on the same floors (at least it appeared they were), so I believe it is suitable for all class of traveller. I can not speak highly enough of this funky hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: NLBanker
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews and scores I had expected more. Nevertheless: The Icon is a very good hotel. Great service for late departures. Staff is very friendly. I'll be coming back here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Comfort and Service. I'll return.”
Reviews.Author: AussieCoasterKing
Reviews.Content: Rarely do you have something exceed your expectation but I'm pleased to say the Hotel Icon well exceeded ours. Our Suite was modern, comfortable (except the bed was a little hard) and very practical for our family of three. The complimentary mini bar and wireless internet we're the added touches that, for a change, meant I came away not feeling like I was gouged for every little thing. Although a reluctance from reception to supply a few extra cans of soft drink disappointed me a little. We stayed on the 18th floor with a good view when the fog wasn't blocking it. When I return I will be asking for a room on a higher floor so the view isn't as dominated by roofs. We chose to have the buffet breakfast which was considered the best we'd ever had and dinned in the top floor chinese restaurant which had a great view, relaxed atmosphere and delicious food. The other pleasant surprise was the reasonable priced, prompt and beautiful room service. We found ourselves looking for reasons to stay in so we could get room service! We loved the warm pool on the 9th floor with great views. Ideally it would be open a little later then 9.30 though. The gym and change rooms (including sauna for men and steam room for women) where modern and never crowded. Once we got our bearings transport was a breeze. We mainly used the MTR but also took advantage of the frequently running free shuttle service the hotel offers and the staff we're always helpful. My only suggest would be the shuttle stopped at more locations. We used two taxis while in Hong Kong. Although cheap you get what you pay for including one taxi driver refusing to take us all the way to the hotel. Overall Hotel Icon is a clean, modern hotel with helpful staff. It appears to be geared towards the business traveller but didn't stop us from enjoying ourselves and looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: catherina_10
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, a beautiful room and bathroom, great beds, super breakfast. An easy shuttlebus to the centre or harbour. A lounge where, after your checkout, can wait and refresh untill your flight. But the best was the service !

Reviews.Title: “Funky boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: denzil67
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4nights in march in the harbor view room icon 36. Rooms well laid out and functional and bathroom fantastic with rain shower and ultra modern feel. Hotel close to tst east about 10 minutes walk and near enough to Nathan road and star ferry terminal. Good location if you don't mind a bit of a walk. Modern, clean, minimalistic...all very good

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: EmmCeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club 38 room and my father in a club 36 room. From the minute we first entered the hotel to the minute we left we experienced service like no other hotel. The friendliness of all the staff, but especially Stella, was second to none. The rooms were great and they had thought of everything, even a stapler and sticky tape and scissors! The above and beyond extras is fantastic, the breakfast is great, afternoon tea and cocktail hour is fantastic. The free mini bar, the laundry, the list goes on! The chinese restuarant on level 28 is amazing. But then so is Green and The market. This will be the only hotel we will stay at when we are in Hong Kong and any other hotel we stay at we would compare to Hotel Icon. A hotel that the management should be proud of....please dont ever lose this level of service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ponyo69
Reviews.Content: I am staying at ICON for two nights right now in a club room/full suite. Pros: 1) Excellent service/great staff 2) Good shuttle bus service(but somewhat wild driving...) Now, here comes CONS: 1) The doors very heavy 2) The Club lounge(i.e. the Above and Beyond) is very small/ very very LIMITED selection of foods - there's no point of going to the lounge (it was also linked with regular Chinese rest. and I believe the bar was also functioning as a regular bar? so there's no exclusiveness here) I was there last night (Sat. night) and it was so crowded so I just came back to my room 3) The staff needs more English proficiency - I asked for a bathroom towel but they simply ignored it (as they tend to do in this city when they don't understand English?) 4) I am staying at a suite - yes, it is a harbour view but it is very misleading - there are number of high-rise buildings right in front the hotel (e.g. Hotel Nikko) - so it is somewhat ugly sight - and that goes for the pool on the 9th floor as well. 5) The location is a little bit off from the center (but its okay) So next time, I am going to Four Seasons af IFC(which was also on my list but I've been to Four Seasons before so I tried ICON this time). Again, it may be the personal preference, if you have the budget, I'd go for the Four Seasons at IFC.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elbo99
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely couple of days here before heading over to stay on the HK island side. I love the decor, the service has been great, good sized rooms (Icon 36 king bed) and lovely facilities. When we checked in from an overnight flight, they said they could give us a room straight away, but it was on a lower floor (11). We jumped at it and the view was still great. We used the babysitting service which was good. Overall, good value and loads of eateries nearby if you don't want to run up your hotel bill too quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: therealmissrita
Reviews.Content: The first thing we did when we got to our room was rush to open the curtains and check out the view (we chose to stay in Kowloon as to have a great view of Hong Kong). We weren't disappointed. Then we noticed what a great room it was - roomy, modern, clean; very comfortable bed. A big plus for me was the deep tub and the two-head shower. Thanks to jet-lag and overall excitement about being on vacation in Hong Kong, we were up really early and went up to the gym & pool on the 9th floor. The facilities are great, and you can enjoy some astounding harbor views while you swim or workout. The breakfast buffet is really stocked; everything you could possibly imagine for breakfast and then some. I like walking so the fact that it is a bit of a trek to the ferry & the subway didn't bother us, and since it was raining a lot, we discovered you can pretty much get anywhere in Kowloon by using the underground passages. I recommend the Icon if you want a view of Hong Kong, a bigger room than you get on the Island for the price, and the great gym & pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay and will definitely revisit.”
Reviews.Author: AshleyHolidays
Reviews.Content: The luxury of staying in a new stylish hotel is topped by excellent service from most of the staff. Pluses Luxury hotel with all amenities included. Basics such as toiletries, cable TV, adjustable air con, linen and towels. Also included are coffee/tea, bar snacks, hair dryer, bathroom scale and most importantly free WIFI. And oh the bathtub comes with a TV. Gym and pool both have a nice city view. Service is mostly friendly and welcoming with some staff more enthusiastic than others. After all the hotel is a training ground for college students at the university next door. There are plenty of places to eat outside the hotel and I think a cinema too. Complimentary hotel shuttle bus every 20 minutes takes you to and from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR and then entrance to Harbour City which is a massive mall filled with shopping, eating and entertainment. Free Airport shuttle to and from the airport express train terminal. Taxi cab of 20 HK dollars will take you to Tsim Sha Tsui shopping district. Lots of shopping and eating there as well as a feet reflexology massage for around 99 HK dollars. Hair washing is also quite enjoyable with ample scalp massage and scratching. Taxi cab of 35 HK dollars to Mongkok. There you can visit some market stalls and try the cheap and cheery, one Michelin star yum cha restaurant named Tim Ho Wan. Taxi cab of 50 HK dollars to Kowloon airport express terminal where you can check in your luggage and take a train to the airport. Room for improvement Is it possible to add a door to close off the shower space as water splashes out in large amounts? Same goes with the bathroom sink tap that is placed on the side meaning water splashes out of the basin. Instead of up-selling our hotel package why not just upgrade us for free : P

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MarchMagnolia
Reviews.Content: Excellent, sets the standard, good location, great views, roof top pool is a great experience, try it day and night, exceptionally nice,welcoming staff. Contemporary Luxury that manages not to be pretentious. Highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room, Excellent Service, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: kmstpete
Reviews.Content: What more could you want? The place is hip and stylish without going overboard. Breakfast was delicious - didn't dine here otherwise, but the menus looked great. The infinity pool on the 9th floor was amazing...want to come back when it's warmer just to swim here! Would highly recommend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK. Just don't prepay or book ahead”
Reviews.Author: SeniorSailor
Reviews.Content: If you haven't brought your cat and would like to swing it around the room...it's OK. If you haven't just disembarked from a cruise liner with a bigger, more luxurious stateroom & bathroom.....it's OK. If you haven't just checked out of the luxurious Mandarin Oriental in Macau....it's OK. If ridiculously dim lighting in the bathroom and a stupid floor-flooding shower appeal to you....it's OK. Why this hotel is number 1 is totally beyond me. The rest of the hotels in Hong Kong must really be appalling. We booked and had to pay for this hotel a few weeks before we took our trip. We booked and paid for a harbour view room. After booking and paying we found a cheaper price on the Qantas web site for a room on the exec floor which includes breakfast, free drinks, club lounge access etc. When we checked in we complained about the bad business practice of taking our money and then lowering the price, asked if we could be upgraded to a club room, which in essence we had paid for, to be told that hotel was full. We were told our original room was on floor 18 but was not ready! This was at 4.30pm!! We then were given a room on 16th floor. The room was the worst we've had in our recent extensive travels. A manager rang us and we told him we felt ripped off by the hotels dubious marketing, that the wardrobe was too small to put all our clothes in and we were deeply disappointed in the hotel. We were given a mobile clothes rack (making the small, depressing room more like a Chinese laundry), a nespresso machine and a few grandiose gestures that if a better room became available we would be upgraded. Our 5 day stay resulted in no upgrade, of course. The staff are all very nice and welcoming but we have found that the Chinese people in general are really very nice. This is still a lousy hotel. The room service menu is boring and lacks real choice. Whoever designed the bathroom should be made to mop it up after every shower and sentenced to a week trying to shave or put on makeup in the dingy, twilight lit bathroom. Years ago when I came to Hong Kong I stayed at the Shangri La and that was fantastic, things can't have deteriorated so much here that the Icon is the best. When we return to Hong Kong the Icon Hotel would be the very last place I would stay. Check the specials before you commit to a booking or better still do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great place.”
Reviews.Author: minerva14
Reviews.Content: This is how all hotels should be. It's wonderfully stylish and sophisticated yet very comfortable with the best bedding I've ever slept in. Service is excellent The shuttle is perfectly fine for getting to the station or shopping areas and taxis to the hotel are cheap and easy to find so getting around is no problem. The free minibar, fluffy robes, tv over the bath, all make you feel pampered and cared for. Great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsMichie
Reviews.Content: Rooms are quite big and comfortable.. Staffs are all very friendly.. View also not bad... Comfortable bed and unique bathroom.. Free wifi, movie channel can be upgrade a bit... Well, I'll come for next visit...

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: sst940
Reviews.Content: Stayed at one of the club rooms, Harbour View (the view is fabulous)! Took about 10-15 min. by walk to Harbor City, but not inconvenient at all location-wise. Service is great (especially at the club lounge - staffs are very efficient) Tried room service - speedy and efficient and food was good. Good wi-fi connection, free beverages and snacks - all excellent. Highly recommend this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Corrie P
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Great location. Great views. Rooms on the small side, but all rooms in HK are. Comfortable stay with staff who made our stay even more enjoable. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nulli Secundus [second to none ]”
Reviews.Author: ken m
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at the Hotel Icon for 8 nights at the end of Febuary. The only comment is FAULTLESS The staff were excellent , the food is superb , accomodation is palatial. After having a hiccup over breakfast , i was given the title of Mr Cornflake, this was actually very complimentary. and onlly showed the attentiveness of the staff.. 5 star all over Personal thanks must go to Eric , Ross, and Nick. Should we ever go back to HK it will be the Icon. Mr and Mrs Mott.. Essex

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry R
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from one of my regular visits to Hong Kong on business and this is the first time of staying at the Hoel ICON (usually staying with the Shangri La). What a breath of fresh air this place is! Instead of being just another guest, I really felt welcome here. Wherever I went in the hotel, I was greeted with smiling faces and genuine concern that I would get the best out of my stay in Hong Kong. It didn't matter what was required, they provided all the information speedily and happily. I stayed in a Club Room and they are a good size, spotlessly clean and really comfortable and well appointed. Tastefully designed and decorated, the bathroom is just fantastic, including a TV overlooking the bath ( believe me, relaxing in a hot tub of water after a long day, whilst keeping up to date with the news back home is just great). Because I was in a Club Room, I was entitled to have afternoon tea and in the evening, cocktails with food all at no extra cost each day. Add to that, a free mini bar (and it is re-stocked twice a day) and even a small amount of laundry and dry cleaning free each day. Why would you ever want to stay anywhere else? I cannot leave this review without expressing enough that the true excellence with this hotel is it's staff. They are without doubt, the best part of the experience and I will return for all future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Proholiday10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days but I say it was great. Food was exellent. Rooms were very comfortable. Transportation was super convienent. The only downside was that it was a bit noisy because it was near the cross Barbour tunnel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the world's (hidden) best.”
Reviews.Author: StephanosK
Reviews.Content: Was stunned. Incredibly well-designed spaces and rooms- particularly fond of the grey leather chairs Terence Conran has designed. Staff are outstanding. All the more when you learn it is a training hotel, affiliated with he nearby Hospitality Training Programme. Everything is sensible- free minibar, free wifi, breakfast only if you want it included. I arrived from Guangzhou by train, so the station was a convenient 3 mins walk away. However, thisis on the Kowloon side, so if you want to be near Central, etc be advised. Best hotel i have stayed at in HK, and one of the top worldwide. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: OneAdvisedTraveller
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big, the beds comfortable, and the breakfast very good, a really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, personalised service”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaAndDavid
Reviews.Content: Having booked a very good rate online, we didn't have unrealistic expectations about the type of hotel we would be staying at in Hong Kong. But the Hotel Icon turned out to be one of the best, most luxurious hotels we have stayed at in recent times. The interior design of the whole building is breathtaking. The living wall that spans three floors is an incredible feature. The room was finished to the last detail. We particularly like the 'round bathroom' design. We had read that the staff of the hotel were in training from a nearby university. If this is the case I am extremely surprised. The staff of most five-staff hotels don't come close to the level of service at Icon. We dined at each of the three restaurants. Above & Beyond was a good degustation but rushed service. The Market had a terrific breakfast. The downstairs restaurant was basic and nothing to rave about. A great experience. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “My third stay at this property”
Reviews.Author: Henson_8
Reviews.Content: This is the Best Hotel in HongKong so Far, i have been traveling to Hongkong since 1988 stayed in numerous Hotel, only down side is the Location, need to wait for a shuttle to all the shopping and attraction, service is excellent, food is great, rooms are all brand new and well appointment, Pool Sauna & Gym at no extra cost. for people that are taking a late flight out the hotel even gives you a place to relax while waiting for your flight. what more can i ask????

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WandsworthWanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights on our way home from New Zealand and we were not disappointed in any way. Yes, the hotel is in Kowloon and a little bit away from the main action (but only a 10 minute walk from the Star ferry terminal) but it has tremendous views, incredible facilities and probably the most helpful staff of any hotel I've stayed in. Our room (which was a club room with Harbour view) was very well appointed. As we got a laundry allowance with the room, we even got home without any laundry to do! The food was excellent (and we enjoyed a terrific view of the Harbour lights) and all the hotels common areas are very well decorated. I was even more impressed when I received what was a very reasonable bill for our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Beautiful Design and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelinstylegirl
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through a google search of hotels in the Tsim Sha Tsui area. It is relatively new and we picked this hotel because it was very nice from the photos and yet reasonably priced unlike it's neighboring hotels. When we arrived we were not disappointed-- it was indeed as beautiful and stylish as the photos suggested and it was very hip and trendy without being over the top. The rooms were nice and comfortable and the staff very helpful and pleasant. This is a teaching hotel where students from the hotel school probably do their internship or practicum, which is why most of the staff are young, very pleasant and enthusiastic, which I think is a great thing. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to Harbor City every half hour which is very convenient, but if you are the walking type like me, it is a very pleasant 15 minute walk to Canton Road/Nathan road where all the shopping is located. The restaurant on the 28th floor is also excellent, offering excellent views of the harbor. Will definitely stay here again and recommend to others visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel great Design”
Reviews.Author: Helen H
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay in Hong Kong the ICON was absolutley fabulous the rooms the staff service and food was definitely 5 star +. All the staff were especially friendly and helpful our check in was hassle free and the room on the 21st floor was fabulous. We are looking froward to going back to Hong Kong and stay again. Thanks to all at the ICON who made our holiday so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: ROGALA1
Reviews.Content: Just completed a long tour in Asia and the ICON was the greatest surprise of all Hotels (all 5* and much more expensive). The concierge service is great, accurate recommendations and getting out of their way to help you out. I will definetely return to the ICON next time I am in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great Room”
Reviews.Author: ladyluck168
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to get to from Hong Kong Airport with express train.They provided a free airport Shuttle bus to/from the hotel every 15 minutes.Once you alight the train and exit the control station, look out for the sign Airport Express Shuttle Bus Service, We had booked a harbourview room after reading other reviews and it was definately worth it. The room is great ,clean and good service from hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon”
Reviews.Author: tshields
Reviews.Content: Just back from a few days in Hong Kong and felt I had to write about this fantastic hotel. We arrived after an overnight flight (used the hotel's limo service) to be greeted by name with the fantastic news our room was ready - in fact we had been upgraded - and we could do an "in room" check in! It really doesn't get much better than this. We had booked a Club 38 room and been upgraded to a Club 65 suite - fantastic. The Above and Beyond lounge with its wonderful views across the harbour was ideal for the complimentary afternoon cocktails and canapes while the included breakfast in the same area was as good as I've had anywhere - eggs benedict with truffled hollandaise..... It was easy to get to where ever we wished to go and the complimentary shuttle to harbour city worked very efficiently. All in all can't wait for an excuse to return

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: globalspoon
Reviews.Content: Love the design of the icon and it is situated in the quieter side of tsim sha tsui away from the craziness of nathan road. The spirit of the hotel is very young and hip but not trendy. The spaces are bright and beautifully designed. Check in was swift and hassle free,we were given a nice room on the 22 nd floor.I love the 24 hour gym facing the island of hong kong. I booked directly through the hotel website with a fantastic rate although non refundable.I am so happy with my choice as most hotels nearby were pricier and probably same view with older rooms. Free mini bar! Loads of toiletries and modern bathroom ! Don't hesitate !

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: FrasWorld
Reviews.Content: If you werent sure about trying icon because it is not part of a big well known chain, then don't worry about your concerns. Give this place a go and you certainly wont regret it. It is outstanding in every way and nothing is forgotten in relation to guest comfort. The staff are attentive and courteous without overdoing it. The rooms are fantastic with nice touch of free soft drinks and sweets. Breakfast is excellent with great choice and good quality. The gym and pool with fantastic views cant be faulted and staff are again very helpful. The "timeless lounge" with comfy seats and refreshments for guests waiting for flights after checking out is a great idea and beats sitting aimlessly in the lobby. In terms of customer service i was extremely impressed. Have been to hong kong many times and stayed at very nice places but this is my new favourite by a long shot. Also the mango daiquiris in the bar are awesome. Well done icon hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: smercury
Reviews.Content: This is an impressive hotel in its technological advances, design, and level of service. They offered a transit lounge for those with late flights after check-out for guests to enjoy free refreshments, lounge in comfortable chairs, and amazing showers. The concierge was always well-staffed and were very helpful. The free shuttle was a great way to get to the train station and to the more exciting part of downtown TST. There was free wifi everywhere, even in the shuttle! We enjoyed the free minibar. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever experienced in a hotel. The breakfast buffet is worth a look, with a nice spread of fresh food. There are several inexpensive restaurants and food stalls within a short walk of the hotel. We wished we took advantage of the pool--it overlooked the harbor with an impressive view.

Reviews.Title: “This is as big a room as you can get in central HK”
Reviews.Author: bottega007
Reviews.Content: We love how spacious the room is which is spacious by any international standard let alone in the land scarce HK. And the bathroom was great if you ignore the poor design of the shower head which leaves the floor wet. The staff try very hard and you really can't complain. Overall the minimalist design appeal to my husband and I. By the way, if you cross the road, there is this place that serves nice local breakfast items for the true local experience. There are a few similar stalls but look for the one with newspaper cuttings of movie star visits. The only thing I need to highlight is that it is quite some distance to walk to the mtr. So in the end, we will take the hotel shuttle out in the morning and take the taxi back at night. Given how lazy I'm, this will be the only reason why I may not return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels....”
Reviews.Author: A S
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to book the club 80 suites during our stay during their grand opening. The staff were attentive and professional striving to meet our every need during our stay. Room service meals were fantastic and quick. Happy hour drinks were wonderful on the club level. The executive day room and use of showers after check out was an absolute bonus with coffee, tea, snacks and movies available before your trip to the airport (after checking out!!!!). Our suite was enormous with a complimentary mini bar and wonderful espresso machine (all complimentary!) I cannot wait to return to the ICON.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, modern, first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: JojozFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend after a week long vacation visiting family in Manila. This hotel was great. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Everything was clean and ultra modern - especially the bathroom. The bed was comfy, mimi bar snacks were free, the lighting and electronics were high tech. The shuttle was punctual, convenient and had free wifi - as did the rest of the hotel. Location was great ... short walk to the harbour, close to restaurants and bars/nightlife, everything else a short shuttle ride away. We booked a harbour view room 19th floor and we flew in late and didn't have enough time to make it to the harbour to watch the symphony of lights so we watched it from the huge floor to ceiling windows of our room. This is definitely the place to stay for a more unique and trendy experience. They even gave us a credit so we could check out the above & beyond lounge for cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay very nicely built.”
Reviews.Author: originalmoru
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice wish they had opening windows. The hotel is relatively new opened in 2011. The service is nice. Clean rooms. The location of the hotel is right in the heart of hong kong. The best part is that the mini bar is free. Had a awesome experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern but partly arrogant”
Reviews.Author: turbotraveller78
Reviews.Content: I booked ICON because it won the tripadvisor award. The roof top bar accepts the last oder between 11 and 12 - too early for a high class hotel. The staff there is too arrogant as if paying clients are not necessary anymore now that they are an award winning hotel. It felt to me as if they would begin to rest on their success. Management did apology after having complained but a negative taste remains. If you are used to the good service many hotels in Asia and Hong Kong offer, why would you go back to ICON if you have alternatives that cost about the same or even less.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have asked for”
Reviews.Author: AWME
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and 2nights on our return from a holiday in NZ. We treated ourselves to a stay in a Club80 suite. The hotel was modern, stylish and beautifully kept, with huge windows maximising the views over Hong Kong Island. The thought that seemed to have gone into making the guests' stay an enjoyable one was extraordinary - from complimenatary hot milk and cookies brought to your room before sleep (preceeded by complimentary afternoon tea then champagne and nibbles on the 28th floor, for club guests), to the powerful "rain" showers in rooms and the gym, to a selection of pillows on the huge and comfortable bed, to the meticulous service from young, charming enthusiastic staff. The hotel is a little further from the harbour and HK island than the Intercontinental and the Peninsula but, having visited these briefly too, is far more edgy and unique. The views from Hotel ICON equalled those raved about in the highly-reviewed Aqua bar/restaurant. The walk is only 10-15 mins to the star ferrry, most of which is along the waterfront, or the hotel seemed to run shuttles to HK island for those who don't like walking. Really hope we get the chance to return again;would absolutely recommend to anyone wanting to feel like a special guest in a special place. Shame we can't give it 6*s!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: hoteljunkieUk
Reviews.Content: 1st class Hotel, friendly polite helpful staff,delicious food, breakfast fresh & varied, the complimentary afternoon tea was perfect on the 28th floor.We enjoyed the all you can eat buffet lunch at the "market" restaurant good value & tasty. Our room on the 25th floor was extremely comfortable spacious & quiet, nespresso coffee machine,large comfortable bed spacious contempory bathroom. All very very good ,we stayed 3 nights, did not want to leave we would highly recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A week in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Ajay P
Reviews.Content: Great Property....very modern...impeccable service...very courteous and friendly staff. You can't go wrong with the Icon, will surely come back the next time in HK. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Soon to be number 1 on Tripadvisor..?!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflowergirl01
Reviews.Content: Originally we had planned on staying on HK island but discovered this hotel through Tripadvisor and booked a week here - so glad we did - the HK skyline is much better viewed from Kowloon side. This is an excellent hotel - the staff were young, enthusiastic, professional and friendly (special mention must go to Angus on the concierge desk!). We had two interconnecting rooms and everything you needed for a very comfortable stay; the views as I have mentioned were stunning (especially at night from the top floor 'above and beyond' lounge with a cocktail in one hand and a plate of delicious nibbles in the other - all included in the club room price!). We had breakfast downstairs in the 'Market' - probably the best I've ever had in a hotel - very good choice. We ate in the restaurant on the top floor next to the Above and Beyond lounge - this was our only slight disappointment - staff in the restaurant were courteous but not over friendly and the food did not arrive all together so I was left with my meal whilst my family had to wait. However the food was of good quality and maybe it was a busy night! The pool was a lovely temperature and I enjoyed a pampering afternoon in the spa. I would highly recommend that if possible book the club level - it was really worth it and it was what made our stay even more special - complimentary cocktails, champagne and nibbles in the evening, soft drinks and tea and coffee all hours, afternoon tea (with scones and clotted cream!), breakfast in the lounge or in the Market restaurant, a credit towards laundry - superb value. The location is not an issue at all - everything in HK is very close! The shuttles to the back of The Peninsular hotel and Ocean Terminal were every 10 minutes, there is an MTR nearby and some days we took taxi's which were incredibly cheap and we never had to wait for one. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great view and stay at Hotel Icon”
Reviews.Author: Annie Y
Reviews.Content: It was a great expereince to stay at Hotel Icon with good services, view, food, and room, especially enjoyed the environment. Pool side view is extremely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, very modern”
Reviews.Author: golferdeluxe
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Icon in Kowloon, just outside Hong Kong. The Hotel is brand new and if you like modern styling, this hotel is just that. The service is impeccable from checkin to checkout. One of the nice things I found out is that the hotel is located 5 minutes walking distance from the Train and Metro station, which is very convenient! Free wifi in the rooms a nice view of the Hong Kong harbour are appreciated. Great place for a stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “IT'S ALL IN THE DETAILS”
Reviews.Author: jordanlipson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ICON last week for 3 nights and truly enjoyed the complete experience. I was warmly greated at the front door by the concierge/club staff and the following 72 hours were some of the most pleasurable ever spent in Hong Kong. The hotel is modern/sleek, techno/eco friendly, calm, sophisticated and quite honestly pretty close to one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. I had a one bedroom club suite on the 26th floor overlooking the HK harbour and it felt like staying in someone's contemporary 5 star apartment vs being in a hotel room. The living room, master bathroom with a walk-in "rain" shower and large tub, bedroom and office/bar area were really well designed and if the lighting had been just a little brighter it would have been close to perfection. The restaurants all stimulate your senses with their tasteful food choices and eye pleasing atmospheres. Breakfast at the Market is a fun experience (but be sure to book ahead for dinner) and the club (a happy hour hangout) on the top floor adjacent to the Above and Beyond Chinese restaurant has a really nice vibe to it with great views and cool mid century furniture. The lobby bar/restaurant is another well designed environment with lots of glass and a unique wall garden installation (a must see) and their weekend tea service and homemade cupcakes appear to be generating a major attraction for the locals. The only flaw with being in or around the lobby is that the hotel is not designed for those rare "cold" evenings in HK when the temperature heads south. I would suggest that the hotel reconfigures the front doors to help limit the impact of the NW wind on those cool February days. The staff (many of them students of the school that built and manages the hotel) are world class and need to be congratulated for their level of professional excellence. You would honestly have no idea that this hotel was a "training" hotel unless you read the dedication plack on the side of the front entrance. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel and most certainly plan to be back next time I am in the bustling city of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel especially considering the price”
Reviews.Author: ClaytonO
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel. The rooms were spacious with an extremely comfortable bed. The bathroom was large with an amazing dinner plate rain shower head. Everything was spotless and of extremely high standard. And the best thing ... the FREE mini bar was re-stocked daily and contained water and soft drinks and mini packets of M&Ms. The staff were brilliant and welcoming. During check-in the staff gave a description of the room facilities, the facilities and the area. The hotel even has a guest lounge on the 8 or 9th floor for those people waiting for their room or after check-out which had free soft drinks, reading materials and use of the showers, which is a facility more hotels should have. As for location, it is slightly out of the Tsim Sha Tsui district, but still close enough for it not to be an issue. There are plenty of shops and restaurants (including McDonalds) right nearby. To walk to the Harbour City shopping mall only took 20 minutes, and Nathan Road is only 15 minutes away. And the subway station is just 5 minutes stroll. Overall this is an excellent hotel which I would highly recommend. Hotels in Hong Kong aren't cheap, and for the price and the quality this hotel would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: chayato
Reviews.Content: A 5* hotel managed by a hospitality management university in Tsim Tsa Shui. I stayed there 5 nights in Feb 2012. Excellent brand new facilities with outstanding equipment and services. Smooth pricing for Hong Kong. I stayed in a club room with a harbor view. The rooms are fully equipped with free mini bar and nespresso. Large bathrooms with separate shower, bathtub and TV. Club rooms give access to the lounge at 28th floor and they include breakfast (buffet and a la carte included) and evening drinks and appetizers. Simply outstanding. Strategically located, 10mn walk from harbor city. I have tried many luxury hotels in HK (Mandarin Landmark, Hyatt, JW Mariott, Crown Plaza) and this is by far my preferred Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: CuriousNik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the hotel for 3 nights in February 2012 and loved every minute of it. Check-in was very fast and professional, the service overall was fantastic, buffet breakfast delicious. The room (we had a Club 36 Harbour room at the 25th floor) was very well equipped (comfy bed, nice shower, there's even a printer in the room if you have to print out documents) and the view is absolutely spectacular. And the windows are very clean(don't you hate looking at a fascinating skyline through dirty windows?)...The fitness room is top of the range and spectacularly located. We also liked the Above and Beyond Club Lounge, where we had a glass of champagne while enjoying the light show on Hong Kong island every evening. We hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Highest Recommendation - Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Eva B
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a quick weekend here, great views, great room and superb service. Modern, clean room with lots of nice touches. Lounge and market restaurant for breakfast also top notch. I recommend paying extra for the upgraded room to go to the Happy Hour on the top floor and Above and Beyond. Gym and pool were beautiful. Absolutely a top hotel. Only negative is it might be a touch far from Nathan Road for some, but we enjoyed the walk (10 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: markinsuffolk73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our trip to Australia and are so glad that we picked Hotel Icon. We arrived really early in the morning and were greeted by the hotel's friendly, helpful, efficient staff. Our room was not ready (which we knew) so we were offered access to the hotel's relaxation area where we had the opportunity to rest after our flight and enjoy some complimentary drinks. We were then told @ 10am that our room was ready and were taken to the 18th floor to room 1819. The room was fantastic - really spacious and well-appointed with a great view over Kowloon across to (a misty) HK Island. As this was our first time in Hong Kong we weren't sure exactly where to go or what to see but one of the staff (Hoily Mok) took time to provide us with a map and noted all the main areas to go - really helpful for us! The Hotel's location on Kowloon is probably not the best but the hotel offers a free courtesy bus, besides the walk across to the main areas alllowed us to see parts of the city that we may have missed. We disn't make use of the hotel's dining facilities so can't comment on those, although we did brave the pool on a cold, windy morning - great facilities there along with an excellent gym. We can't recommend Icon highly enough, particularly the excellent staff, and would definately stay here again if we ever return to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilciSelf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just completed a 7 night stay at the Hotel Icon and we loved it. We booked the hotel onthe strength of its reviews in Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. In fact the Icon surpassed our expectations. The service and staff were excellent and the staff were without exception all very friendly and eager to help. We booked a club harbour view room that included breakfast and access to the club "perks" on the 28 th floor. As a club booking you're entitled to a complimentary afternoon tea from 3 to 5 and complimentary drinks or should I say open bar from 6 to 8 pm ... We spent quite a bit of time after 6 pm drinking French champagne :) The buffet breakfast at the "Market" was really exceptional. Our only hesitation in booking this hotel was its location, as it is a little way from the heart of Kowloon , but we found that this was not a problem as it is less than a 10 minute walk to Tsim ShaTsui station and Nathan road. The real bonus is that it is situated next to a series of shopping complexes that are surrounded by open plazas with many restaurants and bars, all without the hustle and bustle of Kowloon Central. Loved the hotel ... Don't pass up the opportunity to stay there, you will not regret it. Ps also found the hotel and rooms to be very quiet ....nice :)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel...ever”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaCM
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 teenagers stay 3 days there at the Club floor. Everything was perfect: design,rooms, beds, pillows menu but the most exceptional is the service. From the beginning, everybody took care of us as we were the only guests (and it was obviously not the case). Since the location is not the best in Kowloon (Kowloon is a beautiful zone in HK) they provided also, a free shuttle bus. Easy to go there by Train from or too the airport in combination with another free shuttle bus to the station, where you can also make the check in and check your luggage to the majority of airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and effortless”
Reviews.Author: jimbo2012
Reviews.Content: Checked in for 2 nights into a club 36 room and it was fantastic. Great service , delicious breakfast, spacious rooms with a great bed an amzing shower !! The above and beyond club lounge in the evening and the amazing views made our stay well worth it. Would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing time in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney1305
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded ALL of our expectations. (Couple in our 40's) We just LOVED the design - it's not often you find a hotel in the middle of a busy city with such generous use of space in the public areas. Our room size was more than adequate and space cleverly used. The attention to detail and design is too expansive to start listing here. It's just.....top! The fab view from The ICON gym could convince even Homer Simpson into jumping onto an exercise bike! In the (heated) pool you feel like the HK skyline is at your fingertips! Staff are very perceptive and the hotel's care for late-departing guests is second to none. That, for us, left a great impression. Recommendation: Friday night dinner in The Market restaurant where the head chef turns a 40 kilo whole tuna into sashimi right before our eyes. Excellent! The whole buffet can be recommended. And we normally aren't particularly 'fans' of buffet dining. Well done Hotel Icon. Keep up the excellent work. Next time we're back in funky HK we'll DEFINITELY be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: HelenAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own recently to unwind after running the Hong Kong Marathon, needed a place where you could just spend the whole day in case the muscles didn't recover soon enough. I read the rave reviews on ICON, saw good rates vs other 5-star properties in HK, and decided to give them a go. I'm very happy I did! + great customer service. Felt really well looked after, check in was really smooth + lounge/bar on the top floor was comfortable and drinks were good :-) + the room, I took the standard one, was already huge for HK standards. Bathroom with walk-in shower was really good! + 'rooftop' pool on the 9th floor - so not completely the roof, but the pool was clean and heated and did give a lovely view of the skyline + free wifi that worked well + breakfast buffet selection was good and of good quality but expensive (I only sat there once) - it's about 10-15 min. walk from central Tsim Sha Tsui, so not the most central hotel. The hotel mentions that Hung Hom MTR station is closest, however this station does not offer the best connections. You're better off making the longer walk to TST MTR for connections with other parts of Kowloon and HK Island. - the gentleman at checkout got pretty worried when I casually asked about travel times to the airport via different options, as I aimed to be there 1,45hrs before my short flight. Luckily I know HK very well so I was very relaxed, but I guess it would've freaked me out if I didn't know better. My advice: stay calm :-) - I always mention this regardless of the hotel, but I do think asking the equivalent of €20+ for breakfast is a big minus. I'll state the reasons again: 1. you pay enough as it is for a room in such a hotel to expect a better priced morning service, 2. it's wasteful - because many people choose to eat at other places instead, a lot of food gets chucked away and I'm sure there aren't too many hotels who donate their unwanted food to the homeless just yet, 3. if it were say up to €12 a day for such a breakfast, I and many people I know would much quicker decide to have breakfast at the hotel, meaning a larger profit for the hotel...right? This is not so much a minus directly aimed at ICON but all hotels that still charge silly prices. Would I stay here again? I'd definitely have it in my permanent list of preferred HK hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: gigitiongson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Icon from Feb 17-21 in the 19th floor facing the harbor. This time we chose to stay away from TST West. Hotel Icon was a fabulous find. The distance to TST West is not a problem if one loves to walk and is familiar with the pedestrian subway to Nathan Road. Otherwise they offer a free shuttle to the TST West. Harbor view is magnificent especially at night. Service and staff are one of the best so far. Breakfast has a good spread with good choices. Bedrooms are modern and clean with comfortable bed and pillows. Bathroom is the best, I love the huge rain shower. Overall, Hotel Icon lives up to its fabulous rating.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: The hotel Icon was our special treat at the end of a month travelling, and it was a great choice. The rooms were comfortable, the staff attentive, the breakfasts - amazing choice. We also ate in the Above and Beyond restaurant which was a bit disappointing for such a great hotel, although the view from here is fab. Our flight home was not until very late and the facilities available to us through the lounge showed that the hotel really does understand the needs of their guests; we were able to shower, change, relax, get a bite to eat in comfortable surroundings, before we left for the airport, nice and refreshed. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Major wow factor”
Reviews.Author: JoeOutAndAbout
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Icon last week and were amazed from the moment we arrived, which is saying a lot for this very well traveled couple..! The building itself is fairly interesting, however there are some unique features in the lobby and common areas. Rooms were really lovely and well appointed. The staff were all very attentive and eager to assist, which is such a breath of fresh air coming from the 'west'. The overall best outstanding feature for me was the swimming pool and gym on the 9th floor. The pool was heated to a lovely temperature and the view of HK island and Kowloon/TST, especially at night was awe inspiring..!! We loved the buffet breakfast which was a real deal at HK$200 with a good selection of western and asian delights. Would def recommend..!

Reviews.Title: “Funky new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zeyar A
Reviews.Content: Great stay with friendly staff. Great location and great amenities. Good breakfast and fab cocktails. Great bargain for HK (rooms on the small size, but just think I was unlucky this time, hopefully a larger room next time :-). ... Definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “New, nice design, everything you need from a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2theworld
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful rooms, and well designed bathrooms. Well sized rooms especially for hong kong standards. Free minibar, printer in room and nespresso just finishes it. Only small comment, if you upgrade to Club room, why not give access to Lounge as well?

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think of staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sugardens
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you everything you need for a comfortable and enjoyable stay in Hong Kong. This is my first visit to the area and I'm so glad I'm staying in an oasis of calm of hospitality. Unlike a lot of modern hotels, the Icon has a sophisticated air-con system that creates a pleasant environment everywhere you go. We're staying on the 25th floor (28th is the top) which glorious views of the harbour and beyond. At night it lights up and offers a light show not to be missed. As you've probably guessed by now, I'm head over heels in love with this place and think it's worth every penny.....stylish, comfortable, exceptionally gracious and helpful staff, great food AND it's got a pool. What else could you possibly want?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Michael O
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in February. this is an amazing place to say with really outsanding service from the moment you get in the limo from the airport. All the staff are very gracious and welcoming and it felt very genuine. The Club Harbour view room is great with fantastic views and the room is very comfortable and well equipped and very quiet. The check-in is very personal and fast. All the staff are very helpful but particular thanks to Edith, Jacky and Angus and all the staff in the Above and Beyond lounge. The cocktails &champagne seem never ending and the canapes are good. Its a great place to stay in HK and we will definitely come back again..

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL ICON”
Reviews.Author: joeykay
Reviews.Content: The Icon Hotel is probably the most sybaritic place to stay in Hong Kong. It is beautifully designed and staffed by professional, enthusiastic. talented young people. Angus Wong, at the concierge desk, was particularly patient and knowledgeable. The Sunday brunch buffet at The Market Place restaurant was superb. We binged on Lobster claws and succulent lamb cutlets. There were an amazing selection of dishes and it was good value too. Our room was luxuriously modern and the bathroom was magnificent.. A truly five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Here they understand what you need when you travel: to feel free”
Reviews.Author: renee1963
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Once you have paid for your room, almost all others things are free and easy: finally a luxury hotel that does not treat you as a milk cow... Minibar, wifi, laundry, breakfast, drinks between 18h-20h: it is all included. The same goes for the smiles of the staff: feeling welcome is a genuine sensation at the trendy Icon's. Would recommend it to everybody,

Reviews.Title: “The best we have ever experienced!!!”
Reviews.Author: SRS65
Reviews.Content: We have just experienced the best hotel stay at Hotel ICON, Tsim Sha Tsui East, Hong Kong. From the superb views in our Club 36 Harbour View room to the most attentive but discreet service from all personnel it has been an amazing holiday. Alvin Yim and his front office team were there every minute of the day when we needed help with directions, baggage, taxis and restaurant bookings. Nick Tam, Jacky Yip and the brilliant Above & Beyond staff certainly lived up to the above and beyond title - nothing was too hard - be it breakfast service, cocktail hours or Club check-out. The club privileges were well worth the money as they included breakfast in either the club lounge or the very groovy Market, free mini-bar and even an option of warm milk and cookies or sleepy time tea before bed. And you could even request a special infused pillow if you so desired! The location was perfect with convenience stores and restaurants nearby and anything else accessible via the free ICON shuttle bus that runs pretty much all day and every 20 minutes to the Harbour City shopping centre and the nearby MTR station. We had one of the best and most innovative Chinese meals on Valentine's Day in the Above & Beyond restaurant on the 28th floor thanks to Joseph Tse and his very capable team. The decor is cutting-edge and modern. In the ample-sized rooms there's even a flat screen TV in the bathroom and the shower offers a choice between standard or rain-shower. The rain shower is amazing! The whole team at ICON should be proud of the standard they have set. We will definitely be back sooner than planned because it was such an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms over looking the hong kong harbour”
Reviews.Author: MattyB77
Reviews.Content: Booked a room last minute before our flight and got upgraded to a suite over looking the harbour.the room was amazing with a big couch comfy chairs and a big overhead shower.view was reali nice of the sunset and all the lights.not to far from the subway either if you want to go over to hong kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: bbchris
Reviews.Content: We booked a night here to celebrate our 20 year wedding anniversary. We both work so a night away in luxury was the only thing we wanted. We checked in easily and got ourselves into the spa - oh that was AWESOME, very relaxing and soothing and highly recommended. Then we ate dinner at Above & Beyond and it was excellent Chinese food there, the view looking towards Hong Kong was spectacular. The room itself, not really small by Hong Kong standards, was supplied with all the usual amenities and a lot more! One could even ask for milk and cookies if sleep wasn't arriving. Lots of channels to choose from on the TV. The bed was super comfortable and BIG - King size. Lots of pillows and you could order more. everything in the mini bar was free of charge too! The pool looked great and the gym was enticing too. We enjoyed a most amazing buffet breakfast in The Market - I've not seen so many choices at a breakfast buffet in a long time. The staff were eager to please and we enjoyed our brief stay very much. Even if you cant stay here, you must try the restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Experience!”
Reviews.Author: EmpressMW
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we have stayed in and we have traveled quite a lot around the world. The price was reasonable for the level of service this hotel offers. The rooms were large and exceptional for style and comfort and the view was so amazing. The bathrooms were amazingly cool like what you'd wish you had at home. The amenities can not be beat. Swimming with the Hong Kong skyline in front of you is something we won't soon forget. The free mini-bar was a bonus though wished they had more savory offerings. The Market restaurant was extensive and great for breakfast/brunch. The staff was so friendly and helpful that we utilized their services everyday. The location was good though just a tad far from the train. Going to the train was no problem but after a day of touring/shopping coming back was a little far. At least there was a lot of shopping and a night food street on the way back which made the walk fun. We brought back great food from that night food market many times to enjoy while watching TV in our room. We would definately stay here again next time we are in Hong Kong. I only hope they don't raise the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at not a bad price”
Reviews.Author: ericform
Reviews.Content: it was a great hotel right in the middle of Kowloon. the rooms were small but the services was great. the person who met us at the front door escorted us to our rooms. Great view from the Club room of Hong Kong's downtown, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Discerning-guy
Reviews.Content: From what I understand the Icon opened not so long ago under the guardianship of the Hong Kong Polytechnic University Tourism /Busiiness faculty as a training base for its students. Consequently, as has been already said, the staff are extremely polite & attentive and can't do enough for you. We had a harbour view room which was great. There is free wi-fi throughout- always a welcome bonus in this day & age. Also, as mentioned, although there is no alcohol in the minibar in the rooms- the water, soft drinks & sweets they contain are all complimentary and are replenished daily - again another nice touch that adds to the overall experience. We would definitely recommend it. We stayed on a 'room only' basis and discovered a little Italian restaurant nearby (Rocco's Pizzeria on Mody Street) that served excellent cooked breakfasts & coffee at a very reasonable price - also good for an evening meal if you fancy Italian.We had a wonderful first stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A real VIP-treatment”
Reviews.Author: JimVL
Reviews.Content: We arrived at an impossible hour but from the first to the last minute we were taken care of. Nothing we asked was to much. We had asked for and got a room on one of the top floors with a magnificent view. The room wa ssuper spacious with all the luxury you can dream. For breakfast we had the choice between the lounge with a view are a super-buffet at the lower floor restaurant. But even what they called the limited buffet was absolutely super. That and free drinks, afternoon tea etc.. and all that for a price lower than we paid in some B&B in NZ. Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeTourist
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I have ever written a review before I have left the Hotel that I have been staying in, but this Hotel is truly fantastic! Believe all the positive reviews that have been written. We are in a harbour view room with everything you could possibly wish for and yes the espresso machine and complimentary mini bar is very welcome after a days sightseeing. The above and beyond package is definitely worth having and the staff in the lounge are great. The pool is a balmy 28c and well worth venturing into. The weather has been grey and overcast but the jewel in the crown of this hotel is the sunny, obliging staff that have made are stay here the memorable one that it has been. So it just remains to say a big thank you to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed new hotel - not super family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide65
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in 2 rooms. 5 of us ( 2 adults and 3 children aged 12, 11 and 7) in a club suite 65 and Club icon 30 harbour view. A very comfortable rollaway was placed in the living room of the suite. The 2 rooms were adjoining but no interconnecting door - this was fine for our family but may not work for a family with younger children. We loved the rooms - very new and sleek with lots of groovy features - electronic lighting, login screen of tv welcomed you by name, free soft drinks/water/ M and Ms in mini bar, mirror tv in bathroom, amenities bag (you could take home) in bathroom, great rain shower, nespresso coffee machine, to name a few. The best thing was the amazing view - we were jet lagged after a 15 hr flight and loved lounging around enjoying the view. The pool (with gym behind) was quite incredible with the same amazing view. I did feel self conscious accompanying my children to the pool area as it had a very peaceful adult ambience and I did not want my kids to spoil this serenity for other guests. Club facilities were good with lovely breakfast. Afternoon tea and evening drinks okay - we were the only ones with children so didn't stay too long. Staff in the hotel very young and friendly - at times service was a bit slow - particularly at check in - we just wanted to get to our rooms but they drew out he process by sitting us down, offering us drinks etc and the whole process took 15 mins. There was also a delay getting bags to the room. Room service was average and we had trouble getting some wine to have in our room. Location is a little out of the way - fortunately taxis very cheap. We would return but do feel experience will be enriched with older children (or no children!)

Reviews.Title: “Unfaultable”
Reviews.Author: travelwombat71
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel. Well but not perfectly placed being 10 min walk from Nathan rd, ferry etc. (they have a shuttle). Everything else was stylish and perfect, attentive service, beautiful rooms and views. Free wifi, free minibar and in room nespresso. get the club package for complimentary afternoon tea, evening cocktails and late checkout. Can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Luxury Hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: scirocco4404
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed by the staff, the cuisine, the decor and the ambiance that they have cultivated at the Icon. There was a fresh feeling and the attitude was not 'corporate'. I think it surpasses the nearby Shangri-la and the Intercon at much more reasonable prices. The breakfast buffet was very good and the dinner Buffet was exceptional !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and outstanding facilities”
Reviews.Author: Balmaniacs
Reviews.Content: We knew we would be arriving late at night so organised, through the hotel, a limousine from the airport. From the moment we arrived things were slick and convenient. The limo driver obviously contacted the hotel on aproach as when we arrived a porter and member of reception staff were on the front steps to welcome us, by name. Check-in was completed in our room and was very quick. The room was very modern and chic with agreat ultra modern bathroom. The hotel's location was very good and its shuttle bus very convenient. We stayed for 2 nights in a Club 36 King Room, which came with added benefits such as an executive reception, complimentary full breakfast, afternoon tea and evening canapes and cocktails, all of which we happily made use of. We found the staff very eager to provide quality service. This will definitely be our HK hotel of choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, view and welcome at this cutting edge hotel”
Reviews.Author: mappyuk
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe the value of this hotel in comparison to other comparable hotels such as Sheraton/Hyatt and thought there must be a catch. In a way there is, this is a training hotel so some staff are a little 'wet behind the ears' but as soon as you realise this it is really fine and actually, most staff are fresh faced, professional and eager to help. Checking in did feel like we had the third degree though 'Where did you come from?' 'Where are you going to' Little bit OTT. The room is bigger than the average Hong Kong hotel room and if you pay has the most amazing view of the skyscrapers at Hong Kong Island. Beds and pillows are a little hard though but they will bring alternatives (pillows that is!). The pool is incredible on the 9th floor, you swim in an infinity pool level with the skyscraper view, astounding! We didn't try the restaurants but had cocktails and coffees at the lounge bar which was fine. Sadly the bar at the top was off limits unless you were in an executive room which was a bit mean. Finally a word for the concierge staff who you think, because of their age, are not going to be great, they are in fact fantastic. Also the door staff who race to the doors to open them before you get near. Its nice and informal and it felt like coming home when we got back to the hotel after the bustle of Hong Kong. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel overall with very attentive staff but the pushy bar staff in 'Above and Beyond' (the top floor bar) make it not ”
Reviews.Author: EveM1
Reviews.Content: Overall an excellent hotel in a great location, with great facilities and staff that cannot do enough to help. As we arrived early in the morning from our long distance flight they gave us access to the relaxation lounge and allowed us to use the gym and pool which was great. The room was also lovely with a great view over the harbour. The only downer on our stay was when we went for a drink in the top floor bar on the last night. We got two drinks from the bar and were shown to a table with no view (not much point being on the 28th floor when you can't see a thing!) When we moved to an empty table with a perfect view we told in no uncertain terms by the bar woman that as that was a 'restaurant table' we weren't allowed to sit there, even though the restaurant runs straight into the bar, was pretty much empty at 22.30 and the v nice waiter had already said it was fine to sit there. We simply left and went back to our room as the view from there was much better than the tiny 'bar area'! So avoid the bar, but otherwise good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Bahram
Reviews.Content: This is in part anyway a training hotel, so there are some rough edges among the staff who are nevertheless very keen to please. And the public areas are a little sparse. But apart from that I cannot fault it. It is very much cheaper than equivalent hotels in equaivalent areas, and there are nice touches like free wifi and soft drinks in the room. And it is a nice enough room. Excelently ,located too, in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
