Reviews.Author: leithalokc
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and for the price it is a deal that can not be beat in Hong Kong. The service in the "Above and Beyond Lounge" was excellent. We tried al the food options at the hotel and this is where they fall a little short in our minds. We chose in room dining the night of the Chinese New Year fireworks show because we had a great view of the harbour from our room. The food was below average in our opinion. We ate at the chinese restaurant on the 28th floor and this was by far our best meal at the hotel. On the 2nd floor is the "Market Buffet", it was okay if you only eat at it a couple of times but after day 2 there was not alot of changes made to the offerings. The hotel failed to inform us that we would need to make reservations in advance due to the new year for any of the dining options at the hotel. We were told a couple of times that if we wanted to eat at the buffet we would have to eat outside. That was annoying being guest of the hotel, staying in the nicest room and no warning had been given prior to arrival. We found our selves seeking out other options for half the breakfasts and most dinners. The airport pick up and delivery system was wonderful and it was all arranged by the hotel for us. The minibar was stocked with water, soda and beer and was refilled daily....free. We would probably stay at a 5 star if we return to Hong Kong but for the money we spent it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service great in all aspects..”
Reviews.Author: khalijiyah
Reviews.Content: We took a long time deciding which hotel to stay in but in the end we've decided to stay at the Icon due to it's high rating at Trip advisor and it is one of the newest hotels in the area. First of all the Hotel's location isn't as central as the others but everything is in a walking distance even the hotel provides a shuttle to the Harbor city mall every 20 min.. We've stayed at the club suit 80 which was spacious and lovely with a magnificent harbour view. With the club suite many services are offered free such as Afternoon tea at the lounge, daily free refill of the mini bar, and a 100HKD of daily laundry service that can come in handy. Breakfast was served at two places one was at the club floor and the other was at the Market restaurant and it was definitely top notch. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone the staff were really friendly and tried to help us feel comfortable and welcomed all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, comfortable, stylish”
Reviews.Author: tk2x
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super chic, like a W but even a bit more stylish, with maybe a bit less candles and scents. The room (38 / Harbor view) offered exquisite views of Hong Kong island. The location was good but not great, in east TST, with Hong Ham MTR (train station) a 7-10 minute walk. There are restaurants and shopping, but for the really good stuff you have to take the (free) hotel shuttle to west TST or MTR to the island. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful in all circumstances. Really could not have asked for a better customer service experience. The buffet breakfast on the 2nd floor is excellent quality with a wonderful spread. To get here from the airport, take the Airport Express train which now runs every 10 minutes, and then the free K3 shuttle which runs every 12 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A truly iconic hotel...stylish, elegant and well located...”
Reviews.Author: aw101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Icon Room # 2305 which is a Club 36 Harbor Room for 6 nights in December-January 2012. Location: Location was ideal. There is a free shuttle bus that takes guests to Harbor City, Middle Road and back to the hotel. You can get off at Harbor City for the Star Ferry or Middle Road for the MTR. The shuttle bus leaves every 20 minutes and is always on time. Right across the road from Hotel Icon is a small shopping area with a 7/11 and lots of local eateries and western style restaurants, 2 pharmacies and money exchangers. Nathan Road is about 10 minutes walk. Service: The service at Hotel Icon was amazing and extremely professional and everyone spoke perfect English. There is an Above and Beyond check in counter for guests staying in club rooms. Nothing was too much for the staff, they helped us make bookings for restaurants and showed us how to get to certain places and were always very friendly and helpful. There was also always a staff member available to ask for directions or simply to open the door for you. We have stayed in several 5 star hotels around the world and found the quality of service at Hotel Icon to be outstanding. Rooms: Our room was very spacious with a beautiful view of Victoria Harbor. The finishes in the room are all high quality with many clever design details such as a hidden multimedia panel which has universal chargers and USB ports. The bathroom is also spacious and well designed, with a curved sliding door to maximize space, a light up circular mirror and a bathtub with an LED screen TV. The shower however may be a bit small for some people. Food: Our package came with free continental breakfast daily at the Market Restaurant. There was a huge variety of food on offer with the usual selections plus a few surprises such as a chef to make rice flour rolls on demand and a huge range of fresh juices and fruit. Guests staying in a club room can also have breakfast in the Above and Beyond instead of at Market restaurant but the options are very limited. Comments: I cannot recommend this hotel enough. It is clear that a lot of though has been given into every design detail and the entire hotel just radiates understated class and elegance, including inside the lifts. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the location is ideal to explore what HK has to offer. The only other hotel in HK along the same wavelength is the W but that hotel does not have a view of Victoria harbor. Hotel Icon is truly a haven from the bustling chaos that is the streets of Hong Kong. Cons: The finger food at the Above and Beyond Lounge during happy hour was rather limited and the cocktail menu could be improved with the addition of a signature cocktail. Best bits: The view from the room and the quality drinks at the equally impressive Above and Beyond Lounge and the top notch service.

Reviews.Title: “First rate”
Reviews.Author: FMC_12
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the service was excellant. Warm and friendly staff, good food and a free mini bar in our room. Also if you stay in a club suite there are wonderful views from the bedroom. Overall it has made our holiday really special.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: davelocity
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the xmas break and was pleasantly surprised. I had a room with a harbour view, and while my view was at a sharp angle, I still had a great view of the skyline. Breakfast was good with lots of options. Love the free mini-bar, which is a nice refreshing touch that makes you feel like the hotel isn't nickel-and-diming you for everything. The only gripe I have is with the bathroom, which was this strange curved, sliding wooden door - no division between toilet shower and bathroom. That was kind of odd, but everything else was awesome. Service was great, and they got a lot of "little touches" right. You'll see what I mean when you stay here. definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from the pool! Ultra modern hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Kristl_Jean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in June. The hotel was in its opening phase, so was able to get a great rate. This hotel is a teaching hotel, so there is no shortage of staff. It is located in a great area very close to the harbour and the walk of fame. The pool is amazing, with views of the harbor light show at night. The rooms are so interesting, and larger than expected. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: amexGosier
Reviews.Content: the room booked was a club suite 65 located on the 17th floor. View to the harbor was partial; access to the club lounge with free cocktails in the evening, free mini bar, large room with seating area, nice amenities, free breakfasts, shuttle from the Kowloon station is K3. perfect hotel for that but the location is a little bit away from the the MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: HeiMie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Icon for 3 nights during Chinese New Year. We booked a harbour view room to be able to see the fireworks from our room - and what a view it was! We stayed on the 16th floor and could have just been sitting at the window to admire the view for hours. Everything else was excellent as well - service, amenities, the amazing bed, design. For a five star hotel we liked especially that this one was not "overdone", but rather a design-hotel with a five star touch. We did not have the "club" room with free breakfast, drinks etc, but it would not have been worth paying for for us as we liked to sleep late and explore the city after that - not just stay in the hotel. Someone wrote the hotel being too far from the MTR - we did not think so at all. 5 min. walk is not too much and if not willing to walk, taxis cost 20HKD for the first two km, or there is also a free shuttle bus to the ferry pier. In our opinion everything was just around the corner. Would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: Fasted09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and I am glad we choose this hotel. The staff can't do enough for you. They are always keen to help. I suggest that you take the club room with harbor view. It is worth the extra money. Breakfast is included in the package and you get to use the club floor facilities that includes afternoon tea and cocktails from 6 to 8 pm. Enjoy the light show at 8 pm whilst you are enjoying your free drinks and snacks on the 28th floor. The hotel even provide free shuttle service to the Harbor plaza every 20 mins. Overall I rate this hotel 9 out of 10. One small advice is try not to go to the restaurant opposite the hotel call 'Tai Hing'. Food quality is poor and if you enjoy great food, avoid this place at all cost. A big thank you and congratulations to all the staff and management on a well run hotel and making my wife and I feel so welcome. We wil be back to your hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Well designed Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Karolyn C
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well laid out, an excellent design, fantastic bathrooms. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Concierge in particular was excellent. Pool and gym are great. View from rooms is really good, we enjoyed the evening light show. We used the "timeless" room after we had checked out, before our evening flight, to relax, have a drink etc - a great idea. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in, regarding service and design, anywhere in the world. We had adjoining rooms, as traveling with children, worked well. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Eurogolferoxford
Reviews.Content: I agree entirely with the views of Jacob3388 and patsb. The Hotel is wonderful and everyone works very hard to give good service. We were flying out at 9.00 in the evening but could use a room put aside for late leavers, with free coffee etc. as it was next to the gym and pool you could even use those if you so wished. I would happily recommend the ICON to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Like another world”
Reviews.Author: Jacob3388
Reviews.Content: After hours of research for Hong Kong hotels i found the newly opened "hotel icon" in my opinion its the most modern hotel in Hong Kong, The service is amazing, every single worker there is friendly and provide the best comforting service, the rooms were 100% Clean, 100% New and they are professionally designs by a famous designer, the BIG glass window has the most breathtaking views of the whole city.... The pool is a relaxing swim overlooking the neon lights of the whole city at city view height... I would go back to this hotel any day over any hotel in Hong Kong, its such a magical experience the whole city and this hotel adds to it, I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Kowloon!”
Reviews.Author: adventuringone
Reviews.Content: Having no means of comparison as this is our first visit to Hong Kong, but having heard of how small the hotel rooms are in HK, we were pleased with our harbor front room. The hotel is only 9 months old and the rooms are modern, clean and well designed. There is no door on the open bathroom so if a lot of privacy is required, you may find this a deterrent. It wasn't an issue for us. The staff are friendly, helpful and attentive and we are looking forward to seeing the New Year's fireworks tonight from the Club Lounge. Great location as we love to walk. Quite close to the harbor, Star ferry and harbor Shopping Centre. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others. Club room recommended as it includes Wifi, breakfast, afternoon tea and appetizers in evening. A great start to our SE Asia adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: cfibanez
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6-day business trip during which I stayed at the Hotel ICON in Hong Kong. This is probably the best hotel in Hong Kong. Excellent service, perfect location. Spacious, impecable rooms, super fresh, super comfortable. Great food at the 28th floor restaurant with amazing views of Victoria Harbor. Spectacular in all senses. I can't see myself staying at another hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiremanpete
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Icon 11th to 13th Jan 2012 Booked an executive room on the 26th floor with all the facilities attached to that area, ie free afternoon tea and canopies and free drinks in the evening 6-8pm.Even allowed to take the room at 9.00am on a morning arrival after an overnight flight which was a bonus and late checkout on day of leaving and able to use the executive area with all facilities right up to leaving on a night flight which was excellent and being able to use the changing rooms and showers in the gym to get ready. Lovely quiet hotel with no noice in corridors or adjoining rooms which is great when you sleep light. Rooms air conditioned with precise controls Fantastic views across the water to the other side of Hongkong and straight onto the 8pm night show with birds eye view of the lasers and lights. Hotel was spotless and immaculately decorated with bang up to date lifts, and furniture and staff very friendly and helpful in every area. The Hotel has only been in full occupation since April 2011 so everything is pristine. Unique reception area spacious clean and well organised. Buffet breakfast in the 4th floor area was superb with everything imaginable on the breakfast menu to cover every nationality with chefs on hand to cook the usual breakfast stuff fresh as well as breads, cheeses, fruit, yoghurts etc. Room in executive area was very spacious, clean and everything you could want in the bathroom inc tv on bath wall and free minibar. Gym and area was large with every imaginable piece of sports equipment and pool was nice size with beautifully cleaned changing rooms with saunas etc that were barely used by residents. Easy access to the main shopping areas to the south of Hongkong either by free shuttle bus or a quarter of an hour walk to the main areas of Nathan Road and Star ferry area shopping district. Plenty of outside eating places scattered around the blocks surrounding this hotel so you can easily access them in a matter of a couple of minutes. We are fussy travellers having travelled throughout Asia but this hotel ticked every box from its standards, food, rooms and facilities and staff and we would definetely use again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammyslashes
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Icon, having researched just about every hotel in HK prior to booking a few months ago thanks to Trip Advisor. I am 100% glad I am staying at the Icon!! It smells delicious every time you enter the lobby, the staff are wonderful, the service is fantastic, the rooms are spacious for HK & very modern. I am staying in the Icon 36 Harbour View room. What an amazing view! It is Chinese New Year at the moment & I am looking forward to watching the fireworks from the comfort of my room & at the rooftop pool BBQ. Some slightly negative points: It is not that close to the MTR, however it really is only a 5-10 minute walk & completely safe to do so late at night on your own (I am a solo female traveller & don't feel nervous in HK at all). Its also only HKD$20 in a taxi from the MTR so its not that big a problem. Also the hotel offers a free shuttle to Harbour City every 20 mins which is fab! There is not a lot of attractions (i.e shopping) directly around the hotel so take advantage of the shuttle. The only other negative is don't order toast for room service as it will arrive cold & hard! Not a major complaint really! All the positives: Rooms are modern, clean, good sized. I recommend the Harbour View rooms. Free wi-fi & mini bar (although the mini bar is only free soft drink, water & small sized m & m's so don't get too excited by that). The Market is lovely for breakfast & good value for money. The Angsana spa treatments are reasonably priced for a hotel spa & I will be trying a massage this week. For e.g a 1 hr facial & 1 hr body massage is HKD$1300. not too bad for a 2 hr treatment! The rooftop pool is very nice. Overall I highly recommend this hotel if staying on this side of HK. Compared to the other hotels nearby, this is by far the most modern, and seems more boutique than a big major hotel like the Shangri-La. If I come back to HK I will definitely stay at Hotel ICON over any other hotel & I have already recommended to friends coming to HK. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller604
Reviews.Content: Amazing service staff from beginning to end! I've never been to a hotel with such detailed attention to its guests. The hotel was so sleek and modern and the rooms so beautiful. They have paid close attention to all details and everything is perfectly tied into each other. From the beautiful bathroom faucets to the modern bed side lamps. Such a cool shower design as well! And where can you go wheres theres free wifi and a complimentary mini bar??! Wow! So very modern, yet cozy at the same time. Love! Love! Love! Would highly recommend this place to anybody. Great bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “excellent view on top floor”
Reviews.Author: screenHK
Reviews.Content: delicious Chinese Food with great view & service. To start, warm cashell nut and sweetened roasted walnut was served. A wide range of white & red wine with great value. All dishes were awfully delicious. We went there for dinner & then went again for lunch. Both time gave us good memory. We'll go back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: irwish__jc
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at just about every decent Kowloon Hotel over the years, I have watched rates go up and down as tourism does the same. Now with Mainland People taking up most of the mid-priced hotels, the better ones have no problem asking for room high rates. Very nice rooms, free mini bar is really soda and M&M's, maybe different on the Club Floor. Location is convient to most things except MTR which is a long walk, or you take their shuttle. The Lobby is very nice and the Excersize Area is excellent with a very attentive staff. Main Floor Staff were friendly and very helpful but not up to the level of the hotel's star rating but this is still a new hotel. Breakfast Staff in the Second Floor Coffee Shop are at best fair. One important note, if you are taking a cab to the hotel, be sure to have a hotel card with the location in Chinese. Since it is new many cab drivers do not know where the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TheAdventuresofMags
Reviews.Content: My family and I have never been to Hong Kong before but the staff at the Icon helped us tremendously. They told us places we shouldn't miss seeing, how to go there and how much time to plan for. We felt a bit rushed at breakfast as we were reminded two separate times that it ended soon. However everything us has been great! Make sure to check out the free Mini bar!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: Rob2037
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel ICON in January 2012 for four days on a business trip. The hotel is owned by the nearby university and is staffed by students and alumni. The result is a terrific level of enthusiasm from all staff members and a willingness "to go the extra mile" to ensure that guests are happy. The rooms include good quality WiFi and the ability to use the flat panel TV as a display device for your devices. The food is good and reasonably priced ($HK100 for main courses in "Market" and "Green"). The TV in the bath in my room was the first of this type that I had seen! The nearest MTR station is 5 minutes walk away (but need a couple of changes to get to Central). Tsim Sha Tsui station is about 15 minutes walk - which was fine in winter!. The hotel has complimentary shuttle buses to both this station and the ferry to Central. The "Timeless" lounge provides a place where you can relax after check-out. It is close to showers and change rooms. This feature means that it is easy to do the last meeting of the day, come back to a hotel from which you have checked out and still shower and change ready for the flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyPat2065
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel. We booked four nights in a Club 36 room. The room was new and lovely and the Club facilities are worth the upgrade from a standard room. The Club room included a full breakfast plus afternoon tea and cocktails and hors d’oeuvres from 6-8 pm in the very attractive Above and Beyond area on the top floor with a view across the harbour.The Club deal includes a free minbar in the room and HK$100 daily credit for dry cleaning/laundry. We never made afternoon tea but the breakfast and cocktails/hors d'oeuvres were terrific. The staff were outstanding and more than helpful with every request. The location is also very good - a short walk to Tsim Sha Tsu MTR station, the Star Ferry and all the sights of Kowloon. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Number one in hong kong.”
Reviews.Author: Idofei
Reviews.Content: Its my 5th stay in icon hotel. In one word, its amazing. First of all it has the advantage of being brand new. Second, the design is brilliant, the rooms club 36 and also the suite 65 are well shaped and comfartable. Therd, they give you all kind of sweet things to use like free minibar, free nesepresso in the room, a bag with the amenities you can want. Really great staff. Last but not least, the service is great. They care, but they not pushy or waste your time. So, I loved it, I will be back again and again , as long as all the things I wrote up will keep same.

Reviews.Title: “high level at every level”
Reviews.Author: annoukhasselt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Icon in January 2012. It was excellent in every single way. The design of the hotel is absolutely stunning. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and they are so well equipped: DVD player, printer, all kind of different plugs for computers, beautiful bathroom, very comfy beds, perfect roomservice, Bose ipod docking station, ..... Anything that makes you feel like home! The Above and Beyond club is also very charming. I'm sure my next stay in Hong Kong will be at the Icon again !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: sasandtim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel ICON for 5 nights in November and we absolutely loved it. The rooms are plush, comfortable, modern and beautifully appointed - the bathtub was do deep and luxurious, I didn't ever want to get out! The young staff (who are recent graduates of the Hong Kong Polytechnic hospitality program) are earnest, pleasant and eager to help. Location wise, it's a bit out of the way but the free shuttle bus and proximity to the MTR made it a great base for exploring Hong Kong. We hope to stay at Hotel ICON again and again!

Reviews.Title: “All Looks, No Substance...”
Reviews.Author: GXS
Reviews.Content: First, let me tell you this hotel is stunning. New, modern, absolutely beautiful. From the large, open and modern atrium/lobby to the vertical garden to the sweeping staircase. All beautiful… And that's where it ends. I checked in at 12:30am and there was only 1 person at the front desk helping guests. There were 2 other parties in front of me so it took about 20 minutes before I was helped. I booked a more expensive Icon 38 Harbour View room and even though the room was stunning it did not have a nice view of the harbour we all know (if you put your face against the window you can barely see the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, nothing to the right of the Convention and Exhibition Centre). The problem is that the Icon 38 Harbour View rooms are on the side of the building between the regular rooms and the harbour view rooms. The regular harbour view rooms should have a full/direct view of the nice part of the harbor (Bank of China building, IFC). It was too late and I was too tired to complain so I left it as is. As I mentioned my room was beautiful. The Icon 38 Harbour View rooms have a nicer setup than the Icon 36 rooms. The bed directly faces floor to ceiling glass windows which looks out at the harbour. Behind the bed is an open and very spacious bathroom. The bathroom contains a soaking tub as well as a very large rain shower. The next morning I had a buffet at the Market (a restaurant in the hotel) which was extensive and very nice although a little pricey for what you get (almost Las Vegas pricey but with a lot less food/variety). The restaurant looks great however. After breakfast I wanted to buy a specific SIM card so I asked the concierge about the nearest location of the SIM card operator. He told me to just go to a 711 and buy a SIM card there. I asked him again and he refused to point me to the location instead directing me to a 711 store which he said was just outside and to the right of the hotel. Of course the 711 was not really right outside of the hotel and when I finally found the 711 they had a more expensive SIM card. Check out at noon was a complete opposite of check in, very quick and smooth. The hotel rates have also skyrocketed since I stayed at the Icon and as a result are not a bargain anymore. Stayed at the Icon mid November for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs way up!”
Reviews.Author: AviatorYW
Reviews.Content: Check-in A spacious lobby with 70-foot ceiling, a unique wall garden, and a winding staircase to the floor above greet the arriving guest. The check-in process is quick. You have to get used to signing electronically. Room The room size is reasonable and is comparable to similar high-end hotels in that area. It has all the expected amenities and then some – free wireless Internet and mini-bar. The mini-bar is modest: mineral water, soft drinks, and assorted snacks. The room design is thoughtful, from a desk flip-up panel that has all the plugs, a cordless phone that can be used throughout the hotel property, to a toilet seat that won’t slam, HDTV with beautiful pictures, and light switches that make sense. Dining I have tried two restaurants in this hotel: the 28th floor “Above and Beyond” and 2nd floor “Market”. The view from “Above and Beyond” is fantastic. If you happen to have dinner around 8 p.m., you will have a front row seat to the laser light show. Food is exquisite, and service is superlative for both. Exercise The hotel has a well-equipped gym and pool overlooking the Victoria Harbor. The view is absolutely stunning. Bring your exercise or swimming gear! Otherwise, just bring your favorite drink, sit by the pool, and enjoy the view! Neighborhood The hotel is about 10 minutes from the nearest MTR station and about 20-25 minutes from the Star Ferry. The hotel has a shuttle service to the Star Ferry every 20 minutes. It is next to the busy and vibrant Tsim Sha Tsu area, with lots of restaurants, small parks, and shops nearby. Nathan Road, one of the most exciting roads in Hong Kong, is about 10 minutes away. This hotel has my thumbs up, way up, in every aspect. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel with shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: U2NyR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Icon for 5 nights during the Toy Fair. Wifi is free, as are local calls and the minibar, very convenient. the view from the room is good, and the view from the Gym while you're on the treadmill is spectacular. The hotel is brand new and as such the rooms and facilities are nice, but it was designed very poorly. When you leave the room, all electricity in your room is shut off automatically. So the hotel is in effect telling you you're not allowed to charge any device if you don't sit there and watch it charge. VERY big problem for me. The rooms have no wired internet access, only wifi. So i could not use my older laptop to do work. The shower is not enclosed, so when you're taking a shower its very cold in there and you just want to get out of the shower as soon as you can. Every time you want to watch TV, you have to turn it on and negotiate through a 5-minute series of menus just to get to the television.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: tomnativenewyorker
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel, it is stylish and simple. I believe the hotel employees are students of a university hotel management course where part of their studies is actual hands on performing the day to day routine operations. We stayed in a Club level room and we were escorted to the check in on the upper floor and everything was quite efficient. The club floor restaurant was a disappointment for morning breakfast. Not many options for food variety. My girlfriend wanted dim sum which was not available. However, they did bring from another area of the hotel but it was a twenty minute wait. Come to find out that they have a much better place to eat near the ground floor call the Marketplace. Was not informed upon check in but we made it our every morning spot for breakfast the remaining six nights. The rooms a nice and include free mini bar/snacks which is an plus. Bathroom is nice, but the poor shower design means water on the floor. The need to think of a better idea. One day, we went out for the day and inadvertently left the do not disturb displayed. Upon arrival in the evening, the hotel sent two persons to clean the room for us when we return. Thumbs up! We had a nice view of the harbor from our room. Make sure to check out the harbor light show every evening at 2000/8PM. I understand that the show is coordinated with a musical selection on local radio stations, but the room had no clock radio to tune in to. Location is nice, it is about a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest train stations. It is a bit easy to get turned around and end up in a different direction than originally intended so get a local map and pay close attention to it. Pros: Nice rooms, hotel is immaculate, good location, Marketplace restaurant has awesome breakfast buffet. Cons: Show design water leaks, no radio in room, not informative enough about hotel features/amenities on check in, exorbitant prices for launtdr service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with stunning views and great access to Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Icon was rated #1 on TripAdvisor a few weeks back when I booked my trip. It is no wonder it was in that position. The hotel is sleek, modern, and with great design. If you stay here you must stay in one of the Club Level rooms with a Harbourside View. The views are outstanding and you have access to numerous advantages : breakfast included, access to Club level with drinks and such. To be honest, when we first entered the room my wife and I were underwhelmed. Modern and contemporary designs sometimes lack the feeling of "comfort", but it didn't take us long for the very clever design to win us over and provide great comfort as well. The bed faces the large window with the view of the harbour. Bathroom design is very clever with a tub and shower all in one enclosure, yet at the same time separate. All the amenities are there, including a FREE mini bar. The pool on the 5th floor is an infinity pool with unsurpassed views of the city and harbour. The gym also has the same and is very modern and with good equipment. Now on to the best feature of this hotel....the breakfast buffet at The Market. I have travelled the world and stayed at some very nice places, but NOWHERE have I seen a buffet like this. The title "The Market" sums it up. You have access to everything at this expansive buffet that has freshly prepared foods from various cuisines and all displayed beautifully. I can't say enough about this place. The hotel is next door to the Hotel Management School and the Hotel Icon is a government project using the hotel to teach management and service. All the employees come from this "project" providing a staff that speaks very good english and amazing service. I like to try different hotels when going back to the same locale, but I have to say that the next time I visit Hong Kong, I WILL be returning to the Icon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Luxury all over”
Reviews.Author: ralph1971
Reviews.Content: This is the most luxury hotel I ever been. Everything is done to make it comfortable. We booked a harbour view club room with access to the club-level which is great and worth the price. Cocktails are great and they even warn you when the free-cocktail time is almost over, so you can order one last drink. Prices are reasonoble comparing to other 5 star hotels in Hong Kong. Breakfast is superb with splendid views over the Hong Kong skyline. Staff is with no exceptions great! One small thing of critic: why did they put the bar in the club lounge at the window-side so a good part of the excellent view is gone? Location is not top-level, but MTR at 5-10 min. walking distance, harbour promenade is about 20 minutes walk as is Nathan Road, but as taxis are cheap in Hong Kong this is no big deal. Absolutely recommendable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool without the attitude”
Reviews.Author: BaconTrips
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Clean, contemporary decor, lovely colour scheme and 'live green' wall at reception. - Our standard ICON 36 room was so spacious we could've swung a teenaged lion around in it. - Bathroom had a 3/4 size tub and a separate shower area (though there's a big BUT about this - more below). - More-than-decent toiletries: a padded pouch in the bathroom included sturdy toothbrushes with whitening toothpaste etc. - The firmish king-size bed was comfy. More importantly, it wasn't a queen masquerading as a king. - The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. Cons: - Large rainforest showerhead + glass panel in shower that only extends two-thirds of the way across the shower entrance = very wet bathroom floor after every shower. - Not a fan of the Leonard Paris shampoo and shower gel provided. Actually, they might even be the same product put into different tubes, given their similar bluish hue and watery consistency. - The hotel is a bit of a walk from central TST and about 15/20 mins walk/stroll from the Star Ferry terminal. Still, if the weather is cool, it's a very pleasant walk and you can choose to go through either TST's streets or along the waterfront. - As one reviewer mentioned, security isn't great - no key card is required to access the room floors and there's only one 'bouncer' watching people going in and out of the lifts. Etc: - Have stayed at more than a few hip hotels and Hotel ICON is one of the rare ones with service as warm as the decor is cool. Corny but true! Incidentally, the hotel design and style of the staff uniforms is somewhat reminiscient of the W in Hong Kong, which I don't think delivers as much value in terms of service, location (unless you want to be close to the Airport Express), room extras. Would pick this over the W anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Supradim
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. I really love the design of my room (with harbor view). Breakfast very good and various, but a little expansive. I can recommend this hotel. The only minus is a location, it is a 5-10 minuets walk to the main attractions of Tsim Sha Tsui. But this fact not upset me so much because the taxi is extremely cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: watercolourpainter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was impressive from the start. Reception friendly and efficient. The rooms were amazing with huge beds, beautifully designed, lovely shower. It was a pity we were only staying for a stop over on our way to Australia. Very convenient location. Good spa and swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel ICON Hong Kong so much”
Reviews.Author: Wernero
Reviews.Content: After a two weeks' vacation on the Philippines, my wife and I stayed 3 nights in Hong Kong (22 - 25 December 2011). Fortunately we booked the new Hotel ICON in Kowloon. We were very happy about this choice. It is a new modern hotel on Kowloon side offering everything for a memorable stay. Convenient location, beautiful Lobby, first-class and well equipped rooms with any kind of amenities you could think of (including free Minibar and Nespresso Coffee). And, above all, a highly motivated staff with cultivated friendliness (which is not self-evident in HKG). We had a Club36 Harbour Room and enjoyed the advantages we got from the special Lounge on the top floor. As our plane back home left at midnight, we could use after check-out the hotel's Health Club and Pool area to relax and refresh ourselves before we left. Should we come back to Hong Kong, we don't even have to think about in which hotel we will go. It will definitely be the Hotel ICON! Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “So helpful and it felt genuine”
Reviews.Author: Nickybitty
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Icon and overall the place was great. The room clean, modern and functional. So many modern hotels can bestyle over substance but in this case the room worked very well. The bar on the 28th floor was great but the only problem was it stopped serving at 11.00pm. If you wanted a drink later you either had to go to the ground floor bar if it was open or order room service. That was our only quibble on what was a interesting and fun filled trip. I would stay at the Hotel Icon again as the views/service were great and as far as the location goes, yes slightly off the main areas but taxis were soooo cheap this really did not matter. Good value for the money as Hong Kong rooms go. Travel tip: None of the taxi drivers spoke English but we had the business card from the duty manager from the hotel and you just showed them this and no problem. Must do: Happy Valley racecourse on a Wednesday night in the general enclosure it is truly nuts...in a good way, then take the trolley bus home!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon ? set to be the new icon for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: junde01
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room on the 22nd floor with a view of the harbour and Christmas lights. We particularly enjoyed the 28th floor restaurant Above and Beyond which provided excellent food and service (and vintage champagne!). The pool level included an infinity edge pool and guest lounge with Eames chairs. The staff were young and dressed in edgy uniforms complementing the modern decor; they were quite helpful and friendly. We found the nearby Hung Hom MTR handy given the location was a reasonable walk from Nathan Rd/Harbour City. Overall a recently opened hotel which did not fail to impress.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed”
Reviews.Author: Norlitus
Reviews.Content: I am very happy for finding this hotel. I chose it because of the great reviews it had even it was open only a few months. Everything from check in to checking out was perfect. The was looked after at least twice a day. I was very grateful for the additional service the staff was able to provide even on the last minute notice. The hotel design and interior was out of this world the most amazing piece was a "green" wall in the lobby restaurant which is made of living plants. While staying there I found our that the hotel is a governmental project for hotel management school which actually runs the hotel and the staff are the students who study there. I was amazed by their work and devotion. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of superb amenities, service, design and location”
Reviews.Author: mmm356
Reviews.Content: I had searched for a high quality hotel that was not pretentious, stuffy nor ostentatiously gilt. Fortunately I found Hotel Icon, as it turned out to be the perfect match for my particular set of criteria; modern architecture, beautiful surroundings, great service, and convenient location. Hotel Icon exceeded my wish list in the best possible way on all these counts and more. The staff were attentive, professional, fluent in English and friendly. Breakfasts were wonderful thanks to the food (wide variety of Asian, European, and other options) which was exceptionally fresh and delicious, and the airy interior design with views in both restaurant options. The suite itself was surprisingly spacious, beautifully designed with a killer view of Kowloon and the water. I found the location to be ideal: convenient and urban while at the same time a welcome escape from the extreme density of much of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Club 80 Suite = Absolute Bliss”
Reviews.Author: capnplanet
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Icon was an absolutely wonderful one. Coming in jetlagged from the DTW-HKG flight, I was whisked up to my room and was checked-in in-room while being given a demo of the room's features. In the Club 80 Suite, like all of the harbor facing rooms, the view is absolutely gorgeous, with an unblocked view clear to Central. No request or question was too much, and every single staff member greeted me with a smile. It was honestly hard to leave. If you can, splurge for the club level rooms. The amenities included are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Metrodc
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect we would highly recommend anyone to stay here. We stayed in a club harbour room - great size, fantastic views, hotel was spotless, our spa treatments were fantastic. There was nothing I would have changed about my stay here the outside pool was quite special too. Attention to detail was very noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Yves22
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of what has been raved about this hotel. Its personnel's uniforms are unique (it compliments the image of the hotel), interior designs and gyms very well planned, and personnel helpful and courteous. Certainly one of the better 5 star hotels, though they could improve on hotel security. I've noticed that the elevator does not have a room access only lock, something found in most prominent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Emmar0se_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and two teenage children stayed at Hotel Icon in Hong Kong for 11 nights in December 2011. After researching hotels on Trip Advisor and reading the excellent reviews for Hotel Icon, I was confident that it would be a good place for us and I was certainly not disappointed! We had a standard king and a twin room, so no harbour view but the rooms were an excellent size with a really nice bathroom, great shower and comfortable beds. There was also a great range of movies and other entertainment channels for English speakers on the TV. Internet access is free and is wireless to all rooms. The mini bar, (which is cans of soft drink and m and m's) is free and restocked every day, very useful when travelling with kids! We didn't use the hotel's restaurant facilities as there are plenty of other restaurants within walking distance or a short ride on the MTR and this is always a cheaper option for us, however, there is plenty of choice if you are someone who prefers to eat at the hotel. The pool area is lovely and the kids enjoyed a swim most nights. I cannot speak more highly of all the staff at the hotel, they were all so helpful, courteous and friendly and went out of their way to help me when I discovered I had left my coat containing my wallet in the airport bus. They had it back to me within 30 minutes!! I would have no hesitation booking with Hotel Icon again and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone heading to Hong Kong for a holiday or on business.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Modern Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer7000
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and was very pleased with my stay. The hotel delivered and the staff were efficiently friendly. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. I was very grateful for the departure lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: merluza
Reviews.Content: This must have been the best hotel experience so far... We were lucky to have the soft opening rates, and at that rate, the experience has been unbeatable: amazing room, with an even more amazing bathroom, amazing poolside views, amazing rooftop restaurant, amazing staff. Even after check-out, it remained amazing, with the access to the chill-out room. The moment you walk in, everything is being taken care of for you, all you have to do is admire the architecture and design of the building. I can not come up with a negative comment, great work, ICON hotel!

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: alemun
Reviews.Content: We had the suite 65 and because we booked very early (before the first tripadvisor review) it was a perfect price for the suite with a big room with lounge,tv,work desk with printer, 2 toilet, bedroom, shower/bathtub. In each room large windows with harbour view. Can't be better... Our suite was at the end of the corridor so it was quiet. Some previous reviews are still right, the walls aren't that thick and if someone has a party or crying kids, you will hear it! The In-Room Dining is fast and the food was good. Downside was the two glasses of redwine, there was only two gulps in a glas. Looks nice and is correct if you have a whole bottle but not when the glas cost USD 10$ ! I think this is because they learned it so but not i what situation Service in the Above and Beyond Bar/Restaurant, The Market, Lobby was very friendly and helpful. All employees are very motivated to do the best and as guest you will feel this ! Location is good, MTR Hung Hom only 5 Minutes away and you can use the free shuttle bus. In the near surrounding is 7Eleven,some good Japan Restaurant, Italian etc

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui!”
Reviews.Author: NoraElena
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good memories of my stay at this hotel. Upon arrival, the staff opened their doors for us and ushered us into the hotel lobby. The smell of the lobby is so wonderful! The fragrance brings us such a nice welcome to the hotel. The staff at Hotel Icon are very friendly and young. Whenever we pass by any one of them, they will politely greet us at any time of the day. When we reach our hotel room, we felt so happy and more than satisfied with our room. For our Icon38 room, we felt like we got so much more that what we had paid for! There's the minibar, a big Samsung Smart TV and another smaller tv in the bathroom, an expresso machine, Bose mp3 player for our iphone, a printer, stationery items (which proved to be very useful!) and a big comfy bed! The view from our 16th floor is magnificent. Icon 38 is a very spacious room in our opinion. The room smells new and is top notch clean. The bathroom is just perfect. I love every single bit of the room! I'd definitely stay there again when I come back to Hong Kong in the future. The only thing that we found a hassle was the location. As it was situated 15 minutes away from the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station, hotel guests have to take a hotel shuttle bus (frequency every 20 minutes) to the MTR station. However, service ends at 10pm everyday. We had to walk back to the hotel two nights out of three and it was very tiring! But the location won't stop us from coming back to this hotel the next time for sure. Thank you Hotel Icon for making our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Can't I give it 6 stars?”
Reviews.Author: TriniAussie
Reviews.Content: Don't you love it when the reviews are all true? There isn't much more to add to what has already been said. We felt like VIPs from the time the taxi dropped us off. Ms K Siu at the front desk was kind enough to upgrade us, free of charge, to a room with a view of the harbour which came in handy to see the laser show at 8pm. The room was fantastic - brand new furnishings, technologically advanced telephone, a massive Samsung TV with Google maps and tonnes of free TV channels, a free mini-bar, and a fabulous bathroom. The hotel is located 10 minutes walk from the nearest MTR (Tube/Metro/Underground) station, and given that the hotel is in a safe neighbourhood, it is a pleasant walk. I really can't find any faults with the hotel, the room, or the service. The only minor gripe was that they charged HK$5 per page to print our boarding passes for our flights home. If the management is reading this, then please stop this practice, because so many hotels offer free printing (within reason), and charging me to print a page 'cheapens' the hotel. Nevertheless, this hotel deserves 6 out 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel all around!”
Reviews.Author: HuaLala
Reviews.Content: We spent one day at hotel Icon, and were pampered from the minute we walked into the lobby. Everyone in the hotel was polite and helpful, and really went out of their way to make us feel at home. The hotel, both the lobby and the room, are immaculate, bright, and elegant. Our room (without any upgrade) was large: spacious by American standard and GIANT for Hong Kong. There was room for two comfortable, twin sized bed, a large working desk, a sofa chair and more space for our luggage! We had a view of the harbor, which was spectacular at night with all the lights. The shower was a little funky, as there was only a shower curtain but no threshold between the shower and the rest of the bathroom. But as long as we sprayed against the wall, we were able to shower without getting any water out. The hotel is located very close to the Hung Hum train station, and the KCR east rail. To get to Tsim Sha Tsui, the concierge recommended the hotel shuttle, which runs to the Harbor City near the ferry terminal. It is also possible to walk to the East Tsim Sha Tsui station, where you can then take the Tsuen Wan Line on MTR -- very convenient! To get to the airport on public transit, take the airport express train to Kowloon, where a free shuttle (K3) will deliver you to the hotel. All in all, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel offers everything we needed, without much frills. The free minibar access is a nice touch, although a buffet breakfast would have been even better.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, Chic, Convenient, Classy, ICON!”
Reviews.Author: Longshanks3995
Reviews.Content: For the ICON, all I can say is, WOW. The ICON boasts charm along with class and elegance on a level unseen seen before in such an establishment. The ICON has a "neo-Atomic Age" feel combined with modern facilities that never cease to amaze. I absolutely adored the deep bathtub and walk-in rain shower. The hot water arrives in a matter of 2 seconds and you are provided with a plethora of free amenities from a shaving kit to a dental set. The highlight of the room's facilities was the mini bar! Never before in a hotel have I had a FREE mini bar available. It is equipped with four types of sodas, a Red Bull, Perrier, bottles of water, bags of M&M's, bags of nuts, and supplies for making tea and coffee. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in, and the TVs in the bedroom and bathroom were impressive. I enjoyed all three of ICON's restaurants, but my favorite would have to be The Market. The Market offers a lunch buffet daily and spared no expense in the quality of its food. My favorite dishes were the wanton soup, Singapore chicken curry, pork neck, and snow-crab legs. Along with its amenities and facilities, ICON's service was also impeccable. The manager has obviously done a fantastic job training his staff in providing outstanding service and amazing attentiveness. I cannot implore you enough to stay at the ICON. It was contemporary in it's design, chic in its style, convenient in its facilities, and classy in all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: Jane R
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel with all the attributes of the large hotels but with a small friendly feel. All the staff were marvellous going that extra mile to make you feel like you were completely special and nothing was too much trouble. The club rooms were fantastic and added with the ability to use the above and beyond floor at any time of the day was absolutely brilliant. Did not want to leave..

Reviews.Title: “I <3 Icon!”
Reviews.Author: Aisha H
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed by Hotel ICON. Not only is it a beautiful hotel, but the staff are amazing and accommodating. I ate in all three of their restaurants (Green, The Market, and Above & Beyond) and they were all delicious. The buffet at The Market was my favorite. Snow crab legs, curries, oxtail, sushi, and so much more. The room is very cool and the bed is huge. I have slept soundly every single night. I had a spa treatment at the Angsana Spa and it was extremely relaxing. My therapist was terrific. I cannot wait to stay here again and I recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for an experience "unlike any other"!

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: JonNorman75
Reviews.Content: We booked into Hotel ICON the day before our stay. We got a much better deal than the one presenting itself as we look into the possibility of booking another stay three weeks from now. Around £170 a night rather than £230. Upon arrival we were told they'd double booked us so immediately upgraded us to one of the best rooms in the hotel. Result. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The rooms extremely modern, clean and quiet. The location is excellent, very close to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. All in all a great spot and a wonderful hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Although I'm going to wait for a better deal before I book.

Reviews.Title: “I'm so coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Celia L
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right beside Victoria Harbour, great location. The check-in process was fast and we were given two free wi-fi codes and passwords, one for in-house guest and the other for non guest. How thoughtful! Our room is on the 15th floor. The room is quite capacious with wide working space and nice french window, from which we can see Victoria Harbour! Wi-fi speed is fast and It's amazing that all the mini bar drinks and snacks are free, and they arerplenished every day. Turning on TV, we are able to check our bill, as well as the local weather, map and exchange rate etc. I found it's so cool that when I was calling the guest services, I could actually see the staff name on my phone screen. We didnt get a chance to try out the pool and gym, but I'll definately come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Icon hotel Kowloon Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Mmichan
Reviews.Content: Hey, this place is really cool. I'm from Mexico but I travel alot. This place is very clean, very helpful and friendly staff, good breakfast. Rooms are a little small but ok. Very modern and technological. I would recommend this place. Check out the amazing pool and gym. It is worty it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gazzamataz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The hotel room was big for Hong Kong standards and the service was great. The pool and gym were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedDogAdelaide
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels all over the world and I came away from Hotel Icon believing it was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The room I stayed in was brilliant. It was a corner room with floor to ceiling windows windows with an almost 180 degree view of Victoria Harbour and Kowloon. The design of the room was very clever with a separate living are/office, bedroom and bathroom areas. The room was very modern with high quality finish. The shower & separate bath was very spacious and incorporated a waterproof LCD TV build into the wall in case you wanted to watch TV on one side of the bath whilst looking out over the city through the floor to ceiling windows on the other side. The living area was spacious and incorporated a clever curved office desk that made very good use of the space - the desk was spacious and very comfortable to work from and included a printer. The service from the staff was top notch. Generally the staff are quite young but they are very polite and it is very obvious they are very well trained and managed. Also noticeable was the healthy number of staff in the hotel - I could walk up to the concierge at any time and there was always a free staff member available to respond immediately. The breakfast on the 2nd floor was a great way to start the day. There is an abundance of good quality breakfast food. The one aspect they could improve upon is their cappuccinos by utilising a trained barista and not an automatic machine. Another nice feature of the hotel was the 9th floor "day" room. If you arrived before check-in or had a flight to catch after check-out, they had a secluded lounge area you could use to rest up, have a coffee, read a book or even have a shower. This is one hotel were it is definitely worth upgrading to the corporate floors. The upgrade entitled me to free in-room internet access, free mini-bar drinks, free breakfast, access to the 29th floor corporate bar area (free drinks between 6pm and 8pm and finger food), a small washing allowance (enough to wash 1 or 2 garments per day) and a later check-out. A nice feature of the internet access is it was not limited to one device. So I was able to connect both my laptop and my mobile phone to the internet via wireless under the one account. The manager of this hotel has to be commended for the very high standards they are achieving at Hotel Icon. This is a hotel that is achieving standards you would only expect from a hotel charging many times the room rate at Hotel Icon. The hotel is on the edge of the Kowloon shopping district and it is a pleasant 15 minute walk along the waterfront to the Star Ferry dock on the harbour. There is a train station 100m away though its not one of the main lines into central station so you would need to change trains to get to central. There is another subway station maybe 300m away with a line that runs directly to central station. There is a sedate shopping centre behind the hotel or you can go out the front door to join the shopping bustle of Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Form over function”
Reviews.Author: SC42300
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Hotel Icon. It is now the morning following the first night of a four night stay. When I entered the hotel yesterday evening, I was immediately impressed by the design of the public areas and of the guest rooms. However, after a night here, it is apparent that the importance of aesthetics were placed above functionality in the construction of the Hotel Icon. I am an expat living in Asia and come to Hong Kong every couple of years for fun and always stay at 5 star hotels. From the rave reviews I thought Hotel Icon would be on par with those other luxury hotels. After my first night, I have experienced a few "firsts" in a hotel, both good and bad, 1. First time I have showered in a hotel shower that did not drain. After 5 minutes I was standing in half an inch of water. I inquired about this and the maintenance staff promptly came and fixed this problem. 2. I am very sensitive to light when sleeping so always make sure to draw the curtains very tightly closed before bed. However, woke to the sun shining in my face because the curtains were not proper black-out curtains. Also, light shines in where the curtains meet the wall and directly into the eyes of whoever is sleeping by the window. 3. After falling asleep again with the duvet covering my face, was woken at 9am exactly by housekeeping. Pretty early for a Saturday morning I thought. 4, Due to the design of the shower, I lot of water splashes out, enough to form large puddles. We currently have towels covering the floor. 5. Oddly poor soundproofing. I can hear the guests upstairs. I don't want to sound overwhelmingly negative, this hotel is quite nice but with many flaws. I'm not dreading our next three nights here, but I do wish we were somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at The Market!”
Reviews.Author: HKHAWAII
Reviews.Content: A month ago, I decided to book a table at The Market--a buffet restaurant of Hotel ICON. When I called the restaurant, the line was busy. And an automatic pleasant voice told me to leave a message and someone would get back to me soon. My wife thought that we might wait until next day. But actually, 8 minutes later, a hotel staff called back to confirm my booking on 15 Dec.She also told me that the buffet is free for a child under the age of 6! My son is going to celebrate his 5th birthday. So, The Market would be an ideal place. My wife and I invited a close friend to dine there, too. We were amazed at so many options of food! My wife loved the crabs, while I the Italian pork slices. My friend ate a lot of Singaporean dish of crabs and roast lamb. Chef Philip Chan was so kind to advise me not to feed my boy with the shrimps, because they were cooked with alcohol. I accidentally mentioned that it was the birthday luncheon for my son. To our pleasant surprise, later Philip presented a small fruit cake with a lit candle and "Happy Birthday" to our table! The cake is small and should not have cost much. But the experience is far beyond our expectation! Just for this, I would like to rate The Market (or Hotel ICON) as 5 Stars or above!

Reviews.Title: “simply outstanding”
Reviews.Author: zoliverstravels
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we knew we had made the right choice. The staff spoke perfect english and were very polite, smiley and helpful. We stayed in a harbor facing club room on the 23rd floor and were very impressed. The hotel is so new and has a very trendy boutique feel.The room was small although you have to expect this anywhere in Hong Kong. The bed was very comfortable and they even have a pillow menu. The breakfast buffet had an impressive choice and was really good quality. Even when we turned up 2 minutes before breakfast was ment to finish we had no problem and the food was still on the go. The location of the hotel didnt seem to cause any problems for us, it was about a 15 minute walk along the front to to the ferry terminal which is a nice walk anyway. I do believe the hotel has a shuttle bus to the MTR aswell. If your thinking of booking this hotel then do it..you wont regret it

Reviews.Title: “ICON hotel is the Best”
Reviews.Author: William C
Reviews.Content: This hotel just opened in April and do they have their act together. Service, people, accommodations and the location in Kowloon are fantastic to excellent. The hotel is affiliated with the Shanghai Polytechnic Institute with one of the best Hotel Management University programs. Our daughter goes to Cornel, so they better watch out. This hotel must be a teaching or academic facility for the University. From the moment you walk in the door you feel at home with the light scent of ginger lily, to the great view from the Club Lounge and Pool of HK city/ day or night. I have stayed at many global top tier hotels and this is now one of my favorites. I would come back in a minute, well a few more months.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect & new!”
Reviews.Author: Kylie_Renz
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for 5nights. Check-in was easy & fast & it was a delight to have most people on reception speak English as our cantonese is very basic. We were in a club room with Harbor views-awesome view of the harbor! The hotel is new & very modern. Loved the foyer with the grass & flower wall & the smell in the foyer was so good! Rooms were big & comfortable! We loved the bathroom, moved the Bose dock in there & soaked in bath at night-great way to relax after a huge day sightseeing. Free mini bar & Nespresso machine restocked was a treat & the free Wi-Fi was so fast. We took advantage of the club cocktails in the afternoon with our package-it was so relaxing & they made a good drink with a great view. The club manager came around & made sure we were having a great stay. She also gave us her card with her number on it, incase we needed help or were out sightseeing & no one spoke English-she would translate for us. The pool & gym facility were great & had an awesome view of the Harbor. Buffet breakfast was good. Sometimes ran out of food & wouldn't get restocked but just asked the chef & he would cook it up straight away. We arrived @ 8am as our cruise docked at 6:30am. They took great care of us, stored our luggage so we could go sightseeing. But we just wanted to relax. They took us up to there waiting room, free soda, coffee, nespresso machine, fruit, papers, magazines, TV & comfortable chairs. Concierge would get a taxi for us in seconds & tell them where we wanted to go as taxi drivers speak minimum English. Great stay, very helpful & would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, convenient and very professional staff”
Reviews.Author: seira1404
Reviews.Content: Tried this hotel after having read good review and have to agree that the hotel provides good service. Excellent and very helpful staff with professional and good attitude. Room comes with free mini bar including coffee making machine. Convenient location too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the cost”
Reviews.Author: Jenz99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel ICON for three days last month and found the property excellent. We stayed in a club level room, and upon arrival at the property were escorted up to the 28th floor to check in . Staff was friendly and got us into our room quickly. We were on the 25th floor facing the harbor, and the view was as good as advertised. Enjoyed watching all the lights come on in the evenings, especially as many buildings had converted over to their holiday displays! The room itself was nice and big by market standards, with a king bed and lots of desk and storage space. If I had one complaint it was the bathroom - while it included all modern conveniences the layout was somewhat funky, and positioning of the shower could lead to some pretty big water spills if you weren't careful. Lighting in the bathroom was also a little dim, felt kind of like you were getting dressed in a cave. Insulation of the room was good, as I never heard other guests coming back to the room. We did take advantage of a lot of property amenities. Went up to the club lounge for complimentary cocktails all three nights we were there, which was relaxing after exploring the city all day. Also got a chance to use the pool, which overlooks the harbor and offers a great view at sunset. The pool was heated, but could get a little chilly at night as it was pretty windy that high up. I also used the fitness center one day and the equipment was in great condition. They had a couple machines I hadn't seen before and were fun to try. Ate at the lobby restaurant one night that we were there, prices were reasonable and the food was good. Service was a little slow, but the restaurant was very busy as it was raining out and most people didn't want to venture out. Breakfast was a good mix of American and local food - enjoyed the full buffet downstairs more than the smaller offering up on the club level. The rate we got was at least a couple hundred dollars cheaper than we would have paid for a club room at the Intercontinental or the Shangri-La, and given the newness of the facility and the great staff I think it was a great deal. Did not get to see the rooms at either property but did have dinner at the Intercontinental one evening, and some of the public areas were starting to show their age. Would have no problem recommending this hotel to friends or family, and would stay again if we ever find ourselves back in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “5-star hotel at 4-star price”
Reviews.Author: ChicChik
Reviews.Content: From the hotel room, we could watch the Symphony of Lights laser show at 8pm every night. However, the hotel is quite a walk from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. The thing that makes up for the distance is, there are many good eateries around the area. The free mini bar is quite a draw especially with the free m&ms chocolates -- my kids loved it! THe design is very chic and slick. That's what ChicChick likes! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Spyhotelier
Reviews.Content: Excellent front desk staff. They are very professional and helpful. I like the location as well. It is only 5 mins walk from Hung Hom station which I can take it to Guangzhou and to Shenzhen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel”
Reviews.Author: 143b
Reviews.Content: I find the hotel most innovative in design and offerings I loved free mini bar and super fast wifi throughout th hotel Gym with Technogym equipment was one of the best I experienced Excellent service by staff including interns from hotel management school under the hotel floors Will definitely com back if I would visit hong kong again...

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: GAURAV_MAGGI
Reviews.Content: The main reason for choosing the Hotel Icon - -Great reviews from TA members -Relatively cheaper then others 5 star hotels Pros- -Very Good Service/staff willing to help - Hotel Decor/Ambience - Swimming Pool/Views - Good City View From my room - Free Minibar Cons- -Location was not that excellent but not very bad either - Some of the staff is not able to speak english in a neutral accent The only negative exprerince i had was that It took around 1 hour time for check-in as their room was not ready..otherwise a very good stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickAAAA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the end of November and have to say this is an excellent choice. Rooms good size and drinks re stocked daily. Only real issue was the bar on the 28th floor closed at 11pm every evening. Ended up there for a drink after a meal out and along with a German couple and in a bizzar situation having room service at the bar. The lobby bar closes between 11.30 and 12.00 so the idea of a night cap is thwarted.

Reviews.Title: “ICON and a vertical garden”
Reviews.Author: TGettermann
Reviews.Content: The views are spectacular from any of the restaurants. Try the fitness room or pool few places in Hong Kong have similar views.Don't forget to see the vertical garden in the lobby - simply magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: pauloherbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on a stopover back from Sydney to London. It was a really great hotel. Checkin was great (even at 1am!), the room amazing well worth paying the extra for a harbour view and for 'above and beyond'. views from the room were amazing. Being able to have breakfast on the 28th floor overlooking the harbour was also really nice. It happened to be my birthday while we were there and without having said anything, it was a lovely surprise to get back to the room and find a big cheesecake and a card from the staff wishing me happy Birthday. Plus, the mini bar is free!! We couldn't fault the hotel at all and will most certainly stay there next time in HK.

Reviews.Title: “A Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OldBlueEyes675
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is terrific. From the decor, interiors and the amenities and last but certainly not least the staff. Raymond, Benny and Winnie to name but a few could not have been more helpful. Every time they saw us they asked us if we needed anything or if could they help in any way. Certainly the most attentive hotel staff we have encountered. It was well worth booking Club 36 a the benefits so generous, ie between 15-17 free afternoon tea and between 18-20 free drinks and Hors D'ouvres. We will certainly be recommending this hotel to any friends going to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The Details”
Reviews.Author: beejturner
Reviews.Content: Writing this review strictly from the standpoint of the hotel and it's operations, this is truly a fantastic hotel. Almost brand new, the interiors are very well done, the amenities are world class, they have thought of every detail, the staff (mostly students, I presume) are fantastic, and even the mini bar is free. The only challenge with the hotel is that the location isn't top tier for HK, but I'm willing to overlook that given the value this hotel offers. If this was in Central, they could easily command another $200 / night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: darwinsf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice: on my first 2 days in HK and on my last 2 days in HK during the same trip. In between, I went to Macau and stayed there overnight. For the first 2 days, I was lucky enough to procure a Club 36 Harbour room for the same price as a City View room. And let me tell you, there is a noticeable difference. For the Club 36 Harbour room (other than a view of the harbour), your free mini bar is stocked with beer, there is television in front of the tub, and the room comes with a printer. Sweet! I also got a room on the 27th floor which made for fantastic views of the harbour. All rooms have rain showers and are stocked with Leonard Paris accoutrements. The hotel itself is very modern (my type of aesthetic), looks new, is new, smells new. Actually, it smells like Burberry perfume when you walk in through the front door. The pool on the 9th floor is gorgeous, and the adjacent gym has the most modern equipment (love the treadmills). There is also a sauna in the men's room (I'm going to venture to guess that there is one in the ladies' room too!). I don't understand at any reviewer who would take umbrage at the staff's poor language skills. He couldn't be more wrong. In fact, our concierge (Angus, that's his name) helped get us reservations at all the restaurants we want to go to in Hong Kong. I certainly understood everything they said to me and vice versa. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who visits Hong Kong. It certainly made our visit (my first in 18 years) all the more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel......"”
Reviews.Author: lin5521
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at ICON Hotel in October 2011, it was one of the nicest hotel we ever stayed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located just off the busiest part of Tsim Sha Tsui which is nice. It was very easy to travel around Hong Kong and Kowloon using MTR. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the Hong Hum station, we found it very convenience and easy to get around. Taxi ride is very inexpensive, it cost us about US$2.50 to get from Tsim Sha Tsui station back to the hotel. We had a room on the 19th floor facing the harbour and the Hong Kong skyline, the view was just breathtaking. The complimentary mini bar was a pleasant surprise. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite in HK.”
Reviews.Author: Vegas2Macau
Reviews.Content: My boss was looking for a new hotel to stay in HK when we travel on business. I kept seeing The Icon Hotel advertised on all the travel sites so I decided to take the plunge! One word...WOW! Many foreign business travelers staying here now. It's clean with impeccable service and for that little "extra" we chose the CLUB FLOOR room. (We hold many meetings at the CLUB Lounge as it is quite and offers the best view of the harbour in the building) I've now stayed here 3 times and really don't see the value in purchasing the Harbour View over the City View as all the rooms had fascinating views of the city. The location is not near Kowloon central (Canton Rd.) but on a nice day it's a 20 min walk and you can see all the shops and small markets on the way. There is always a taxi just steps outside of the door so no worries there. The restaurants in the hotel are STELLAR! My favorite is THE MARKET. Open for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. I strongly recommend you make a reservation as soon as you check-in. The restaurants fill up fast with the local business workers for Lunch and Dinner. Free WIFI throughout the property and in your room. Also free mini bar and little snacks. Nice touch. My only "pet peeve" is how horribly SLOW the elevators are. Other than that this one is a MUST TRY.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend”
Reviews.Author: yuwenchang
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel ICON for 3 nights last weekend. We booked this hotel partially because of the great reviews on TripAdvisor and partially because it was relatively cheap in terms of 5 star hotels. The room was great, on the small side (which is completely normal for Hong Kong), and clean. The bed was super comfortable, you might never want to get up ever again. Sleep quality was great, except the room gets super dry at night. Credit goes to the room service, the cleaning lady was amazing, leaving the room impeccable every time when we came back to the hotel. The location was very good, close to Hung Hom station if you use the back door. However, Hung Hom is kind of awkward in terms of the MTR system, having to transfer three times just to get to Causeway Bay. The facilities were excellent - the views from the pool was breathtaking (especially at night). And the gym was very well equipped. All very clean and modern. The service was overall very good, although it seemed to still be one step down from excellent, nevertheless, it has great potential. All in all, Hotel ICON is excellent value for money - with excellent facilities, great rooms, and good service. The free mini bar was a plus. I would most definitely stay here if I were to come to Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service”
Reviews.Author: barrval
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Hong Kong and I was travelling alone for the first time, When I checked in my first priority was to find a doctor to treat my blistered feet after spending three days walking in Bangkok and the concierge couldnt have been more helpful in finding a doctor and setting up an appointment straight away. He then arranged a tour for me the following day and gave me ideas on where to eat and what to see. My room was excellent with all the amenities you could want, a view of the harbour and most important a comfortable bed.
