My first evening I went to the buffet restaurant for dinner which had the most amazing choice of food, but it was expensive at 493HKD about £40 although I do believe it was value for money. They also have a lobby cafe which is very nice where you can get a light meal or lunch or snack. The hotel is in an excellent location with shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance , even with my feet. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel. One piece of advice I was given was do not buy cameras or electronic items on Nathan road as what you see is not always what you get, the best places to go for these items are Fortress or Broadway stores although I didnt find prices that much cheaper. In all I really enjoyed Hong Kong it was lively, vibrant and somewhere I would go back to

Reviews.Title: “Superb business stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: RudiHefer
Reviews.Content: I have made 3 trips to Hong Kong, and stumbles onto the Icon reviews on Trip Advisor. Trip Advisor has become my reference point of choice for selecting Hotels on my numerous international travels again, it has not disappointed. Hotel Icon in a fresh, vibrant, superbly facilitated Hotel which I can highly recommend. The reception staff are well informed, frienly and efficient. The Green Bistro is a fantastic afternoon coffee or wine spot and the staff are well informed and the food is superb. The rooms are modern and very well kept with superb ameneties and attention to detail The club rooms on the 38th floor provide superb views of Hong Kong and the Gymnasium, changing rooms and "tranist room" are all kmagnificent. The Market, the Hotel's main resaurant, is very populart and serves fantastic food and wine. Whilst at face value the Hotel seems a little out of the way, the TST East MTR is a 10 minute walk away. I can honestly say that I can find any faults with this hotel and this will most certainly become my hotel of choice for business and personal travel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for money - almost faultless”
Reviews.Author: 40ishcouple
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to Hung Hom station ( the train to Shenzhen) , its price and the good reviews it had recieved since opening. Our expectations were not just met but exceeded. The rooms and public areas are quite lovely with significant thought put into the design and excellent attention to detail - ie. lights come on automatically when you enter your room and the shower head actually points IN to the curved shower screen/tray and not out of it like most. The complimentary minibar is a great idea and all services we experienced were faultless. The location really was very good being still walking distance to Star Ferry, TST etc but the proximity to the train station made our lives much easier after winning the shopping Olympics at Shenzhen on a couple of occasions. Other things that really stood out : The pool area and indeed the view from the pool area is quite oustanding - the entire harbour and Island right there in full panorama. It became a popular place to regroup at the end of the day and watch the Lightshow with a cold drink, depsite the fact that our rooms also had great views. The Concierge and particularly Cody where outstanding - Cody did everything from chase us down the street to direct us to a better restaurant ( he rang ahead and discovered they were out of Goose which he knew we were after) to packing up our shopping and organising it to be shipped back to Australia. Nothing was too much trouble and his smiling face and happy demenour was very much appreciated. Also the 'Timeless' room was very welcome and we all used it when we checked out to repack, relax and show etc...as our flight was not until very late. In saying this is also the first hotel I can remember that allowed us to check in at 7.00 AM ( at not extra charge)- can you beleive it ! This purpose built training hotel is an excellent idea for both students and travellers and offers a tremendous option for Hong Kong visitors at a fraction of the price of similar establishments. I rarely stay anywhere twice but cannot think of a single reason why I would even bother researching another hotel for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Like a W, but not a W.”
Reviews.Author: Fareastender
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Icon, almost by accident. TST East is not an area that I would normally choose to stay in HK, but on this occasion is was very close to where I had a meeting planned. The hotel is quite new and very modern, same sort of feel as a W, but not quite the same 'air' of luxury. Nonetheless, it's a great hotel to stay at for a couple of day. Great views over HK Island and fantastic gym and friendly staff all add the the experience of a pleasant stay. In term of the price for the facilities on offer, I thought it was very good value. Oh, and the mini bar was all free (no alcohol though!).

Reviews.Title: “If I could give it 6 stars I would!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_p81
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a five night stay at hotel Icon and I have to say there was absolutely nothing at all I could complain about. Nothing was less than perfect. The hotel is modern, clean and brilliantly designed. The service was perfect and the food great. There is a free shuttle bus to central Kowloon but we actually enjoyed the walk (about 10-15 minutes). Of all the hotels I have ever stayed in hotel Icon is by far the best. There is something about the way this hotel is run that seems to be in tune with what guests want and expect. I worked in hotel's (sales and management) for 10 years and hotel Icon could teach some of the international hotel chains a thing or two about how to run a hotel. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough, we genuinely enjoyed our time here. By comparison to other hotels in the area this hotel also offers brilliant value for money. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Forget afternoon tea and the Peninsula, "The Green" (in the reception area) does a great afternoon tea.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon - What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: bollyb
Reviews.Content: Staffed by students and used as a training school for hospitality and hotel management. This 5 star gem is amazing. Located with all the big names in international hotels in East TST this was a great on-line find. The rooms are first rate. The views amazing. The staff were just amazing young students who could not do enough to help and nothing was a problem. The use of the hospitality room with free drinks and nibbles for those arriving early or leaving late was an added bonus. We arrived at 6am, were able to store our luggage use the amenities to clean up, sit back and read the paper, make a coffee, grab a bite to eat (fruit plate), watch the telly and get ready for an amazing day of sites in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tennille
Reviews.Content: In a great position, everything new with beautiful bathrooms. The harbour view rooms have a wonderful view at night with a lazer show around 8 p.m. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience for a new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Oztravels7
Reviews.Content: I checked into what I thought was going to be a fabulous hotel. The room was nice enough and the bathroom looked delightful, until I had to use it! It flooded when I showered, I called the hotel who sent maintenenace staff and told me they had fixed it. Low and bejold when I went to shower again, same issue! No apology from the hotel just get on with it attitude. Nice gym though but I would not recommend this if you are looking for any service standards!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CeeKil
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights in a harbour view room. The view was fantastic, the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in and to cap it all, there was a Nespresso coffee machine in the room! There is nothing I can fault with this hotel. The staff were excellent - helpful and polite and the rooms were spotless. We were sorry to leave. If we ever have the fortune to visit HK again, this hotel will be at the top of the preference list.

Reviews.Title: “over rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShuShuShanghai
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel is rated No.1 by the reviews at tripadvisor, it is over rated by my experiences. It is true that this is a new hotel by Hong Kong standard, services are very good, staff is young and very friendly, and outdoor heated pool is fantastic. However, the hotel has certain handicaps to make it impossible to be rated No. 1: First, it does not have good ocean view as it is not a first line ocean view hotel (for those who intends to book 36 harbor view rooms, my advise is not worth it); Second, it is not close to metro station by Hong Kong standard, especially if you are going to Hong Kong side; Third, the shower booth in the room is in a narrow shape, which makes one uncomfortalbe. The second point is a big negative factor if you are a tourist and you are going to Hong Kong side very often since taking metro is the best way going around there. Taking a cab is not only expensive but also time consuming as trafic is not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent service & hotel”
Reviews.Author: uthinx
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel's architecture and room interior (especially the bathroom), excellent service when I asked them to prepare surprise Birthday Cake to my partner - they can provide precisely and its a complimentary from Hotel Icon, thanks for Jacky & Grace.. Enjoy our staying there for 4 nights before we left to Macau The breakfast in the market is fabulous, the concierge and all the staffs is really helpfull, the angsana spa and the pool is also fascinating... The location even a bit far from Tsim Tsa Hui, but you can walk for 10-15 minutes. The nearest MTR is Hung Hom, its pretty easy if you would like to go to Disneyland or Big Budha. But Hotel Icon also have a shuttle to take us to Tsim Tsa Hui area every an hour if you don't want to walk there..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room with Harbourview and fabulous breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dieuwke
Reviews.Content: We stayed over for one night in Kowloon Hong Kong at the Icon.The lobby with the carpetlike garden on the walls,really an architectonic art-piece.Fabulous rooms with all commodities and free minibar(why don't they do that more?)Amazing bed and the lovely chair,next to the window ,invites you to sit and enjoy "The View of Hong Kong". Because we stayed only one nights between flights,we did not have time to enjoy everything the hotel had to offer but we hope to come back some day to do that.The buffet-breakfast at "The Market" was not included in the room price but was outstanding,the variety and quality of the food was way over what you get at most hotels,definitly worth the price. Do take the rooms with habourview it is worth the extra cost.The location was very convenient, near metro and shopping all at walking distance .To the airport with the Airport-express with shuttle to the hotel was also very fast.Would love to come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LisaDH
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Icon was fabulous. We loved every part of this very modern hotel and thought it very well priced for the level of service we received. The huge atrium entrance was cool and smelt delicious. Our room was so well designed, with everything we needed and more. Very quiet, with super - comfortable beds. We slept so well we missed breakfast both days, but we had dinner on 28th floor, tea in Green restuarant and Sunday brunch in the Market. All delicious and beautifully served. The staff were so thoughtful, they could not have been more helpful. The pool was superb, with marvellous views, and swimming in the late afternoon sun after a busy day's shopping was a highlight of our stay. We look forward to staying at The Icon again.

Reviews.Title: “very good modern new hotel”
Reviews.Author: kivancgorkem
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a very good condition and well priced, is very close to metro station and main shopping attraction around kowloon area. concierge and other staff was fine, breakfast price was high related to the average quality.

Reviews.Title: “The small things”
Reviews.Author: Badliutent
Reviews.Content: Hotel icon is most everything I like in a hotel. It's modern and fresh. There isn't yet the hidden mould that might be found if taken a closer look as in some longer term hotels. I've booked 4 nights with Icon. Although everything is in place so far as a physical structure goes, it's the smoothness of the staff and the little things which I too will remember. So far My gripe has been errors with room service. Missing something in an order or not providing what I asked as the meal option. Was it in the translation? Having said that, it's only a small part of our experiance and I wont be focusing on that once I leave. I would definitely recommend a stay as it is a nice boutique hotel. It will be even better once the staff are encouraged / empowered to proactively make decisions to the benefit of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TO_traveller69
Reviews.Content: spent 2nights in the club room @ icon. stay was faultless, we loved every part of the hotel. very modern and new. staff very attentive. gym and pool on 9th floor overlooking the harbour and HK island amazing. added benefits of club level included afternoon tea, cocktail hour. will definitely be staying here again on return to HK

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: 50ishPerthites
Reviews.Content: Excellent 1 week stay at the Hotel Icon, worth the extra to have access to Executive benefits - wonderful food, great service and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel but not child friendly”
Reviews.Author: BSWAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife, five year old son and myself stayed at the Hotel for two nights after a business trip to Beijing, and on previous reports from satisfied guests on this site. From the outset, the hotel is very nice. It is fairly new and has a good mix of facilities. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable (we had a harbor view suite); the harbor view well worth the extra money. Also don't worry about the location as some reviews allude to. It's not so far out of the way and taxis are super cheap. Having said all that, our son was not made to feel welcome at all. We were singled out on one occasion (for taking him with us to the 28th floor lounge) where he apparently was not allowed until he is six...4 months time! The staff showed a full lack of compassion and understanding. We had stayed in suites in 5 star hotel chains and boutique hotels, and never had that. We have stayed in other hotels in HK and would recommend if you have children, consider looking somewhere else. In fairness to the Hotel, they did arrange a late check out in another room type for us after this debacle, but by then the damage was done...and we had a near to six year old boy asking what he had done wrong... unforgivable in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, great views and service and would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Donskie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on business for over 10 years and never had a harbour view and I had one from the room, gym, pool and lounge! The service was great and I loved the modern Conran design, especially the dog tooth chairs. Although a bit of a walk from the star ferry, it really wasn't an issue and if I was on holiday I would definitely stay here to enjoy the great facilities. I did however use the gym and pool with the amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: sendtotak
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located in a quiet but convinence location. Room is spacious and well.designed. Staff members are polite, friendly, helpful, and attentive to all requests and feedback. Will sure stay again and recommend to friends and family. T Choy - Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Staying in style”
Reviews.Author: DimitrisTheHague
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that has plenty of style, sophisticated design, friendly staff, a good location and one of the best pools facing Hong Kong island, then go to ICON. it also has all what we expect from any 5* hotel: very comfortable rooms, cleanness, restaurants...

Reviews.Title: “It was a right choise”
Reviews.Author: STr1t
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's actually a very good hotel. Nice design, clean and comfort rooms, very good breakfast (one of the best I've ever seen), and beautiful view on an island. oh, this hotel was built this year, so it's new. It's located in 5 minutes walk from subway station and in 2 minutes ride by taxi from ferry station. But I think it would be priceless if it was located in a Central. On my second visit to HK I decided to stay in another hotel, which was a slightly cheaper. It was a very big mistake. So, don't think — book it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful fireworks”
Reviews.Author: jjpm
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel wonderful views of the harbour. Our room on the 14th floor was very large with a hi spec bathroom. Our visit coincided with natinal day so we had a wonderful view of the fireworks from our room best I have ever seen. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A good location. definitly stay again

Reviews.Title: “fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: IIoana
Reviews.Content: Hotel ICON is THE 5 stars hotel; we have stay there for 5 days in August and had a wonderfull experience. New hotel, with extremely efficient staff and good location, on Kowloon island( the nice part of Hong Kong, with restaurants, stores). From expresso cofeemachine to multifunctional and Bose audiosytem I dock , we found everything in the room. Nice touch with free Perrier, nuts or dry fruits and fabulous view. From our room we had a splendid harbour overview, in the night lights show was great. The food was great , the breakfast is served in to a restaurant with the same view, at The Market and afternoon tea with nice apetisers at GREEN. We did not have time to try the spa or pool. The staff was great, we received indication about everything. It was very nice to travel from Kowloon station from airport, a hotel bus was waiting and we receive a free suttle bus to the same station. Also, every 15 minutes, a bus take the guests in the city. The checking formalities were very efficient, overal, a wonderfull stay. I would reccomend the hotel with all the trust.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, beautiful and gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: BenDaniels
Reviews.Content: CHose this as was new and had never been there. What a good choice! A lobvely hotel, fabulous views from my bedroom (Club room), used the Club room a lot and breakfast views are wonderful Staff very friendlly, service is frst rate, bathrooms super and great lines and style. Bed nice and comfy and food quality is lovely Concierge very knowledgable and while not close to thed MTR as otehr hotel it is a short walk and the hotel has a regular shuttle bus so I never felt this was a problem Stylish hotel and I l;ikely will never stay anywhere else in Hong Kong again as this is a really wonderful and awesome hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon”
Reviews.Author: JetRTW
Reviews.Content: As a family of five we found it hard to find hotels in Hong Kong that could accommodate us. Here we had a suite in the Above & Beyond floor and they upgraded our other twin room to that floor too so we could be next door. The design of the communal areas is fab and there is great attention to detail in the rooms too. We loved the friendly but helpful service and on the whole we felt the hotel offered a real Wow experience. Would very happily stay here again! For some more details & photos, check here on our blog...just ignore the general holiday info... http://jet-rtw.blogspot.com/2011/10/hotel-icon-hong-kong.html

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: KSadvisor
Reviews.Content: Overall highly recommended and excellent value for money compared to the other HK hotels. Pros - central location, 5-7min walk to metro station, large rooms very modern and chic, excellent shower with TV, good value, free wi-fi in the room most other HK hotels charge, nice gym and pool, excellent service very helpful staff booking restaurants, arranging taxis, free shuttle bus, free shuttle bus from kowloon station, airport check in at kowloon station. Cons -overall not many cons but if you want to be extremely picky, ex-pat nightlife more on HK island side, decent harbour view but not the picture classic that you get from Ritz-carlton (which is 3 times the price). overall i wouldnt hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!! I want to come back again and again!!!”
Reviews.Author: mooer
Reviews.Content: I was only here for the one night after having travelled around China for 7 nights in different hotels and i definalty saved the best until last! As soon as enter it is so uber cool and modern and just great! The staff are polite without being too over the top and nothing to any trouble. The rooms are a good size - lovely and modern with a fantasic shower and a deep tub with a TV!!! Nice toiletaries as well. The bed is huge and fantastically comfortable as in the chair in the room!! I love the hotel and all the touches that go into it - the pool area is great - and the staff will continously keep your glass filled with ice cold water! There is also a room if you have a late flight where you can wait and have coffee and snacks - for free!!!!! Its great and all the things that all the other reviewers have said are all true!!!! I will defianly stay here again and i am sure that this hotel will soon climb to the top of the ratings!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: specialk23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at just about every 4 and 5 star hotel in Tsim sha tsui. This is one of the best. I booked on the basis of trip advisor reviews and had a great experience. I check in at 7am during the canton fair season. But the check in staff member was able to find me a handicapped access room which was just fine because I had flown all night and wanted to freshen up. The room was beautifully appointed. Quality fittings throughout. The gym and pool area a re simply stunning. A must visit. Breakfast was also world class. Staff at every point of contact (reception, bellboys, gym, restaurant ) were just so helpful and professional - very impressive. I'm not a fan of TST east location where this hotel is because it is a bit far from the action. But I would definitely make th eeffort for this hotel. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Megloulou
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here in mid october and could not have been happier with our choice, from time of booking until check out we had a great experience. I was travelling with a friend and so we booked a harbour view 36 room which was a very good size with plenty of room for our luggage and subsequent shopping. The bathroom was excellent though it could have had a couple of extra towel rails. The free mini bar was great especially the little packets of M&Ms after a hard day of shopping and touring provided a much needed sugar boost. Staff were extremely friendly and efficient but the star of the show was the view from our room which was spectacular. We did not book a club room and were located on level 17 which provide very very good views. We had breakfast a couple of times which was good but there are plenty of places close by if you choose not to. This was my second trip to HKG and my friend's 6th time and both of us would definitely stay here on our next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ShellywUK
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here last week, we were totally blown away! We have stayed in some really good hotels but this topped them all for us. The hotel and the rooms are beautiful and perfectly styled but functional, the bedroom wasn't massive but more than big enough for us and the habour view is a must! We ate in Greens and the food and service were fantastic. All I can say is that 99.9% of hotels could learn a thing or two from Hotel ICON.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manateepat
Reviews.Content: We stayed very recently one night at this hotel. It looks very nice and modern. Very nice and spacious rooms and a beautiful design of the common space (lobby, swimming pool, fitness area). Check out the views outside from the swimming pool during the day and at night (on 28th floor you cannot go outside). Hotel is a short walk to the ferry and shops. Service was flawless, everyone was very helpful. We could check in early. Breakfast was good as well, plenty ofchoice. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: 210beast
Reviews.Content: One of the best in HK. Make sure you get a club room. Everything included breakfast, Internet, laundry allowance per person per day 100HKD, drinks at Above and Beyond on 28th floor. Staff were great and rooms exceptional. Perfect place to stay for business. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: FrankieandBe
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Icon and cannot wait to return. The staff were attentive, polite and could not do enough to ensure our stay was enjoyable. Our room was located on the 26th floor with magnificant views of Hong Kong Harbour. The bed was super comfty and the pillows were like clouds. Free m&m's, nuts & drinks were a very nice touch. Breakfast (in the Market Place) was excellent and very fresh, with a huge variety to chose from. The croissants, breads etc were even baked as we sipped on our coffee. The free cocktails & canapes were our favourite time of the day. Benny (the bartender) would make us anything we requested and every time they were 10 out of 10. Afternoon tea was also lovely with complimentary tea, coffee, cakes and savouries. We were happy with Hotel Icon's location and did not think it was too far from the MTR at all. Overall a fantastic experience and I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: eggegg
Reviews.Content: In general, I confirm what is said by the other reviewers about this hotel! Service is excellent and very attentive. The top floor restaurant is excellent too! If you book a Club room, upon check-in you will receive a letter listing all the services that you can benefit from - unfortunately some of these triggered us into hidden costs, so be careful. Although the hotel policies are uncomfortably inflexible one one side (see the hidden costs above), they are surprisingly flexible on the other. In fact, on check-out day, we had a late evening flight back home and we were allowed to use the hotel services until departure (these being the swimming pool & fitness room and the free cocktails and buffet in the Club lounge in the evening). If you are a late sleeper avoid taking breakfast at the hotel which is certainly very good, but unfortunately closes at 10:30 already. So if you get there at 10:31 and want to take your prepaid breakfast you are sent to the ground floor bar to get a coffee and you are charged for it! The hotel has recently opened and I stayed there on the last day of the testing period. Some employees were walking around, interviewing the guests about positive and negative points as well as seeking for suggestions. So since my stay several services and policies might (hopefully) have changed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Claude C
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great staff willing to learn, obvious that they are part of the University next door, a totally new experience for HKG, room we had was 65m2, big for HKG with fantastic harbor view, fully equipped with printer and IT set-up, breakfast buffet was very well stacked, Asian and European style food Complimentary cocktail hour on the 28th floor, very warm athmosphere and great view. Location is great as well, next to the MTR station, plus complimentary shuttle bus to TsimSha Tsui. Check-in process could be faster, it takes too long. I shall be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Number one for me!”
Reviews.Author: whitaylot-11
Reviews.Content: Husband had business trip to HK electronics fair so I checked reviews and decided on Icon for HK and Westin Bund for Shanghai. Loved everything about Icon and Club Suite 80 room, 1 and 1/2 bath,comfortable bed and pillows, and especially the free mini bar which was non-alcoholic. Breakfast at buffet is included with club rooms and it is well worth the extra money to get the full variety. Restaurant meals in HK can be expensive unless you want to eat like the locals at the street shops or McDonalds. Shopping at little local shops are a quick walk away including an intenational market grocery next to Watsons, where you can buy lots of western style foods with labels in English. We bought bread,cheese and V8 juice. The luxury and high end shops are a short walk or taxi ride away and are more plentiful than Las Vegas. Hotel service was excellent, we asked for only diet coke in the bar and extra water,no problem. We took advantage of the free $100 each for two persons daily laundry for our PJs and misc. This hotel is great just like the recommendations, and compared to the Westin Bund in Shanghai(5 star) I think It deserves the 5 star rating instead.They even sent up a free cake when they found out it was my birthday! We did HK restaurants that were reviewed on Tripadvisor and both were excellent also.Peking Garden and Sabatini italian.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice tks to tripadvisor.com”
Reviews.Author: DRC1957
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a biz trip in HK and stayed in a rather roomy Club Suite on the 17th floor . Great views, lots of space for a very reasonable price when compared to other metropolis of this importance. Work area with own printer, scanner and everything from paper clips to bostitch. Let s not forget free minibar, and the Nespresso machine. ( i needed it badly due to my jetlag and susequent disorderly sleeping patterns). Top floor restaurant offers very good chinese cuisine and a nice wine menu. I recommend suckling pig for dinner and eggs benedict in the morning. The Hotel is very well managed and staff is well trained. Everything that I requested was delivered in timely fashion and with a smile on the face . From picking me up at the airport to a simple club sandwich at 3 am HK time or organizing a taxi . Last but not least let me mention the gym. Absolutely fantastic views from the 9th floor , overlooking the lit pool and then further on the skyline of HK island. A pleasure to work out! My next stay in HK will be at the Hotel Icon. Ps: while you re at this Hotel and if you like japanese food ask to indicate the way (it s walking distance) to the restaurant Kenjo, in a hidden cul-de-sac (30 Minden Av.) Memorable culinary delight!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Now my hotel of choice in HKG”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTraveller3
Reviews.Content: I'm here, having just had the fourth night of a five night business trip to HKG. I decided to book this hotel after reading the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. I've stayed in several other hotels nearby, and this one beats them all. It's an extremely professional atmosphere, but it's also reasonably relaxed. You get that legendary Asian level of real quality service, but without feeling fussed-over, as you do in other hotels. I'm staying in a Club Suite 60 (I think that's what it's called!). There's loads of room for one, but it would also be pretty spacious for two. Having a separate work space is great. There are two massive TV's, and the biggest bath and sink I have EVER seen. The shower/bath room is a wet room, with a fabulous shower built into the ceiling. From a business perspective, at last I have found a good hotel which provides free wi-fi. I have never understood why other hotels insist on charging for this. Here it's free, and you just connect as many devices as you like for nothing. Great! There's a fancy printer/scanner in the room which prints wirelessly, and there are nice touches like little wooden trays with 'helpful' stuff like a stapler, paperclips, sticky notes etc. That's a really nice touch. If you're in a suite, you really don't need the use of a business centre. There are nice places to sit in various parts of the hotel on the 1st and 2nd floors, and I satisfactorily held a couple of meetings there. There's a really lovely board room on the top floor which you can also use if you're staying in Club. The 'Above and Beyond' Lounge on the 28th floor is super. The views across Victoria Harbour to the Island are stunning, and I'll bet you'd struggle to get a better one without paying huge amounts of extra cash at the waterside. Nick manages it, and he's brilliant. The quality of the food in the hotel is excellent - I thoroughly recommend the 'Eggs Royale' at breakfast - blimey! Of course, food is dear by HKG street standards, but it's certainly not dear for what you get by 5-star hotel standards. There's a nice, relaxed happy hour going on, officially from 6:00-8:00, but I went in at 5:30 and got a free glass of champagne. The hotel is a brisk 6 or 7 minute walk from the nearest MTR. But taxis are pretty cheap, and I've been journeying to Central by taking a taxi from the hotel to the Star Ferry at TST ($20 - about £1.70) and then bobbing across the harbour on the ferry. There is a shuttle bus which goes to the MTR, but I never seemed to have the time available to wait for that. So, would I come back here? Definitely. It offers me everything I need, and I'd much rather have the extra space of a suite here on this side than pay a lot more for a shoebox at the Mandarin. October 2011

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Clock2011
Reviews.Content: Wow what a beautiful hotel, service, location, rooms, view it has it all. We spent 4 nights there last week with another couple and I think we should have stayed 4 weeks.... We chose a harbour view king room for our rooms which we wonderful had awesome views day and night, so quiet and bathrooms amazing. We looked at the suite 80 whilst there and chose not to upgrade as we were so happy with our rooms allocated on level 26. The Above and Beyond lounge on Level 28 was a fabulous oasis for drinks all day and evening drinks and canapes and finished off by viewing the light show on the harbour each evening from 8pm. We ate breakfat in the restaurant on Level 2 which was spectacular, such a variety of beautiful fresh food. The pool, gym, steam room and spa on Level 9 were out of this world. We struggled leaving such a perfect place, close to many restaurants, duty free shopping and anything you desire right there on the doorstep. Thank you Hotel Icon we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Hong Kong Encounter - Hotel Icon”
Reviews.Author: Jaj408
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel of the soft opening deal for a week stay in September with my girlfriend. We had a harbour 'basic' room, which was beyond basic. Had fantastic uninterrupted views of the harbour. The room itself was spacious, with the choice of choosing matress and pillows for ultimate comfort! Loved the touches such as the free mini bar, and M&Ms. The room was modern with all the modcons in including a tv in the bath, full flat screen tv, and interactive Television screens. The bathroom was very nice, including a rainfall shower. The hotel had an excellent roof top pool, though was often busy and hard to get a sun lounger. The gym was excellent also, and we discovered on the last day that in the changing rooms there are saunas. On check out we used the timeless room, great touch with free drinks and newspapers to pass the time. We ate in the seafood buffet one evening, excellent lobsters galore and freshly made sushi! Would definatley visit again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Little Gem in TST”
Reviews.Author: hidden0rchid
Reviews.Content: HK is one of my favorite places to shop and I visit the place quite often. Hotel Icon is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. HK being the Asian hub that it is, has many nice hotels but (and this is a big BUT) HK customer service in general is not known to be the friendliest. I have stayed in many hotels where the service has been efficient but very curt. Not in Hotel Icon. The staff is so wonderful and nice! And have I mentioned that the place is so chic and modern? My husband and I were given a room upgrade and the club room was just gorgeous with a great view of the harbor. My husband couldn't wrap his head around the "everything in the bar is free" concept and the in-room Nespresso machine just sent him to heaven. The room and bathroom was huge especially by HK standards. But this hotel earned my complete admiration when I fell ill with food poisoning (courtesy of another hotel's restaurant) and the night staff made a midnight run to the convenience store to pick up electrolyte rich drinks for me. The staff would even ask my husband how I was doing the days after. There is only 1 major drawback to staying at this hotel. If you are a shopaholic like me and love hotels that sit on top of major shopping malls so that you can bring up your bags and rest in between sprees, you will have a hard time staying at Hotel Icon which is quite far from Ocean Terminal, Nathan Road and all the other TST shopping areas. They have a free shuttle that leaves every hour which is great but you will have to either walk or take a taxi back to the hotel which is very difficult with a lot of shopping bags. But if you are in HK for business or other non-shopping reasons, then I cannot recommend this hotel enough! It's the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahretirement
Reviews.Content: Chic and contemporary without being stuffy. There simply couldn't be better service from nicer staff at any hotel in the world. This hotel is beautiful with inspiring design every where you look. We had a huge 800 sq ft suite with a panoramic view of Victoria Harbour and Hong Kong Island. With a 14 day advance booking this magnificient room was little more than a standard cramped room at the Marriott or the W. Don't miss this place when you visit HK.

Reviews.Title: “The best city hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Jo S
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel as part of our honeymoon in August. It was a pleasure from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. First off the location could not be better with incredible views of the Hong Kong skyline and easy access to all city transport. The interior design of the hotel is outstanding, the rooms are full of little treats and ultra modern technology and the views are just breathtaking especially from the upper floors. When we arrived, the reception staff had left a bottle of wine and a card individually signed by a number of staff to wish us well on our honeymoon. We could not get over this level of service. The pool was stunning, even the gym was a pleasure to be in which I would not have imagined! We availed of the Above and Beyond club lounge and wow was the service spectacular. Benny (one of the barmen) really made our stay, he could not have been more helpful and attentive. The hotel staff were exceptionally warm and professional. This is a place that must be visited, absolute heaven! Will definitely return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: notoftheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Icon in Kowloon and cannot say enough about the quality of the rooms and services provided by this new hotel. Very close to Hung Hom train station and has shuttle service from Kowloon station Airport Express. The rooms are spacious, with very comfortable beds, large walk-in showers and separate bath. Pool & spa are exquisite as are the dining options. Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “the suit is realy worth it, dont miss it”
Reviews.Author: THX
Reviews.Content: i visited this hotel me my wife and 2 kids (10 & 12 ) we booked in a suit room, the hotel is exteremly clean, breakfast was great and tasty, very big breakfast area, pool was clean and big, also they had a gym which got most of the equipment, staff very friendly, also room fares are reasonable, i would realy recommend everyone to stay on this hotel, im a kind of person who is very critic, but i found this hotel so great, also We loved the nice scent , one mmore thing, they have one of the greatest thai massage

Reviews.Title: “Amazing new boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1edmond2
Reviews.Content: While looking at hotel in hong kong, we were finding difficulty finding a hotel that was our style. The Mira or W were definitely good choices but they were full. We found this gem on the web and we were not expecting much, given the low price point. Wow, seriously, this place is fantastic. First, it's an easy access by train and bus from the airport. Really no brainer. The lobby and the restaurants are fantastic. In fact, the restaurant on the top floor was full on a sunday night! The room are well appointed and if you pay the extra, you can ave gorgeous view over the bay that will make hutong and Aqua shy... The rooms are good size, the bathroom are gorgeous with marble, a TV in the mirror and an "umbrella" shower. There is a flat screen if you wanted to watch TV with tons of western channel. It's a 10 minutes walk to the tube station but cab are so cheap in HK that we would just cab to the station for 2USD. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice whether on business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: str8fwd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while on holidays with my gf, and we had a ball. The hotel is well located,stylish and unique. We loved the nice scent which can be smelled as soon as you enter the hall. The check-in was easy and the staff was very helpful in helping us taking the luggage upstairs. The staff is pretty casual but polite and efficient, so I did not mind. The bedroom (harbor suit) is rather spacious (although it did look bigger on the pictures on the website, as usual!) and comfortable. We loved the big shower and the bathtub, great for romantic plans ;) I would recommend this hotel to any couple on a romantic escape or even honeymoon (I believe they have suites too). The only regret we had is that we were not able to try the bar, as it was closed when we were going back from our outings.

Reviews.Title: “An ICON in-the-making”
Reviews.Author: sojourneys
Reviews.Content: The most interesting factoid about Hotel ICON, situated next to the historic Hong Kong Coliseum (known affectionately as 紅磡), is that it is a teaching and research hotel owned and operated by the Hong Kong Polytechnic University (also adjacent). Perhaps because of this lineage, Hotel ICON exudes a fresh, young, stylish vibe. The staff look young, are personable, and helpful. The hotel opened in mid-2011, and naturally, facilities are spanking new. Because the interior design (by Hong Kong native William Lim) adopted a contemporary, understated language, I think the property will hold its age well over time. The best part of the room is its spaciousness (my city-view room measured 36-square meters) and the floor-t0-ceiling windows. The next most welcome aspect is that everything in the mini-bar is complimentary, refreshed daily during morning housekeeping. There is a thoughtful trove of stationery, and even an in-room printer and a supply of paper. The secret delight is the generously-sized bathroom with glass-enclosed shower, deep soak tub (with a mirror that turns into a TV at the flick of a switch), huge mirrors, ambient lightning, and Leonard toiletries. It’s amazing to have such a well-designed and spacious bathroom in Hong Kong where hotel rooms are notoriously small. The facility I personally utilized the most was the gym, which faced the pool and featured a good selection of TechnoGym equipment in a spacious, high-ceiling environment that allowed in lots of natural light during the day. Fitness buffs will not have much to complain here. The business center is on the 28th floor, but with free WiFi for hotel guests and in-room printers to boot, one would hardly need to make use of this facility. The final amenity to note is a room on the 9th floor (same level as the fitness center, pool, and spa) called Timeless. Featuring leather lean-back chairs and an array of beverages, fruits, and magazine, this is the sanctuary for guests who check-in before their room is ready or prefer to wait at the hotel before heading to the airport for their late flight. A word of caution: the chairs look more comfortable than they actually are once you settle into them. All said, I think Hotel ICON has the promise of an icon in-the-making.

Reviews.Title: “Spice up your stay in HKG with a real enchanting hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterPatItalia
Reviews.Content: When you arrive from the airport, immediately you feel a special welcome feeling: Jacky and Grace are welcoming you in the best friendly manner never had...They are really interested to make the best for you! The hotel is really beautiful, smart and with a special taste...here all has personality! Great the color inspired by the green alabaster. Magnificent the vertical gardens having the same alabaster striking, it's seems a masterpiece of "buon gusto". The rooms are amazing...very modern but warm and cosy, with all the best technology devices. One of our rooms was an icon 65...a real paradise for style, design and amenities. The bathroom is a dream, all it's perfect, also a nespresso machine is welcoming you with 3 different coffee blend...mmm unforgettable. At the club, above and beyond...great cocktails and frech cheese and the brekfast is a poem..eggs benedict made as you were dreaming from a long time...and a muesli with fresh blueberry .. All is perfect, all is very tidy and clean, all it's made with good mix heart and mind... The view is superb. The swimming pool it's nice but really great the gym with the best tapis rulant by tecnogym. All the staff is attentive and so helpful but Jacky...he is really, really so smart! Thank you! The food is delicious at the Green and at the Market...we are looking forward to go back there next week... We spent 4 marvellous days during our anniversary...and our son was with us too. Great place for elder and youth... Go there, and let's me know....I'm sure you will be satisfied 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, stylish, excellent service, a must”
Reviews.Author: Liz141166
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It is owned by the polytechnic and is a teaching and research facility for their hotel management course. This sounds odd but it is brand new, designed by Terrance Conran, with great harbour views. We had a club 38 harbour view room on the 26th floor. Huge bed facing wall entirely of window over the harbour. An amazing view! The executive lounge offers soft drinks all day, afternoon tea cakes and a free bar (including champagne and cocktails) from 6 till 8, with substantial snacks. Breakfast also great. Food could not be better. Cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Club Class is Good, with thoughtful touches”
Reviews.Author: patriciaTasmania
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Icon in early September, & found it very good value at the Club level. Situated on the 28th floor, giving all a spectacular view over the bustling harbour, The Peak & Hong Kong. The room had a lovely feel to it, with large chairs arrange in such a way that you weren’t cramped in with other guests & bookshelves with a few ornaments & books a few years old, giving the whole room a homely warmth. The attention from Nick, the Club manager & staff was very profesional & friendly. Breakfast was served in the al carte restaurant ajacent to the club lounge room. A good selection, for those wanting a continental breakfast, was available. There was also a small, but adequate, a la carte menu offered, with staff taking your order, & the meal served to you. We were greeted at the front desk by an inexperienced receptionist, who, it appeared, couldn’t seem to locate our booking, made several months earlier with Booking.Com All was resolved very quickly, with appologies by a more senior receptionist. As we had arrived at 9 a.m. , we did not expect the room to be ready for us, but was offered access to the 9th floor where we could utilise the small lounge facilities, with tea/coffee etc. This floor level also has a swimming pool & showers. The shower was something else with water spraying from both sides as well as above, wonderfull after a 13 hour flight. The bedroom, on the 25th floor was clean and spacious, with king size bed, large bathroom, a no charge mini bar and great little coffee machine. The only thing missing was a lounge chair, ( there was one, but 2 would have been nice) The bathroom was supplied with everthing one needed, if it wasn’t, all you had to do was ask. (nail varnish remover) Overall we had no complaints and would return again, only hope they can keep their rates competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: john_tillett
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the Hotel ICON during its soft opening in early July in a Club 36 Harbour View Room. This was the best hotel experience of my life. The room was amazing, from the view of Hong Kong Island, to the extremely comfortable bed and stylish fittings. It was also extremely large- a Club 38 room must feel truly spacious. The service was consistently impressive. The check-in was seamless and professional, and the staff seemed legitimately interested in making sure they knew how to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The Concierge service was accurate and helpful, although I only used it once to purchase tickets to an English language movie. The free mini bar was freshly stocked every day, the cleaning service was always impeccable, and the laundry was quick and well priced. Otherwise, the hotel facilities are fantastic. The view from the pool is incredible, as is the fitness centre. It was just disappointing that the pool closed at 10pm, because you could soak in it for hours. The included breakfast is also of a particularly high quality. Finally, I highly recommend getting a club level room. The nightly cocktail hour(s) in the Above and Beyond Bar were fantastic, it has an amazing view, and the bar staff were personal, and would make anything you wanted to taste (free of charge). Although the Above and Beyond breakfast wasn't as good as in the main restaurant, it was easy and efficient. A friend visited me while I was staying at the hotel, and said, quite simply, she couldn't believe that I was getting something so impressive for less than three hundred Australian dollars. Neither could I.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in my favourite city”
Reviews.Author: tigerstu
Reviews.Content: I come through Hong Kong quite often... sometimes I stay with friends, sometimes in cheap hotels and sometimes I splurg a little. On a recent trip I wanted to stay somewhere really nice and experience a bit of luxury. After a bit of searching I found Hotel Icon which has only been open from early 2011. At first glance I thought it would be beyond my price range, but after checking the dates and rates, it wasn't that bad. It might be out of some peoples price range, but I think for what you get in the hotel it is well worth it. Location: In Kowloon, near the HK Museum and Museum of Science. It is really only a 5-10 minute walk to East Tsim Sha Tsau mtr station and another 5-10 to TST station and Nathan Road. Around the hotel there are lots of restaurants, shops and cafes (the BBQ place across the road is pretty good and cheap lunch specials). Only a 10 minute walk to bars around Hanoi Road or Knutsford Terrace. I loved the free shuttle bus to Kowloon Station, as I go there for the cinema, shopping and to eat. It is actually a free airport shuttle bus, but we used it a few times. The hotel also has another shuttle bus to take you closer to the mtr... so walk or be lazy, but it really isnt that far from anything. Hotel: The design and decoration of this hotel I love. Quite modern and funky, but not loud or garish. The foyer and cafe on the ground floor is AMAZING. The whole back wall is alive with plants... a vertical garden (I wonder how they water it??)). Rooms: I have stayed here twice now... first time in the Icon Harbour View Room. What I wanted and what I love is you get a view of Hong Kong island and the harbour. People like staying on HK Island, but the best view is of HK island. The rooms are not huge, but not tiny either... which is very normal for HK. Bathroom is big, awesome shower and bath too. Beds are really comfortable and twin beds are quite big too. Free mini bar (no alcohol though), big LCD TV and great blinds/curtains which block out the sun when you sleep in. The second time I stayed was in the Club Harbour View Room. More expensive, but a few more amenities in the room (ipod dock and speakers, printer, nespresso machine and private check in ) and you get free access to the top floor cafe/bar. Free breakfast, free coffee/drinks all day, afternoon tea and the best bit... free cocktails and tapas in the evening. Service: Amazing. Very attentive, from the guys at the door, to reception, to the guys collecting your bags... they have staff in the foyer to ask if you need help, or taxi or anything when you come down to the foyer. More: The pool is awesome... the best views of HK island, even when you are in the pool swimming. Gets a bit hot up there though and not any plants or anything to help this out... but chairs and umbrellas. The gym is there too... looks pretty good. Inside there is a sauna and big change rooms with lockers. All in all... I love this place and if I want to stay somewhere really nice and not an old school 5 star hotel (which there are sooo many), this is where I will always come now.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a great price”
Reviews.Author: 123Phil
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there twice, on overnight stopovers in Hkg. We were getting concession rates of about $US 200/night, which is more than we usually pay for stopover accommodation but it was well worth that little extra. The room was beautifully appointed, luxurious bathroom with high quality toiletries, lovely fluffy robes to wear to the pool, free minibar (softdrinks and snacks), excellent tea/coffee and even a set of bathroom scales for weight conscious. Wi-Fi was included, breakfast was not. Service was good. One small niggle. On our second stay we arrived at about 7 am from an early incoming flight. Not unexpectedly, they were unable to give us a room, pleading there was nothing available. However their first response was an unhelpful "room occupancy does not start until 2 pm", (not the response to encourage a couple of tired, overnight travellers). A more experienced front desker quicky changed that to "we will be happy to accommodate you as soon as something becomes available". We then wandered Kowloon for an hour or two seeking a hot noodle breakfast (the Icon coffe shop was open but we wanted something more Asian) but found no room available at 10 am. We asked if we could use the pool area to wait, and were graciously given a pass card and sent up to the 9th floor. We had no sooner settled around the pool when the pool attendant suggested we go to the very comfortable, air-conditioned "guest" lounge on the same floor, equipped with expresso coffee/ tea/magazines, comfortable chairs, a very pleasant place to while away an hour or two until we were ushered to our rooms. I understand the hotel is a "training institute" and at 200/night, with trainee staff this is marginally acceptable. However we should have been offered the guest lounge on early arrival, rather than allowed to wander the rainy streets at 7 am. At full rates of 500+ per night I would have stormed out to a more welcoming reception.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Unsatisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: MoiseCheung
Reviews.Content: As a Asia Pacific Regional Hotel Controller several years, I have been staying in more than 100 hotels. Hotel ICON, Hong Kong is the most horrible and unreasonable one. Besides defame my reputation in hotel business, it also caused my health status much worse. I was invited by Mr Richard Hatter, the General Manager to stay at their suite through email in the end of May 2011. My wife and I checked into the hotel on 2 June 2011 with an original plan to stay for two nights. Unfortunately, I was suffering from health issues and I immediately informed the management of the hotel that I would like to extend my stay to 21 June 2011 after checking in and the management agreed. During my stay, I had pointed out to the management the inadequacies of the hotel through emails. Mr Alvin Yim, the Front Office Manager and Ms Susana Frok, the Director of Rooms had admitted their knowledge about the problems but no improvement had been made. They tried to offer 3 nights complimentary stay to comfort me but it was rejected by me. I had changed rooms four times because of the sub-standard service rendered by the hotel. The problems that I had encountered included but not limited to the following: The hot water system was not working properly which made it not suitable for bathing. Because of this problem, I had to change the Room 2009 to Room 2011 at midnight despite I was indisposed. Whilst I was staying in Room 2011, the lights flashed continuously and I had to change rooms again back to Room 2009. I had complained again to the hotel on 18 June 2011 that the hotel breakfast service was not up to standard. My complaint had never been addressed and there was no improvement in the breakfast service. At about 8:15pm on 18 June 2011, my wife went back to the room to get the medicine for me but found that the key card had been de-activated. At the same time, Mr Alvin Yim of the hotel asked me to go to the conference room on 28th floor and told me to check out immediately. I requested to stay for one more night and leave the next day because I had an important meeting at 8:30pm and I was not feeling well. Mr Yim refused discourteously alleging that I was behaving inappropriately during the stay. The allegation made by the hotel was totally untrue and defamatory in nature. At the time when Mr Yim wanted to expel me and my wife, he knew full well about my health condition and the check-out date would be 21 June 2011. After checking out from Hotel ICON, I urgently checked into the Island Shangri-La Hotel at 00:39am on 19 June 2011. Due to the unpleasant and poor service at Hotel ICON, it caused my health to deteriorate and I had to check into the Sanatorium Hospital several times and saw the specialists after 18 June 2011. From 2 June 2011 to 18 June 2011, I had settled at a total cost of HK$37,615.50. However, my stay in this hotel was totally unsatisfactory because of the sub-standard service rendered by this hotel. I had changed rooms four times for various reasons and this hotel was negligent and had failed to exercise reasonable care and skill in performing their service to me. After I rejected their offer of complimentary stay for 3 nights, the management decided to expel me and my wife. I was wrongly accused of poor behaviour during my stay at the hotel which amounts to defamation.

Reviews.Title: “Birthing pains but great potential”
Reviews.Author: JuliaVanderbilt
Reviews.Content: The hotel concept is based mainly on design--sleek lines, vertical gardens, cutting-edge technology. But as with any new hotel--the Icon has it's share of birthing pains that make it not quite there yet, in as far as hotel excellence is concerned. Arrival via Airport Express bus was smooth, a doorman ready to swing open the rather narrow door. As I had booked a club room, I was directed to the special reception on the 28th floor. I will have to note that the greeting at the main floor was cursory at best, unwelcoming and uninspired if I were to be truly honest. I wish I could say reception on the club floor improved, but that wasn't really much the case. As I was shown to my room, I turned on the television and here came the first major snafu. The technology on their televisions is so new, no one could remove an irksome, running blurb from the manufacturers on the screen--an hour later, two visits from engineering and housekeeping--and I finally had to ask for a change of rooms. The rooms are spacious by HK standards--clean, modern lines, new furniture, excellent linens. The toiletries are not the finest, but they were sufficient. And the design, especially of the bathroom, was interesting and esoteric, if not very inspired. A curving door closed it in, and an eye-shaped shower stall with rainshowers completed the modish style. The bath tub was smaller in design and yes, there was the charming television adjacent to it. The club floor was small and given the high volume of guests during my stay--was not in the least bit inviting. It was crowded, busy and not very well manned. I would think it would be more enticing if there were less people as all tables, whether lounges or bar stools, were always full. The same can be said about the pool--great view, excellent design but really quite small and congested with people. I think the staff has yet to learn when loungers have been vacated--and in fear of removing someone's reservation--most loungers linger all day with strewn towels but nary a guest. I tried venturing a swim at 630 am, but even then, two other swimmers had the same idea and we all had to share our laps with in arm's reach. The gym is fairly complete and is in a sun-dappled room facing the enticing harbor. An excellent hotel gym by all regards. The shuttle to shopping areas is a great idea--unfortunately it can only make drop-offs and isn't prepared for pick-ups. A shame, considering it can take considerable time and sweating in HK humidity to walk back from, say, Ocean City. Breakfast was varied, interesting and good value. All the western staples with some Asian offerings, including Singaporean and Indian. Service here was at it's best. The most unfortunate thing about this hotel perhaps is the fact that rooms were not entirely soundproof. My next door neighbors were a group of teenagers and enjoyed themselves immensely playing loud music and screeching to their heart's content. Would I return? HK always has interesting choices on the page as far as hotels are concerned. The design element here, sorely the primary pull of the hotel, felt charmless and un-involving. The staff are either too young or too busy to do their jobs right. And like most thing modish and new--Icon is interesting to look at, but rather empty at the core.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moremusicbuzz
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has thought of everything! We stayed for three nights on level 27 in one of the Club rooms and were extremely happy with our choice. Bathroom was fully equiped, good beds, free non alcohol mini bar,discounted same-day laundry service, turn down service with tea or hot drink option, welcome gift and afternoon tea and evening canapes and cocktails in the Club Lounge one floor up. There is a free local shuttle bus to drop you at nearby places in Kowloon and hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The only down side, if there is one is that our room was directly below the wooden floors of the 28th level lounge so even a simple movement of a chair could be heard from about 6am when breakfast started. This could easily be fixed if the hotel attached felt or small isolation buttons to the bottom of the chair legs....problem solved! All in all, highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: KMC022
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel, walking distance to Nathan Road. Staff fantastic go overboard to please and assist. We stayed in a club room. Worth the extra - room amazing, view from the 28th floor club lounge awesome and a great choice of drinks, food selection small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in HK for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: mumbai_masala
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Icon from the 31st of August,2011. Harbor view Twin room on the 16th floor. The hotel room ,stay and service were top of the class, more so considering the price we paid ( only around HKD 6500 total). The room had a great view of the Harbor and the mirrors next to the windows enhance the experience even further. Comfy twin beds , a nice LCD TV and free wireless. The free minibar was also a very nice touch,as was the rain shower in the bathroom.! Hung Hom station is only 5 minutes away and the walk to the Tsuen Wan line at TST takes about 10-15 minutes walk from the hotel. There are a plenty of restaurants in the hotel neighborhood also. The airport express shuttle also stops at the hotel. In all, it was a 5 star experience. After a long day out exploring HK , this is the perfect place to come back to in the evening. Definitely recommended and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing new hotel, best in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: I booked on line, and got the best rate, Check was slick and smooth as they escorted me to the check in lounge. The rooms are modern with amazing views over to Hong Kong. All the mod cons, plus more, including wifi, and cool IP phones that you can use around the hotel. All in all this hotel is setting the standard of what hotels should be. Well done I will be back very soon to stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaaust
Reviews.Content: We had a great four nights in Hotel Icon. Being a new hotel the room was extremely clean and fresh and had a great view (room 2116) across to Hong Kong central. We made use of the spa (good value massage/facials) and pool (nice pool, not such a great view of the rooftop next door) and the buffet breakfast was extensive. The hotel was comprehensively staffed with with very helpful employees - particularly on the front and concierge desk. If I was to try hard, the only downside would be that the location is at the end of the hotel strip however we had absolutely no trouble walking everywhere we needed to go. It is also worth noting that the hotel provides a regular shuttle bus service which can take you to the main shopping strip locations if you can't be bothered walking. The shuttle bus for the airport express also stops right in front of the hotel. Overall we had a excellent stay and considered Hotel Icon to be one of the best value hotels we have stayed in. We would highly recommend it to anybody visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully designed room, Breathtaking view of the HK harbor,and excellent restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Zudoco
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently during the hotel's promotion period on a club floor with great view of the HK side of the harbor, room is beautifully designed, spacious and well equipped. Great breakfast buffet and wonderful restaurant Above and Beyond on the top floor. The gym and pool is good sized and well equipped. Staff are friendly and generally courteous as the hotel is run by HK polytechnic university. Only criticism is that as a hotel affiliated with hospitality training institute, there is not a single place where the hotel ask for feedback or suggestions from the hotel patrons. Some of the staff are obviously under training and can really use more service user feedback to help them further develop. But overall it is an excellent facility with many nice artistic touches, definitely has 5 star potential.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is VERY good especially for the price of the "soft opening"”
Reviews.Author: jaskkk
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at "Icon" after reading many positive reviews here. The only doubt was that its location is rather far from Nathan Road and central Tsim Sha Tsui. Though the hotel has its shuttle bus running almost every 30 min to central TST. And also I must say that Nathan Road is easily accessed by foot within 15-20 min walk. Taxis in HK are quite cheap and there are plenty of them around the hotel. As almost everyone says here, this hotel is ULTRA modern with almost all amenities the guest may require. We stayed in CLUB room on 23rd floor with Harbour view. Club room is the same size as the ordinary one, but has some privileges: evening cocktails at Above & Beyond lounge, free minibar (though with rather small choice), Nespresso coffee-machine inside the room. Also I should say that Club Rooms are from 23rd to 27th floor, while ordinary ones ("Icon rooms") are below 23rd floor. Rooms are not that big as I thought after reading reviews here, but of normal size for Hong Kong. Living space is not big, but bathroom is spacious, and there's even TV over bathtub if someone likes it. Evening cocktails were very good option, though the quality of cocktails differed from day to day. Breakfast on the 2nd floor was EXCELLENT with very big choice of meals. Breakfast on the 28th floor has less choices, but has the view on the harbour. :) Hotel staff is very attentive to guest's requests, and this is good. Visit the swimming pool at least once (open to ALL hotel guests). It is on the open terrace on the 9th floor and has fantastic views, especially at night! There are still some construction works within the hotel which may bother someone whos's living nearby. Also I should mention that you may wait for the lift (evevator) for a very long time, especially at breakfast time on the weekend. Overall I think that this hotel is a very good choice if you don't have to visit HK island every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service.”
Reviews.Author: superchickridesagain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days for a stopover on my way home from a European trip. I booked a club room for the extra perks, and while it was quite expensive - the whole stay was chock full of value and a super place to wind down after constant travel. The minibar was free (no alcohol, though!), and a Nespresso machine was provided for decent coffee, the room was spacious and comfortable with tremendous views over the harbour, the bathroom was lovely with a separate bath and an insanely big shower, and a toiletries bag with heaps of extras on top of the usuals. Breakfast was included and was served on the top floor (menu and small buffet), so you can watch boats on the harbour while eating. A free afternoon tea was supplied there too, but I was too busy sightseeing to try it, and free cocktails and canapes were served from 6pm - 8pm which I definitely did get to try! Room service was quick and the food was really good, but I'd recommend just eating out in Hong Kong for great cheap tasty food. I was impressed that the night doorman didn't bat an eyelid when I stumbled through the doors at 4am, a bit the worse for wear. Everything is brand spanking new and very clean, and the pool is just big enough to do laps in - which I loved - but wished it was a little bit bigger. My one criticism was the staff could be a little bit overly attentive, but I would put that down to them being young and eager to please. Understandable when you realise the staff are part of a hospitality college providing on the job training. Overall, if I had enough spare cash, I would stay here again. The architecture in the lobby alone is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, loving it”
Reviews.Author: ArvinLee
Reviews.Content: I am not even checked out yet frm d hotel. Yet I feel so compelled to write this review. I've stayed in so many hotels, and icon hotel easily on the top of my list. Checked in was a breeze, no hassle, done within 5 minutes Room : clean, minimalist, great amenities, fre minibar, and chocolate . Comfy bed and pillows Bathroom: great pressure on the shower, nicely designed. Staffs were friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. Swimming pool and d gym: amazing few, pool were a but small, but get d exercise done I have nothing negative to say about d hotel. Oh well one little thing a bit far frm d MTr. At least it gives me my daily exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but still can be better”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: We have used a special offer during the soft opening. First I have to say, that the value for money is really good. We have booked the club room, but were upgraded for suite. Harbor view suite is very modern with a great design and view. Breakfast is excellent as well as dinner at the restaurant on the 28th floor. Pool is good with a nice view. But there are some things that should be noticed: Contras: Hotel is pretty far away from the MTR station. It means for you that you have either to work or take a taxi. Working 15-20 minutes in Hong Kong summer time is everything else but pleasant. It is hot and humid, so after 5 minutes you fill like you have used the sauna. Taxi is also pretty a troublesome option, since hotel is new one and not every taxi driver knows how to find it. So if you choose a taxi you would better take a local map with a hotel on it, to show the driver the right location. Cleaning could be better. Actually they have not cleaned the floor at all. We have booked the club floor, so we have used the lounge. The quality of food is good, but choice is limited. If you have stayed at Langham Place the difference will be not in favor of Icon. Despite all this, the value that hotel offers for this money is great. I am pretty often in HK and have seen a lot of hotels. This is one of the few valuable. The question is what they will do after the soft opening. But now I advise this hotel to anyone. You will not regret.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the high praise”
Reviews.Author: KJT74
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few nights stopover in Hong along, staying at Hotel Icon. I booked it after reading the great review on here, making use of the soft opening 'buy 2 nights get one free' offer to book myself a club 36 harbor view room. The hotel lived up to all the reviews and I would recommend it to anyone. It's the little touches that make the difference - the personal check-in on the club level was nice, but being shown the room amenities was great, especially when the member of staff showed me they had already provided me with an Australian adaptor, which came in very handy. The free mini-bar (soft drinks) was superb and always replenished every day, along with M&Ms and coffee pods. In fact, one evening I had a pack of M&Ms before going out and when I returned they had been restocked - this is because housekeeping had been back in to fill up my ice bucket for me. Like I said, it's the little touches that really do go above and beyond and that are remembered. The free breakfast allowed me to eat in either the club lounge or in the buffet restaurant on level 2. The first morning I used the club lounge and the service was excellent, but I had to choose from a limited hot food menu - I'm not an egg fan, so there wasn't much choice for me. There is a semi-buffet in the lounge for cold food as well. The next two mornings I used the buffet restaurant, which was also great. A good variety of food (western and Asian), both hot and cold and the staff were very attentive - I even got a 'welcome back' from one staff member on my 2nd day eating there. The club lounge provides cocktails between 6 & 8pm every night, though I didn't have time to make use of it so can't comment. It also provides afternoon tea and I had this on my last day (you can use the club lounge after checkout while waiting to go to the airport). Although there was no much provided, it was lovely and again staff were attentive in replenishing drinks (free soft drinks all the time in the lounge). Every time I walked through the lobby the staff would say hello, wish me a good day or night, etc. and they were a joy to chat to. I know a lot of the staff are students at the polytechnic, but they were more professional than the staff in some top class hotels I have visited. All in all, it's a fabulous hotel and I would recommend it to anyone. This will be my number one choice for any future Hong Kong visits and the club level is worth it (free minibar and wifi are provided in all rooms, but the lounge, $100 per day laundry allowance and other 'perks' plus the view make it a must for me).

Reviews.Title: “A TRULY WONDERFUL STAY AT THE HOTEL ICON, HONG KONG”
Reviews.Author: Vikram S
Reviews.Content: A truly wonderful service and stay at the hotel during August, including a fantastic tour of the 28th floor followed by dinner and drinks in the Above & Beyond lounge. The staff were extremely polite, efficient, attentive towards us throughout and overall, a very noticeable improvement on the efficiency of the hotel compared to our stay in June. The rooms allocated to us were identical to last time and were enjoyed to the highest level offering us maximum comfort in line with our busy daily schedules. We would also like to put forward a special thank you to Van Poon Ching Wan, Benny Chan, Nick Tam and Raymond Hou, whom we dealt with on a daily basis in the evenings, receiving nothing but the best care and attention possible. We hope to return towards the end of October and look forward to another great stay. A very “BIG” thank you to all staff for a truly wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way....Above and beyond is exactly that!”
Reviews.Author: Blackerbrinkworth
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that Hotel Icon was everything we could wish for! From the moment we checked in we were treated like royalty. We had a club 36 harbour view room and all staff from above and beyond were outstanding, particulary Raymond who we could not thank enough. Views from our room on 23rd floor were stunning and we loved the little luxuries in our room...mini bar restocked throughout the day with soft drinks, mnms!!! Breakfast in the Market was very varied and breakfast in the club lounge was beautifully cooked. We made the most of the complimentary afternoon tea and cocktails from 6-8pm...both had food of excellent quality and the cocktails were fantastic and a good selection to choose from. All in all a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: ringo_nz
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. We had 'above and beyond' club rooms and the hotel and staff certainly do go above and beyond other hotels. Everything is brand new, well-designed, comfortable and modern. Loved the rainforest showers. Loved the free mini-bar drinks and snacks (although soft drinks only). Loved how you can use the club lounge or timeless lounge to relax after checkout if you have a late flight, they even let us have the free afternoon tea in the club lounge on check out day. The club lounge is a great place to relax and watch HK light-up in the evening with free canapés and cocktails. Occasionally service was slow to re-fill the drinks (but always very friendly), then again on other nights we never had empty glasses as service was so fast! The club lounge also serves free soft drinks all day, free afternoon tea and free breakfast so it was great value. The pool area is good and also has amazing views over HK island. They are still in their 'soft opening' phase so we got great value 'pay for 2 nights and stay for 3' deals - although everything was open and functioning so this phase surely can't last much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but could have been even better (although it was really good!)”
Reviews.Author: 260mike
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, our stay was fantastic...and the hotel is absolutely beautiful.
