The star is extremely friendly, especially a greater / doorman / bell hop / concierge named Angus (thanks for e verything Angus!). The roms are on the smaller side, but the design and use of space is phenomonal...truly impressive. The pol area is spectacular with a great view, the for offered is fantastic. Everything really great. Our only complaints were regarding the check out and a minor problem experienced with the room our last night. The key card reader broke and we were unable to enter. While the problem was handled with efficiency and quickness, I feel the appropriate course of action should have been some type of compensation (glass / bottle of wine, etc.). Also, the morning of check out, I made it very clear that we were taking the shuttle to kowlon station for the airport train, but when the shuttle came and went no one stopped it..while not a a big deal - another shuttle came along in 10 / 15 minutes - it would have been nice to have been offered at least a complimentary coffee (I had just purchased one). Regardless, fantastic hotel and staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 stars hotel with 6 stars service ( front desk concierge & timeless lounge)”
Reviews.Author: Chingp
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 28 July ard 6am. Unfortunately no twin deluxe available at the time when we arrived. So we were told to come back at 1pm, we were so tired and decided to stay at timeless lounge to rest till we get the room. We were so impress with the service at timeless lounge, after I came out from shower I saw my friend slept so well n he was cover with 2 big towels supplied by hotel staff as it was very cold in there.. I was sleeping after 5 mins when I sat on the arm chair.. It was very cold n agn the hotel staff suddenly came in to gv me a big towel, he was so warm n considerate for hotel guests! This is already mark 100% before I even check into my room! After first day of check in to our room, the room was fantastic especially the most comfy bed that I ever slept!! I never ever slept so well in any other hotels when I travel! We both loved the toilet, the massage shower was really great after a long day shopping! The toiletry pouch in the wash room was convenient when u r going to ocean park or pool. There is few feedback; The bathroom glass wall should hv some kind of sticker with design to prevent kids or old folks hit on to the glass everytime go into the toilet. I was there 4 nites but I was hit by the glass 3 times becos I can't see there is glasswall when I walk in. Housekeeping; The 2nd day we were in the hurry to go out, my room mate actually forgot to hang up n drop his set of sleeping clothes on the chair; when we came bck that nite, the sleeping clothes was squeeze like a ball n throw at corner of chair! We were very disappointed wth the housekeeping lady!! We stay at level 12 anyway. N noticed the used glass n waste paper was not clear! N it was there throughout 4 nites as we want to see if she will clear the waste paper n glass, bt never happen! So I hv to take the glass n wash n threw the rubbish to the bin. Perhaps, house keeping only clear rubbish from the bin only..? Housekeepin need more training! Very unpleasant with clothes been throw at a corner! The concierge service was fantastic! The hotel rates is quite expensive although it is a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, coming back”
Reviews.Author: nadine7186338
Reviews.Content: brilliant brilliant brilliant. brilliant staff. brilliant location. brilliant rooms. brilliant view. and i've stayed in many 5 star hotels globally. this hotel is the best so far ..........

Reviews.Title: “Great in-room technology”
Reviews.Author: Chio606
Reviews.Content: The rooms are of standard size but with panoramic views of Hong Kong, i was being escorted to the room for in-room check-in with remote pc which showed great conveniency and privacy. The in-room entertaintment system is also user friendly. There were also printer in my suite which can be connected to my notebook.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OZinNY
Reviews.Content: We had a harbour view room on the 27th floor. The room was not huge but very well decorated. We loved the oval-shaped shower enclosure with a rainfall showerhead. As we were on the Above and Beyond Club floor, we had access to free breakfasts on either the exclusive 28th floor or the Market restaurant on the 2nd floor. The service on the 28th floor was superb! The breakfast selection in the Market was outstanding. The staff were attentive and well-informed. The hotel's location in Kowloon was not the most convenient but was made up by the hotel's free shuttle bus to Tsim Sha Tsui, the Star ferry and Harbour City. All in all, a fantastic experience - we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The best place I have ever stayed at... simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jtwitchett
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for three nights last week taking advantage of the 3 nights for the price of 2 deal. We had a club 36 room on the 27th floor which was very nice indeed. We had the benefits of the above and beyond lounge and we especially liked the free cocktails between 6-8pm, the breakfast was also lovely with stunning views in the above and beyond lounge. The gym and pool are also excellent with awesome views over Hong Kong Island. The staff were very helpful and polite and our room cleaners were excellent. I loved my stay here and would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys modern hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great for tree hugging, design afficionado types”
Reviews.Author: Chris J
Reviews.Content: An enjoyable stay, great suite, tasty breakfast and great service, from the vertical green wall in the lobby to the beautifully designed suites, Hotel Icon, is a contender for excellent and most pleasant experience without breaking the bank. Would like to thank Ms. Joey Leung and "Above and Beyond" staff for the warm welcome and enthusiatic service during our stay. Hotel Icon part of the Polytechnic University of Hong Kong while the property is nearer to Hotel Nikko, Intercontinental Stamford, The Kowloon Shangri-la and the environs such as Granville's DNA galleria, Miramar Mall,etc.., an estimated approximately 10-15 min walk is required to access Nathan Road via Chatham Overpass or the MTR walkway. There is a scheduled bus service managed by the hotel to I-Square on Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotandwet
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with good location, price is reasonable. I like the room design. Overall is perfect but unfortunately, it takes me 3hours to get into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with potential”
Reviews.Author: yichiban
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ICON this past week during their soft opening. The hotel had a great deal for 3 nights for the price of 2 which was great. The hotel is fairly reasonably priced and nicely decorated with modern details. The rooms are spacious with a view of hong kong skyline and the victoria harbor. The staff was fairly helpful and the spa was nice. The only downside is the location which is a bit of an inconvenience. The nearest MTR station is a 10 min walk which isn't bad until you are exhausted from your day and your taxi ride from central hk to the hotel can go up to almost 200 hkd. Also, they had some kind of construction going on during our stay which sounded like they were drilling through our ceilings and it was unbearable. We couldn't wait to get out of there on our last day as our heads were about to explode. So check to make sure the construction is over before you give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Loved it, especially the staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Matt196962
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. New, clean beautiful rooms. Very modern and chic. We had a fantastic view from our room on 15th floor of Hong Kong, and were treated to the light show from our window!! Awesome!! Staff were especially nice and helpful. A special mention must go to Kelly Tsang in guest relations for taking time out to chat and make sure we were ok and happy, very nice to talk to her about various subjects!!! Sorry we didn't get to say goodbye to you Kelly!!!! And Holly Mok waitressing in the Market restaurant for looking after my Wife superbly while i had to go and spend some time making phone calls. Thanks to you Holly for the amusing chat and opening our bottles for us!!!!! ha ha!!! Thanks also to Alvin Lau. Had a great time and would recommend this Hotel to anyone and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “6 stars for service”
Reviews.Author: MisterPip
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay was too short. Our harbour view room was stunning, and not just for the view - bed, furnishings and bathroom were great and the free mini-bar was a nice touch. Throughout our stay the service was excellent - staff were attentive and knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble. Location-wise, the hotel was a brisk 10 - 15 min walk from the TST train station, which was a bit of a haul after a long day walking the streets, but the free shuttle from the hotel was a nice touch. Design throughout the hotel was easy on the eye - particularly the tiled gym/pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: VT2369
Reviews.Content: Staying here for my summer vacation. Being a loyal customer of Langham Place, I was attracted to this hotel by the overwhelming good reviews and the special rate. Here is the pros and cons of the hotel. For location, centrally located but not over crowded. Room size is good... But I only have one piece of luggage and I am here by myself, it's comfortable... Lighting... the lighting is really good in this hotel, a big plus for business people if you can't sleep at night and want to work... For long stay visitors, 2 weeks and above, Langham is better as there is a kitchenett for the suites. If you are a light sleeper like myself, Icon has better sound proof system unless you stay near the service station, then you hear the service wagon, open and close door...Smell control is also very good. No smoking smell at all in the room or the hallway. Hotel staff are really friend and helpful. Unlike other hotels, most staff here are bilingual, both English and Chinese. I also like the fact that it's not carpet on the floor, only area rug around the bed... Bathroom is spacious... The Above and Beyond club lounge in Icon is part of the Chinese restaurant, it could be noisy during the day and night time. I really like the Club lounge at Langham Place, it has better food, drinks and facilities. There are always sweets, fresh fruit, orange juice, tea and coffe and house wine at the club Lounge, more private and exclusive... Re service, during the past few stays, I could not find any faults of Langham place. Icon is a brand new hotel, I was impressed when I got my long stay questionnaire after my booking, but nothing was implemented when I arrived at 11:30p.m. after 8 hours long flight. It was 12:15 a.m. by the time the apologetic housekeeper changed all the beddings as I was allergic to feather, gave me the extra hangers. Then the pillows were too high and I had to ask for the small pillows on my questionnaire at 3 am. It needs better oversight on housekeeping... The Chinese restaurant on the top floor is good, but need to increase the varieties of choices for both dim sum and main course. Selection is limited. However the quality of food is better as no MSG at all, which is a big plus for me as I am allergic to MSG as well. It's nice not to take antihestimine after a meal. Also, if you stay at the club floor, there is a HK100 daily credit for dryclean and laundry, which is perfect for me. Overall, the hotel is very thoughtful and does its best to make guests feel comfortable... Free internet, free local calls, free snacks and mini bars... I can see myself coming back here in the fall if the rate is reasonable...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, terrific service and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: praks12
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hong Kong and chose the Icon on reviews and price. We stayed in a harbor view room and found it extremely comfortable with everything you could need, including bathrobe, slippers plus complimentary soft drinks,water and snacks. The view was great and we were able to watch the evening light show over the harbor and buildings from our room. The staff are also extremely helpful, friendly and provide great service. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: trombosit
Reviews.Content: The lobby, the room, and the pool were amazing. The staff is very helpful, everything looks and feels perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: elfseah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a party of 4 from Jul 7 - 11 and it was just awesome!! - taxi fare from airport is approx 250 HKD - Only 1 room was ready for checking in but this was quickly resolved with the 2nd room ready in 10min. - rooms are big and spacious for HK standards. excellent appointment. Trendy decor especially the toilet. - it's a new hotel so everything is spanking new, no wear and tear at all and the maintenance program seems quite robust. - location is good and near to most attractions. - this is a "Teaching" hotel. the hotel is owned by the university next door and they put their students here for on-the-job training, which is really - NOT a bad thing at all, since the staff exhibited a lot of energy and enthusiasm. I observed that this was probably only for more rank-n-file staff, the mangers i'm quite sure are professional staffers and not students. - pool and gym has excellent views but we did not have a chance to use it, pity. Summer Sale!! haha - rem to take a hotel card as the hotel is new and taxi drivers might not be familiar, we were brought to a wrong location one time during our stay. - lots of "cha chan teng" across the road, some open late and we packed a midnight snack there 1 night. - for this price, and the service and product we received = we could not have asked for more. Will definitely be back!! cheers!

Reviews.Title: “A REFRESHING EXPERIENCE FOR HONG KONG”
Reviews.Author: yingchua
Reviews.Content: It was only their 1st week when we checked in; the hotel lobby is modern and yet warm in design with the wood and vertical landscape wall; the staffs are well trained and friendly. Room is spacious for Hong Kong standard with large bed, a lazy chair and well equipped bath; and great harbour view; we were given a lovely cheese cake for my husband's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel ...worth trying”
Reviews.Author: brick_one
Reviews.Content: We booked utilising the 'soft' opening offer of 3 days for the price of 2 to allow use of the room to accommodate our late flight departure from HK on the third day - with that in mind the Icon presented reasonable value for money in what is generally an expensive market. First things first; Check-in didn't set a good mood, apparently our web booking had only been made for one person and therefore we were 'surcharged' for having a 2nd person in the room. Whilst technically correct I must admit I didn't notice that online and when booking a double room my expectation is that it will accommodate 2 persons and we were not using the third days's breakfast as we were checking out the night before ..the value was looking a lit less. On reaching the room the air-conditioning vent had fallen from the ceiling, the promised welcome letter wasn't there and the bags took ages to arrive....nothing that couldn't be fixed but 'niggles' which detract from the customer experience. Harbour view rooms are good with great city views. Non-alcoholic bar items are free and there is good coffee in an Nespresso machine. Bathrooms are excellent as are the toileteries. The hotel location is a 15 minute walk from the MTR, and about 20 minutes from the Star Ferry - in humid Hong Kong this can be an issue though there are taxis and the Airport Express bus does connect to Kowloon station so options abound. Hotel facilites are good. The garden wall is impressive and gives a great ambience. Gym has great views, reasonably equipped and the pool is excellent. Though during our trip was not accessible as they seem very sensitive about 'lightning risk' when the weather is stormy and they close the pool. Breakfast on the top floor was included and is adequate, though some very simple mistakes again impact the experience e.g. one 4 slice toaster for a whole room?. Also on day 2 we were refused access as they were 'full' and re-directed to the main dining room on the 2nd floor. To be honest the breakfast food range there is better but this seemed to be a ploy to move people as the breakfast time neared an end (we arrived at the top floor at 9.45am when breakfast closed at 10am) The evening buffet was great value with fantastic food - it get's very busy so book and get there early. Bar staff in the lobby were great and service very good. In fact all the staff try very hard and are very welcoming which does make this hotel a pleasure. Overall this is a great hotel but it has lots of competition eg new Hyatt Regency nearby and after their 'soft' opening it will be interesting to see if they retain their value.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the place to stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: gnaix
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel which I have chosen to stay in after reading all the positive reviews. Although I had very high expectations from all the reviews, Hotel Icon still exceeded my expectations in every aspect, esp in terms of service. Facilities wise, everything is ultra modern and very clean. Although the room was not considered big compared to other parts of the world, it was very spacious by HK standards. The room was very well equipped - from basic amenities to refreshing and high tech gadgets. The free mini bar was definitely a plus compared to many other 5 star hotels. In terms of location, it is very conveniently located and about 10 to 15 mins walk to the TST MTR. Although I was travelling by taxi mostly, I did tried the free hotel shuttle which was very prompt and the driver was even nice enough to drop off some guests at specific location (nearby) other than the designated stops. However, what actually struck out most about the hotel is the staff. They were all very young and energetic, giving a vibrant feel to the whole hotel. I was greeted with smiles everywhere I go in the hotel and everyone was very sincere in helping with everything that I needed. It definitely made me felt very much at home during the entire stay. Hotel Icon is definitely one of the best stay I've had in any hotel and I will definitely choose to stay there again when i revisit HK. I highly recommend the hotel, regardless if you are traveling for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: Agulnik
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor and was happy every day of my 7 day stay. The hotel is new and everything is on par. Check in - check out was smooth, I recommend staying on the higher floors as there is a separate reception, complimentary internet and great view of the harbour. The location is great, service is exceptional - staff is always happy to assist. I even got a phonecall whilst in the room saying that my front door was not completely closed and asking if everything was alright. ) The pool is very good for an afternoons swim, the fitness room, sauna and SPA were great. The hotel restaurant was also excellent, good choice of food and very good service. I would definitely come back to this place again, I really hope the hotel keeps up the high standarts that it has set. Oh almost forgot - the lobby has a live garden on the wall!!! With flowers grass and everything, its on the wall and it is live )))) Great work. And last but not least - definitely go for the cupcakes in the lobby bar, they are exceprional!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Icon exemplifies the Above and Beyond theme!!”
Reviews.Author: Hevsta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the absolute pleasure of being guests at the Hotel Icon from July 14 through July 19. I have never written a Trip Advisor review before, but I felt I needed to share my experience. First, we were greeted at the door by Edith, who took us to our room, checked us in, and explained all the amenities of the facility. She was extremely professional and knowledgeable. We stayed in a Above and Beyond Club room on the 25th floor. We had sweeping views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The room was quite large considering the the fact we were in a huge city. The bathroom provided plenty of space, especially the shower, which had a rain shower feature. The mini bar is complimentary and refilled each day. Once we were settled, our doorbell rang. A bottle of wine was delivered and a card signed by the staff wishing us a Happy Anniversary. We were celebrating our 7th. We decided to make reservations for dinner. We went to the concierge desk and spoke to Cody, who made the reservation. When we arrived at the restaurant, our first round of drinks were paid by the Hotel. I though that was a very nice gesture. We frequented the concierge desk often for recommendations and travel plans. A young lady who was extremely helpful was Kit. She helped organize and plan our way around the city. Overall the Hotel Icon is a beautiful and modern hotel, but the service is the real reason why I am writing this review. If you are someone who enjoys impeccable service, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...made my whole trip great!”
Reviews.Author: shoppingfrog
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the service of this hotel from the moment I got there. I save my money and love to stay at great hotels, Hotel Icon is the the best one yet! This was my first trip to Hong Kong and the hotel staff was very helpful with maps, tips, and guides. Every question I asked was met with kindness and top quality answers. This is how celebrities must be treated, I felt VIP the whole time! The room was immaculate, the decor relaxing, clean, modern, zen. I was actually sad to check out and go home, I loved the hotel, my home away from home. I really enjoyed Hong Kong as well, and will plan another vacation there, and I would only consider staying here! The location is 2 minutes from the subway ( we took it every where), 2 USD cab fare from most things you want to see, and a 5 minute walk to great shopping, and really great variety of restaurants. The food at the hotel was delicious and plenty. I have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world, and I was so impressed with Hotel Icon, I encourage you to give it a try without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan H
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff, great facilities, well thought out and considered hotel, comfy beds, quiet room, superb food, great service,not just a satisfied customer but a FAN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cut the classical music in the lounge and I'll gladly give you 6 stars”
Reviews.Author: Vardomannen
Reviews.Content: Amazing design both on the exterior an the interior, and in a very convenient part of town, the Icon deserves to be an icon. A 10-minute walk will get you to the Avenue of the Stars, where luckily the turban-clad gang of "you-have-a-lucky-face" intimidators seem to have been removed. (long story, but ask anyone who has been the Avenue of the Stars prior to 2010, and they will be able to enlighten you), and from there on in, you are in the thick of Kowloon. Rooms are spacious, clean, well designed, clean, well equipped, clean, have comfortable beds and did I mention that they are clean? Stayed on the 25th floor with access to the "Above and Beyond" executive facilities. Ate breakfast there two days; you can order from a menu as well as eat from the buffet. On the second day the buffet became quite bare by 0940, and it didn't seem to be replenished until just before closing time at 1000 which seemed a bit odd. Breakfast downstairs was superb, both as regards to quality and choice. Didn't try the afternoon tea, but did try cocktail hour where there was an excellent choice. Which takes me to the classical music. There it was, ever present, slightly to dominating and loud, both at breakfast and in the evening. I actually found it a bit depressing, rather like being in Arkhangelsk on a cold, dark, rainy morning in November. I don't need or want cultural infusion at breakfast time - I need coffee. There seems to be noise everywhere in Hong Kong, so it would be interesting to know if other guests think it might be a good idea to cut out the enforced music at breakfast. Service is generally faultless. As I had a flight leaving at 0210, I paid for a late checkout at 6pm. this cost 50% of the usual room rate. The plan was to get some sleep during the afternoon, and take a shower before leaving. Despite the "Do not disturb" light being on, housekeeping rang (on the phone) at 4pm to say that they could not service my room because the do not disturb sign was on. Check the times: it was 4pm, and I was going to check out at 6pm, so i don't understand what they were going to achieve with a service at that time. Needless to say, I had been asleep for 10 minutes when they rang, and that was that. no more sleep. The shower didn't go too well either; there was no warm water, so my shower ended up being a wash in the sink. I hope a bit more experince will help them iron out these small problems, because they really do try hard and have really achieved a lot in the short space of time they have been open.

Reviews.Title: “My new choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Halesy07
Reviews.Content: First time I have stayed here. So new and fresh and the attantion to detail is amazing including free internet and free mini bar! (no alcohol). The gym and pool were suberb with views over the harbour. I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 but 10 star hotel! Perferct place to stay in HK!”
Reviews.Author: Choosy2011
Reviews.Content: The ambiance, the friendliness and hospitality of the staff, the location, the Hotel itself is modern, yet the people and staff are the ones making his hotel a true ICON. They have well trained and knowledgeable staff members that makes this hotel great. The location is close proximity to The Rosary Church and the room....hay.... Is heaven :) Super modern with touch of modern style and the king size bed is super comfy :) Plus with complimentary drinks in house, what else could you ask for? If you would like to stay in a 5 star hotel, this is the place to be... Hotel ICON in Hongkong. Oh and the view from the 21st floor is truly amazing... If i can just stay for another week, i will! So modern yet elegant. A must place to stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Jacqtan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Icon for 3 nights. Currently, the hotel is having a opening special where you stay for 2 nights and the 3rd night is free. We enjoyed our entire stay at the hotel, right from the time we checked in till we checked out. The staff were courteous, greeting us in the morning when we leave the hotel and in the evening when we returned to the hotel. When our hands are full of shopping stuff, the helpful staff would help us to press the lift buttons for us. As for the room, it is very clean and spacious considering the standard of Hong Kong hotels. The highlight of our stay was a birthday cake that was placed in our room the night before we checked out. Although my husband's birthday fell on the following day (the day we checked out), Hotel Icon was very thoughtful to place a cake in our room, complete with a candle. It even prepared a birthday card with signatures from the management staff. We will return to this hotel for our next visit and we probably consider getting the Club room to pamper ourselves after hearing the good comments from this website.

Reviews.Title: “A New Gem in HK”
Reviews.Author: tweenshopper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days with my husband and 2 kids almost 2 weeks ago. We stayed in a Club 36 room with Above and Beyond Club Privileges. It was a fantastic stay. Location-wise, the hotel is in the city but not actually in the center of the main shopping district. Hence, you have the privilege of being very near the place of action though not necessarily in the middle of it. Yes, you'd have to walk leisurely about 10-15 mins to get to the nearest mall or MRT station but at least, you get a little more peace and quiet and you don't have to deal with crowds and vendors bugging you as soon as you exit the hotel doors. Just be sure to take the hotel card (with the map) with you to show the taxi drivers as they may still not be too familiar with this newly opened hotel. The hotel itself is very new with ultra-modern and tastefully-designed decor and facilities so it is everything you'd expect from a 21st century hotel...simple but elegant, minimalist yet very artistic...and oh so immaculately clean. The view from our room was breath-taking. We had a partly city and partly harbour view, so we could see the best of both worlds from our 25th floor room. The room was quite spacious compared to HK standards, with hygienic and comfortable beds and pillows. The bathroom was unique and a statement in itself...with curved, transparent glass shower rooms drenched by a huge rainshower and a separate deep soaking tub. We also loved the daily semi-buffet breakfast and afternoon tea at the chic and relaxing Above and Beyond Lounge, which my kids really enjoyed. Finally, the friendly and very accomodating attitude of the staff capped this very pleasant and memorable experience. In summary, if you'd like an ideal combination of good location (at least close to the city center) + five-star ambiance + reasonable rates + clean and ultra-modern facilities + superb customer service, you will finally find it here at the Hotel ICON. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “New chic hotel with contemporary facilities. Worth a try.”
Reviews.Author: OhOhSe7en
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hong Kong more than half a dozen times. This time I decided to stay in Hotel Icon . Its a brand new hotel with good facilities located in a decent place.Not too close to MTR or shopping malls but still the location is good. The hotel is in soft launch phase though the spa alone remains to be opened yet. The hotel rooms have a Nice harbour view (harbour view option), swimming pool with a pleasing view which I liked. The harbour view is quite good due to the hotel's location. The hotel lobby is not grand like other 4-5 star hotels. But unique. It has a wall hanging garden. i.e. Plants on the vertical wall. The plants are real. Stunning combination of plants. However on the 3rd day I notice the plants were dry & were drooping which took away the splendour. The bed and the pillows were too good. Nice combination. The chair I felt was an imitation of the famed egg chair. Must say that the free wi-fi is a welcome option. Quite a few hotels (despite 5 star status) dont provide internet for free. Free mini bar (water, canned drink & buts) is a nice option. The best part of the hotel I think is the 'Timeless' lounge concept. People who check out but want to relax a while or if check in is delayed, this smart lounge could be used. With a nespresso machine & apples & snack bites this is one of the nicest aspects I have ever come across in a star hotel. Very good dining options. There are three options.There is a Chinese fine dining restaurant at the 28th floor. Its pricey for that quality of food. However due to their possession of a wine preserver that can store opened wine fresh upto 21 days we can select quite a few wines by the glass.There is a Sommerlier who could suggest the wine combinations. That was nice. Next there is a simple lounge bar near the lobby to chill out. I ordered for couple of cocktails which were not bad & the tapas side dish choices were good. Then there is 'The Market' which has a plethora of dishes to choose from. I went there once and also ordered from them another time through room service. Good choice of food. I liked the Malaysian lamb satay & the Indian chicken curry. The staff are a little overwhelming but and a little more professional experience is needed. The hotel shuttle bus has a drop at i-SQUARE a mall in Tsim Sha Tsui. This is a better option compared to the 10-12 minute walk to Hung Hom or East Tsim Sha Tsui metro. One could take this shuttle bus and get dropped at iSQUARE & take the metro from Tsim Sha Tsui. The staff cud have recommended this instead. Because its another 10 minute walk (unpaid subway) from East Tsim Sha Tsui to Tsim Sha Tsui metro station. I am not against walking but when it drizzles or too humid I feel the guests would be happier with the smarter option than the walk.

Reviews.Title: “astonishing design, finding green in the middle of concrete jungle”
Reviews.Author: TKTan
Reviews.Content: Despite of the room is indulged with artful and yet full of state of the art, high tech design, it has the sense of green as well. There are 2 greens visitors can find. The green refreshing vertical garden right in front of the front desk, and the light sensors that automatically turn of electricity of the room, when there is no motion in the room for certain minutes. The harbour view from hotel room was just magnificent and i dont find myself mis-spending my money. Hotel Icon is a new hotel, but the experience management team will help solve your needs whenever you have any!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding new hotel- beautifully designed and highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: tgrotzmd
Reviews.Content: If you are used to 5 stars and impeccable design, comfort and excellent customer service- Hotel Icon is not to be missed! My family of 3 had a wonderful 6 nights stay in the Club 80 suite that had a fabulous harbor view. Everyone including the front door greeters, check in staff, executive floor team, servers and even the pastry chef consistently did their best in terms of customer service skills. The staff made sure our every need was met! The pool, fitness facility and locker rooms were a pleasure to use. Every amenity available! We still can't get over how beautiful our room was and how quiet in such a noisy city like Hong Kong! Kudos to the general manager Mr. Richard Hatter and his team!

Reviews.Title: “New shining star on the HK hotel scene!!!”
Reviews.Author: nadzak
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the new Hotel icon during the ‘soft opening’ period last week. The hotel is wonderful with big rooms compared to HK standards. I checked in to one of the regular rooms and found it to be spacious and well laid out. After a few days in China, upon my return to HK I was upgraded to a suite and it had everything I could have wanted, and more! Well planned and extremely comfortable with amazing views of HK from the 22nd floor! The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. The “Above & Beyond” lounge is a nice oasis after a busy day in the HK heat, with great staff! Great amenities with restaurant choices, gym, pool, and a yet-to-be-opened spa. Although located in TST East, there is a shuttle bus that stops at 4 points throughout TST, and the hotel is an easy walk to the MTR subway. This will become my HK address whenever I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: JKDM14
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent new hotel in Kowloon which was going through a soft launch when we stayed. We stayed in one of the Above & Beyond rooms on the 25th floor which overlooked the Harbour, it was just spectacular. The rooms were very well equipped, my husband particularly liked the coffee machine and the bathroom was wonderful. The service from all of the staff was great, nothing was too much trouble. Angie Lo in particular went out of her way to ensure we had information and timetables for everything we wanted to visit. The benefits which come with the Above & Beyond rooms, including the club on the 29th floor, breakfast, high tea & cocktails makes it very worthwhile along with the personal check in and check out. I will certainly be booking in again when I return with work in August.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service, Promising Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kim0404
Reviews.Content: I have stay here the day after their opening with my husband. The moment you step inside the hotel you will be greeted by courteous smiling staff. The check in was a bit slow I think due to the new system. The room was big and spacious! We had the harbour view room and it has a fantastic view of the Victoria harbor at night. The Bed is of top quality, its soft but offers great support so our sleep was excellent. The bathroom is very nice. a deep soak tub with separate walk in rain shower. One thing I would recommend though is that they should have made the walk-in shower have a door , even a sliding glass so that it can be close and water wont get out. The floor in the bedroom was all wood, I would have preferred if it was carpeted, and there was no magazines. But the staff was excellent. My Husband got sick on the last day and i went out to buy medicines, one of the floor manager greeted me on the lift and we chit chatted and they were very kind enough to offer us a late check out free of charge since our flight was not till late in the evening and they sent a get well card along with a plate of fruits to our room. Most of the facilities aren't available yet. We were invited to the above and beyond floor by the club floor manager to have a little talk about our whole stay and what think of the hotel. It was a pleasant chat. Location: I love the location of the hotel! It is near the " bar street" where lines of open bars are open till late night, loads of restaurants near by to choose from, shopping centers, electronic shops and it is just a walk to the avenue of stars but the hotel it self is not in the middle of all this so you don't have to worry about street noise or loads of people outside the hotel. I say that this hotel is promising because Im sure when they are fully open it would be a five star experience for the guests with their spacious comfortable room, wonderful location and excellent staff and great facilities to look forward to...

Reviews.Title: “Different in standard and confusion in Club Level”
Reviews.Author: Jasontan65
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there 18/5-24/5 2011 for six nights at Club 38 Harbour View. Day of check-in,was very friendly and feel welcomed at Level 28 (Above & Beyond) with both Angie and Winnie (very sincere and eager to help) Breakfast at The Market was indeed nice (very prompt service), the pastry chef even remember to serve us Croissant for consecutive 5 days without us asking when on day one -my companion commented that the croissant taste nice and fresh. Special mention have to be given to CK, Charles and Chris@The Market (they will chat you up) and provide insight of the hotel! Here comes the Club floor, first two nights were good but subsequently was bad to worse! There seems to be confusion here and we have to keep telling them we have been booked on the Club Floor and here for the complimentary drinks. Each night, we have to check whether non-alcholic drinks are complimentary until 11pm. Even it was clearly stated in our welcome letter! We have given up after those not so nice experience (thinking we were some unwelcomed intruders). They can simply checked our room number and know for once we were booked on Club Floor and should be entiltled to those benefits. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and service is good except for the difference in standard between the Club and The Market. Would recommend this hotel but think twice about booking the Club Floor unless they have sort out the confusion.

Reviews.Title: “A New Icon in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Punamdemanny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Icon during the soft opening phase in March and were very impressed by the service, food quality and rooms. The contemporary interior design emphasised the quality of materials and amenities in the rooms and outlets. We particularly liked the bathroom, which was well stocked with every amenity you could think of (hair dryer for ladies!) and the separte rain shower. My larger-than-life husband loved the deep bath tub - finally a something in which he could actually soak! The highlight of our stay was the meal in the Chinese fine dining restaurant on the top floor. The food was exquisite, the service was attentive and the view was breathtaking. Book in advance for a table overlooking the harbour - it's well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but shady marketing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Partner traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel put up false advertisement to deceive travelers. Listing amenities on the ads as hotel features that's not even available. I should have done more research before booking.

Reviews.Title: “True Icon in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Joegozz
Reviews.Content: Having traveled to Hong Kong more than a dozen times, I just experienced my best stay ever at the Icon Hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Hong Kong as the hotel and location is excellent. It is close to both the train and metro station and anything else in Kowloon. I was staying at another hotel and was told about the Icon from a colleague. I walked over and was given an extensive tour from one of the staff that was very informative. I checked into the Icon the next day, it was a great decision on the move to the Icon. While it is still in its "soft opening" stage it is excellent and the staff go out of their way to make you feel relaxed and comfortable. I stayed in an Above & Beyond Club 65 Room and the view and furnishings are very good with a rain shower and deep soaker bath tub. You will appreciate all the free benefits and extras and the great staff at the Above & Beyond club program as the extra cost is well worth the Club experience. The view and club lounge on the 29thfloor are great as are the bar and Chinese restaurant. I look forward to staying again and I will be staying at the Icon for all my future trips to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the heart of Huzzle & Buzzle”
Reviews.Author: GardenHongKong
Reviews.Content: The ICON Hotel, to me, offers an unqui and unforgettable experience. You are in one of the busiest corner in Hong Kong with thousands of cars going past funnelling into the tunnel, however when you are relexing in the lobby lounge watching the traffic goes by, you feels like sitting in an open garden, totally relaxed, smelling the freshness of the vegitations and the moisture in the air. Where some other hotels may also offer a gradn view of the Victoria Harbour, but nothing like the manificent view sitting in the Up and Above lounge, enjoying the nice wines and Chinese cuisine. To be, the above along, is worth staying at the ICON Hotel, not to mention the hospitality of the staff, with smiles coming from the heart.

Reviews.Title: “A room like the Starship Enterprise.”
Reviews.Author: lobbydosserHongKong
Reviews.Content: I spent 24 hours in the hotel during its soft pre-opening phase. My room, a standard Single, was like something out of a science fiction movie. From the modernistic office chair in front of the long desk to the largescreen interactive TV on the wall above, to the truly amazing communications module (telephone) I could have sat there for hours just playing with the gadgets. The shower is simply the best I have ever encountered. The super-large overhead shower head is a delight to use and the overall design of the shower area gave a very luxurious feel to the whole experience. I had dinner in the Chinese restaurant , which was simply excellent. The food was unusual; Cantonese but with a Western touch. Yum Yum. The lifts (elevators) were a bit slow but perhaps these can be tuned with more experience. The staff were excellent. All seemed to be young and very enthusiastic. I enjoyed my stay immensely. I will use this hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel ICON
HotelInfo.Address: No.17 Science Museum Road, Tsim Sha Tsui East, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
